title: Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
Position Overview: 



As the Executive Assistant to the CEO, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth and efficient functioning of the executive office. Your primary responsibility will be to provide comprehensive administrative support to the CEO, managing their schedule, and coordinating various tasks to enhance productivity. Your ability to maintain confidentiality, exercise sound judgment, and proactively handle administrative duties will contribute to the overall effectiveness of the CEO's office. 



 

Pay Range: $7 per hour with a performance review scheduled after 90 days of employment. We believe in rewarding exceptional talents. 



 

About Power Plus Systems: 



Power Plus Systems LLC has been a dominant force in the residential electrical contracting industry for two decades, and we continue to lead the way. Our vision is to successfully wire 28,000 homes to completion by the year 2029, ensuring safe and efficient electrical solutions, thereby making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. At Power Plus Systems, LLC, a position with us isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to grow and develop within a company that genuinely appreciates your contributions and dedication to our shared mission. 



 

Objectives: 

• Manage and organize the CEO's daily schedule, including meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.

• Act as a gatekeeper, screening and prioritizing communications to the CEO.

• Coordinate and facilitate communication between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders.

• Anticipate the CEO's needs and proactively handle tasks to ensure optimal time management.

• Coordinate special projects and initiatives as assigned by the CEO.



 

Competencies: 

• Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills, with keen attention to detail.

• Strong written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion in handling sensitive information.

• Proficient in using Microsoft Office and Google Suites.

• Familiarity with scheduling software; experience with additional productivity tools is an advantage.

• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively with individuals at all levels.

• Proactive problem solver and resourceful thinker.



 

Equipment Requirements:  

• Must own a reliable computer or laptop capable of handling administrative tasks efficiently.

• Must own and actively use an iPhone and/or MacBook or Mac computer for efficient communication and task management.

• High-speed internet connection to support video calls, cloud-based collaboration, and remote work.



 

Physical Requirements: 

• Extended periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

 

Benefits: 

• Growth opportunities in a well-established company.

• Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.

• Opportunity for advancement within the company.

• A supportive and collaborative work environment.

• Company-observed paid United States holidays (full time).

• Paid vacation.





How to Apply: 



If you are ready to join Power Plus Systems, LLC, a well-established residential electrical contractor that values its tea
mbers and offers excellent benefits, please submit your application through the link below. 




/internationalcareers



Power Plus Systems, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply. 



Join us at Power Plus Systems, LLC, and be part of our continued success as we embark on the next 20 years of excellence in residential electrical contracting!

title: Workflow Engineer
description:
Workflow Engineer





Overview

We are looking for a Workflow Engineer to design, implement, and maintain the software systems that support our operations. This role focuses on improving productivity through better tools, smarter configurations, and clear, well-functioning workflows. You will collaborate with leadership and tea
mbers to understand needs, eliminate inefficiencies, and create systems that scale as the company grows.



Key Responsibilities



Software and Systems Analysis



• Audit all current software platforms and identify gaps, redundancies, and inefficiencies

• Evaluate team workflows to determine where tools are underutilized or misaligned

• Create clear recommendations for improvement based on business needs



Tool Selection and Implementation



• Research and recommend new tools that increase operational productivity

• Lead the setup and configuration of new software

• Build integrations between platforms to reduce manual steps and prevent errors

• Configure automations, workflows, access controls, and permissions



Workflow Optimization



• Translate existing business processes into streamlined digital workflows

• Build systems that support repeatable, scalable operations

• Document configurations and workflow logic for ongoing reference



Team Training and Adoption



• Train tea
mbers on new tools, workflows, and best practices

• Provide clear guidance to ensure proper usage of software across roles

• Create reference materials that support strong adoption and reduce knowledge gaps



Continuous Improvement



• Monitor system performance and user behavior to identify improvement opportunities

• Adjust workflows as business needs evolve

• Stay current on new features, emerging tools, and best practices in workflow automation



What Success Looks Like



• Teams use software consistently and correctly

• Manual tasks are reduced through well-designed automations

• Workflows run smoothly with fewer errors, delays, or handoff issues

• The company operates with clear, documented systems that scale cleanly

• Tools support growth rather than slow it down



Qualifications



• Experience configuring or administering business software systems

• Strong understanding of workflow design, automation, and integration concepts

• Ability to evaluate tools and match them to operational needs

• Comfortable learning new platforms quickly

• Strong communication skills and the ability to explain technical concepts clearly

• Proven ability to collaborate across departments



Preferred Skills



• Experience with workflow or automation tools such as Zapier, Make, Power Automate, or similar

• Familiarity with project management or operations platforms such as ClickUp, Monday, or Asana

• Ability to map processes visually using flowchart tools

• Strong problem solving and systems thinking ability



Ideal Candidate Traits



• Enjoys building order from complexity

• Curious and resourceful in finding the best tools for the job

• Strong attention to detail and quality

• Comfortable running training sessions and supporting user adoption

• Thinks in systems and understands how tools and people interact

title: Manager, Operations Analytics & Systems
description:
Manager, Operations Analytics & Systems





Role Overview

This role is responsible for overseeing the company’s analytics, systems, and workflow functions as a unified operational capability. The Manager ensures that data, tools, and processes are aligned, scalable, and designed to support efficient decision-making across the organization.



 



This position manages technical and analytical tea
mbers, sets standards, defines priorities, and acts as the connective layer between leadership, operations, and execution teams. As the organization grows, this role expands naturally to oversee additional analytics, systems, or process-oriented roles.



 



Core Responsibilities



Team Leadership and Direction

Manage and mentor analysts, engineers, and systems-focused tea
mbers

Set priorities, timelines, and deliverables across analytics and systems work

Ensure clear ownership, accountability, and quality across all outputs

Review work for accuracy, usability, and alignment with business objectives

Analytics and Reporting Oversight

Own the company’s operational and workforce reporting strategy

Define and maintain standard metrics, definitions, and source-of-truth logic

Ensure dashboards and reports are actionable, consistent, and trusted

Translate leadership questions into structured analytical workstreams

Validate assumptions, calculations, and interpretations before distribution

Systems and Workflow Governance

Oversee the design and evolution of internal systems and workflows

Ensure tools are configured intentionally and work well together

Approve major workflow changes, automations, and integrations

Maintain consistency in how data flows across platforms

Prevent tool sprawl and fragmented processes

Cross Functional Alignment

Serve as the bridge between leadership, operations, analytics, and technical teams

Gather requirements and convert them into clear execution plans

Ensure insights from analytics are reflected in system or workflow changes

Support stakeholders in understanding and using tools and reports effectively



Documentation and Standards



 



Ensure documentation exists for systems, workflows, and reporting assets



 



Establish standards for naming, access, permissions, and maintenance



 



Reduce reliance on institutional knowledge held by individuals



 



Continuous Improvement and Scale



 



Identify recurring inefficiencies across tools, data, and workflows



 



Drive ongoing improvements based on usage patterns and feedback



 



Prepare systems and analytics functions to scale as the organization grows



 



Support onboarding of future roles within analytics, systems, or operations



 



What Success Looks Like



 



Leadership consistently relies on reporting and systems for decisions



 



Metrics are clearly defined and universally understood



 



Tools and workflows reduce manual effort and operational friction



 



Analytics insights translate into concrete operational actions



 



The organization scales without breaking processes or visibility



 



Qualifications

title: Systems Coordinator
description:
Position Overview:  



The Systems Coordinator is responsible for creating, managing, and troubleshooting automation workflows in GoHighLevel (GHL) to support efficient operations across the company. This role requires at least one year of hands-on experience in GHL or a similar automation platform, along with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. In addition to system automation, this person will assist the Admin Operations Team with various ad hoc tasks and continuously seek opportunities to optimize workflows, eliminate inefficiencies, and enhance team productivity. 



 



Pay Range: $8 per hourwith a performance review scheduled after 90 days of employment. We believe in rewarding exceptional talents. 



 



About Power Plus Systems: 



Power Plus Systems, LLC has been a dominant force in the residential electrical contracting industry for two decades, and we continue to lead the way. Our vision is to successfully wire 28,000 homes to completion by the year 2029, ensuring safe and efficient electrical solutions, thereby making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. At Power Plus Systems, LLC, a position with us isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to grow and develop within a company that genuinely appreciates your contributions and dedication to our shared mission. 



 



Objectives: 



Build, maintain, and troubleshoot automation workflows in GoHighLevel to support streamlined operations. 



Monitor performance of active automations to ensure accuracy, functionality, and timely resolution of system issues. 



Work closely with the Operations Manager to understand workflow needs and translate them into effective and efficient automations, while coordinating with Admin Operations and other departments as needed. 



Identify inefficiencies in current processes and proactively recommend workflow improvements. 



Assist the Admin Operations Team with various administrative and operational tasks, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations. 



Troubleshoot and resolve Admin Operations Help Tickets with a customer-service–focused approach. 



Manage and update pipelines, triggers, automations, forms, and integrations as needed. 



Ensure all GHL data, workflows, and configurations are maintained accurately and consistently. 



 



Competencies: 



Strong understanding of automation logic, workflows, and pipeline management. 



High attention to detail to ensure accurate configuration and troubleshooting of automation sequences. 



Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to identify system gaps and propose solutions. 



Strong written and verbal communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. 



Proficiency in GoHighLevel or similar automation platforms (HubSpot, Zapier, Make, Zoho, ActiveCampaign, etc.). 



Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. 



Proactive mindset with a drive for continuous improvement. 



Customer service orientation when supporting internal stakeholders. 



 



Equipment Requirements: 



Must own a reliable computer or laptop capable of handling administrative tasks efficiently. 



High-speed internet connection to support video calls, cloud-based collaboration, and remote work. 



 



Education and Experience: 



At least one year of hands-on experience with GoHighLevel or similar automation platforms. 



Experience in operations, administrative support, or systems management is a plus. 



Familiarity with CRM logic, automation mapping, or workflow design is strongly preferred. 



 



Physical Requirements: 



Extended periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. 



 



Benefits: 



Growth opportunities in a well-established company. 



Ongoing training and professional development opportunities. 



Opportunity for advancement within the company. 



A supportive and collaborative work environment. 



Company-observed paid United States holidays (full time). 



Paid vacation. 



 



How to Apply: 



If you are ready to join Power Plus Systems, LLC, a well-established residential electrical contractor that values its tea
mbers and offers excellent benefits, please submit your application through the link below. 




/internationalform 



Power Plus Systems, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply. 



Join us at Power Plus Systems, LLC, and be part of our continued success as we embark on the next 20 years of excellence in residential electrical contracting!

title: AI Tools Hacking / Analyst: Hiring Screening (White Hat / Red Hat)
description:
Book directly in to game the group screening interview here: 



About the Role



We're looking for a sharp thinker to join our team. Your job is to think like a cheater - and then build systems that stop them. As our screening platform is used by many candidates, a growing number are leveraging AI tools to attempt to game the process. While we catch most already, you'll be on the front lines of detecting, analyzing, and countering this behavior.



This is a hybrid white hat / red hat role: you'll actively attempt to defeat your own screening form, then design defenses and detection mechanisms to prevent it.





What You'll Do



- Attempt to bypass screening questions using the latest tools to identify vulnerabilities 

- Analyze submission patterns, response quality, and behavioral signals to build detection heuristics for AI-generated answers

- Stay current on emerging AI capabilities and prompt engineering techniques to anticipate new attack vectors

- Produce internal reports on AI evasion trends and recommended countermeasures

- Admin and general assistant duties alongside, data entry may also be required, the role will evolve with your skills





What You Bring



- Hands-on experience with AI tools and an understanding of how they can be prompted to produce convincing, human-like answers

- A methodical, adversarial mindset - you naturally look for holes in systems

- Background in HR tech, trust & safety, content integrity, or cybersecurity is a strong plus

- Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders





Nice to Have



- Experience with prompt injection, jailbreaking, or red teaming LLMs

- Familiarity with NLP-based AI detection tools

- Prior work in hiring, recruiting, or HR operations





Why This Role Matters



Hiring decisions shape organizations. When candidates misrepresent themselves using AI, companies make bad hires, and qualified, honest candidates lose out. You'll be protecting the integrity of the hiring process at scale.



Our hiring process looks to connect with the real person and design roles with dignity for who they actually are, and the skills they genuinely possess - especially those skills that they may not even be aware of in themselves.



When candidates use AI, we don't get to create roles that fit them, and they are less likely to get jobs that they love.

title: Entry-Level Healthcare Virtual Assistant (full/part-time)
description:
APPLICATION PROCESS:

1.Email us your resume in PDF format only. Include all of the jobs you've worked at and the month + year. Do not leave anything off. Do not leave anything off.  You must provide an explanation of any gaps in your work history. Include the compensation you received for each job. Do not give us your hourly pay, only your annual compensation or total compensation.  If there is any gap in your resume without an explanation of the gap, you will be disqualified.



2. Email us a 60-second video of yourself answering the following question:

What are the 3 most important things that the company you work for MUST do to show you that they care about you? For example, if they don’t give me these 3 things then that means they don’t care about me. The video CANNOT EXCEED 60 seconds, or you will automatically be disqualified.



3. IMPORTANT: Please Email us at accounts(@)achieveih.com. Failure to follow the above instructions will result in automatic disqualifications.  Do not DM us or call us or contact us in any other way.



ABOUT OUR COMPANY:

Achieve Integrative Health is the #1 rated Acupuncture & Wellness Clinic in the United States with over 750 five star google reviews. Our Mission is to help people restore their body’s God given ability to heal itself so that they can do what they love. Our vision is to equip and inspire one million people around the world to do what they love, when they want, with whom they want. 



WHY JOIN US?

• You’ll Achieve your Goals = our team provides all of the resources (information, training, opportunities) you’ll need to achieve all of your Professional, Financial and Personal Goals, as long as you are willing to put in the work and deliver results.



• Peace and Joy Team = we have a phenomenal culture of care for our patients and our team members. We are very strict with our rules, policies and core values in order to protect our culture of peace and joy.  Imagine being on a team where you don’t have to deal with people who talk behind your back and end up back stabbing you.



• Be Highly Rewarded as a Side Benefit = imagine being able to do your Passion everyday and make a phenomenal living as a side benefit. The average "experienced" VAs in the Philippines/Indonesia make $5-$7 USD/hr, our entry-level VAs start off making $5/hr. We have a quarterly bonus program, where some of our team members have earned $500-$1,000USD per quarter, and this year 2025, because the team has performed so well, some team members were paid an 'additional' year end bonus of $2000-$3000 USD.



BENEFITS

• Competitive Total Compensation = $5-$12 USD/hr for graveyard shift only.

• Unlimited Opportunities for Growth = as long as you can generate more results for the company we will never limit your ability to grow within our company. Every team member can also become a partner of the business if they desire.

• Other Benefits for qualified team members = paid-time off, premium medical insurance, Employee Savings Matching Program

• Work from Home = no more 2-4 hour commutes to work

• Wellness Initiatives = benefit from complimentary virtual health services from our medical providers, ensuring your well-being and your family’s well-being is always a priority.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

• Receive all inbound calls to close Leads wanting to receive treatments at our clinic

• Call, email, and use various communication forms to identify the validity and potential of the lead

• Receive all inbound calls to answer questions – fact find and qualify lead/route to appropriate team members

• Work with patients to ensure they are satisfied with the services provided

• Encourage happy patients to send us their success stories

• Share patient success stories during daily company meeting

• Implement our CARE system to follow-up with our patients to provide 5 star service

• Check-in and checkout patients

• Verify Insurance Benefits

• Other additional tasks may be added based on your strengths…



CHARACTER REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS

• You must truly have a caring heart and truly want to help people improve their health, if you are mainly focused on how much money you can make, we are not the team for you

• You must speak Fluent English (ie. someone on the phone can understand what you're saying w/o straining)

• You must be organized and be able to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities everyday. If you’re looking to only do one or two tasks per day, we are the wrong team for you.

• You must be able to follow instructions exactly as written, if you don’t like reading or following instructions, we are not the right team for you

• You must have a good heart. If you like to gossip behind peoples back, please don’t apply.

• You must value Results over effort. If you like to be paid based on how many tasks you completed or how much responsibilities you have, we are not the team for you. We pay ONLY based on you meeting your KPIs, metrics, quotas.

• You must sleep the same schedule 7 days a week, as this is a graveyard shift, you cannot switch back to the Philippines/Indonesian time zone on the weekends as this destroys your health. Your Health is our priority, and if you don’t value your own health we don’t want you on our team.

• You must be honest and have integrity. If you are caught lying, you will be immediately terminated.

• You must want to EARN your pay (ie. base salary + bonuses) instead of being given a pay (ie. focused only on base salary) that you didn’t earn.



WORKSTATION REQUIREMENTS

• You must have a separate quiet room to work in. You can not have your children or anybody else in the room that you work as your screen will be displaying confidential information, no exceptions.

• There can not be any background noise in your room when you are making phone calls.

• You will be required to provide photos of your workspace

• We will also randomly ask you to show your workspace via your webcam, and if you are caught lying you will be fired immediately.



COMPUTER AND INTERNET REQUIREMENTS:

• Fast and reliable wired internet connection of not less than 100 Mbps

• Secondary and Tertiary Back up Internet of not less than 10 Mbps

• At least one Power Station Backup

• Dual Monitor

• Intel Core i3 or higher Operating System with at least 8gb RAM

• Excellent quality headset with microphone, and a working webcam



WORK SCHEDULE:

OPTION 1 > Full-time 8:00 - 18:00 (M-Th) 8:00-16:00 (F) U.S. Central Standard Time, 2-hr lunch breaks 

OPTION 2 > Part-time 7:00-13:00 (M-F) U.S. Central Standard Time 

OPTION 3 > Part-time 13:00-18:30 (M-F) U.S. Central Standard Time

Turn videos into multiple variations and frames for testing



Improve outputs until they feel real and natural



Brainstorm hooks and creative angles with the team



Follow simple brand guidelines

title: Senior Data / Business Analyst
description:
Specialty Capital is a data-driven alternative finance company delivering fast, flexible capital to small and mid-sized businesses. We operate at the intersection of underwriting, risk, and technology—leveraging data and machine learning to make smarter funding decisions while responsibly managing credit and fraud risk. As we scale, we are building a best-in-class internal data and AI capability to power the next phase of growth. This role will be central to that transformation.



The Mission:



Elevate analytics from reactive reporting to proactive, decision-driving insight. This role serves as a primary business partner across Sales, Underwriting, Risk, and Operations—translating ambiguous questions into structured analysis, trusted metrics, and actionable recommendations. You will help shape how the company defines performance, measures success, and identifies opportunities for growth and risk mitigation.



What You’ll Do:



1. Own Business Questions End-to-End

Take high-level objectives (e.g., “Why is conversion dropping in California?”) and independently structure the analysis.

Define data sources, assumptions, logic, and methodology without requiring step-by-step direction.

Synthesize findings into clear recommendations—not just analysis.



2. Build Scalable, Decision-Ready Reporting

Design, build, and maintain intuitive, high-impact dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or similar BI tools.

Define and evolve core KPIs across funding volume, funnel conversion, underwriting efficiency, and collections performance.

Ensure reporting is actionable, reliable, and tightly aligned with business outcomes.



3. Strengthen Data Integrity & Governance

Support and reinforce a trusted “single source of truth” across the organization.

Proactively detect data quality issues, metric inconsistencies, and KPI drift before they impact stakeholders.

Partner with engineering and business teams to diagnose root causes—not just patch symptoms.



4. Act as a Strategic Thought Partner

Provide structured insights that influence pricing, risk strategy, channel performance, and operational efficiency.

Challenge assumptions and bring analytical rigor to leadership discussions.

Help shape the evolution of our internal data science and analytics roadmap.



Who You Are:



Self-Directed & Structured

- You prefer owning outcomes, not waiting for instructions. You bring clarity to ambiguity and structure to loosely defined problems.



Business-Minded Analyst

- You don’t just analyze data—you connect it to revenue, risk, and operational impact.



Clear Communicator

- You translate complex analyses into crisp, business-relevant insights for non-technical stakeholders, including Sales, Underwriting, Operations, and executive leadership.



Technically Strong

- Advanced SQL (complex joins, window functions, performance optimization).

- Strong experience with Tableau, Power BI, or comparable BI tools.

- Working knowledge of Python for automation, validation, or deeper analytical work.

- Comfort working with large, imperfect datasets in fast-moving environments.



What Success Looks Like (6–12 Months)

- Leadership trusts your dashboards as the authoritative source of truth.

- Business teams proactively seek your input before making decisions.

- Core KPIs are clearly defined, consistently measured, and aligned across departments.

- Analytical insights directly influence revenue growth, credit performance, or operational efficiency.



Why Join Us

- Direct exposure to executive leadership and strategic decisions.

- High ownership and autonomy in a scaling data-driven company.

- Opportunity to help build a modern analytics and AI foundation from the ground up.

- Meaningful impact at the intersection of finance, risk, and technology.



Benefits:

- Opportunities for promotion

- Paid training

- Promotion to permanent employee

-Work from home



Experience:

- Related work: 3 years (Required)



Work Location: Remote

title: Video Editor & Graphic Designer
description:

Create scroll-stopping content for a scaling DTC brand. We need a performance-focused video editor who can turn raw footage into high-converting ads and social content - with creative freedom and direct feedback loops on what's working.



About Uproot Clean



Uproot Clean is a fast-growing, eco-friendly pet care brand expanding across major retailers like Walmart, Target, and Chewy. eting on Thursdays at 10:00 AM EST

Ready to Apply?

title: Digital Marketing Account Manager
description:
About DigiSolve: We are a dynamic and rapidly growing US-based digital marketing agency specializing in providing tailored solutions for dermatologists, plastic surgeons, and other medical businesses. Our mission is to elevate our clients' online presence and drive meaningful results through strategic and data-driven digital marketing campaigns.



Job Overview: We are now hiring a Client-Facing Account Manager to own client relationships and act as the buffer between clients and fulfillment teams. As the liaison between our external clients and internal service teams, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the seamless execution of digital marketing campaigns.



Responsibilities:



The Role (Read This Carefully)



- This is not a VA role.

- This is not task execution.

- This is not “take notes and pass messages.”



You will:



- Own client communication

- Lead weekly/monthly client calls

- Set expectations and enforce scope

- Translate client input into clear, actionable direction for fulfillment teams

- D
 what feedback matters — and what does not get passed downstream

- Your job is to keep clients confident and calm without dragging the fulfillment team (or the founder) into unnecessary noise.



Core Responsibilities:



Client Ownership

- Act as the primary point of contact for assigned clients

- Lead client calls with confidence and structure

- Provide clear updates, context, and framing around performance

- Push back professionally when requests are out of scope or misaligned



Internal Leadership

- Translate client goals into clear, pre-approved tasks for fulfillment teams

- Filter and synthesize feedback (not all client input gets passed through)

- Ensure deliverables are aligned with agreed scope and timelines



Strategy & Judgment:

- Understand DigiSolve’s service offerings and boundaries

- Identify when a client concern is: a real issue, a misunderstanding, or simply noise

- Escalate strategically — not emotionally



Problem-Solving

- Handle client concerns calmly and proactively

- Resolve issues before they become “fires”

- Maintain trust even when results take time



Who This Role Is For



You are a strong fit if you:

- Have 2+ years experience as an Account Manager, Client Success Manager, or Senior AM at a marketing agency

- Are comfortable leading conversations, not just supporting them

- Can say “no” or “that’s out of scope” professionally

- Think in systems, not just tasks

- Are calm under pressure and don’t personalize client emotions



This Role Is NOT For You If

- You prefer to avoid difficult conversations

- You need constant direction

- You see your job as “passing messages”

- You are uncomfortable pushing back on clients

- You expect the founder to stay heavily involved in every decision



Work Setup & Compensation

- Full-time, remote (Philippines-based)

- Approx. 40+ hours per week

- ~$800, depending on experience



Opportunity for increased responsibility and pay after 90+ days



How to Apply



Please
:

- Your resume

- A short cover letter answering:

“Tell us about a time you had to push back on a client — what happened and how did you handle it?”



Send to: 



Final Note



This role exists to remove mental load from the founder and create a more scalable, professional agency.



If you’re excited by ownership, judgment, and responsibility — we want to hear from you.

title: VA needed -Marketing Strategist- Full Time, WFH, US Hours
description:
Hello there, awesome VA!



I'm the owner of a small IT company (9 employees- 3 in the Philippines and 6 in the US/ Costa Rica). We're based in Arizona, USA. We provide IT services to small businesses, cybersecurity, and cloud services as well.



We have 3 amazing VAs already, but we're getting busier, and we can use your help...



SOME OF THE EXPECTATIONS YOU SHOULD HAVE WHEN WORKING WITH US:

• Paid vacations- it's important to us that you are happy, healthy, and have a work-life balance!

• Bonuses- when we win, you win!

• Raises- As we grow, we believe you should as well. We have to stay competitive as an employer to retain our awesome employees!

mbers to stay ahead of the technology curve. Help you continually sharpen your skills with a focus on your career aspirations.

• Paid sick days- We understand life happens. We don't want you to feel that you have to drag yourself to work sick, if your body tells you to relax...



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



Note: While it seems like a LOT is included here, I prefer to list everything I can think of now to avoid major surprises. These tasks are currently handled by our virtual assistants. You will receive training and support to ensure you are comfortable with each responsibility.



Your MAIN responsibilities:

You’ll work closely with the CEO to build marketing systems that help attract leads, increase engagement, and support growth. You’ll need to follow the brand’s voice, work quickly, and focus on the results that matter.

 marketing tools like Glasshive, Eventbrite, and other tools for marketing campaigns and assisting with event coordination, venues, guest speakers, and attendees.

• Basic lead generation using Apollo & LinkedIn



OTHER tasks that you can assist with:



• Provide
/call/chat support for inquiries, coordinate information with both clients and company employees (This is NOT a tech support job, but you will assist with coordinating service calls and meetings with clients and vendors)

• Calendar management

• Coordinate courier pickups and deliveries.

• Assist with basic internal audits, documentation, and file management

• Post jobs, candidate screening, review and respond to applications, scheduling interviews, and interview with applicants when needed.

• Assist with projects as needed



WORK HOURS:

• Mon-Fri at 8am-5:30pm (Arizona time zone- MST -7)

• Paid (US) holidays, time-off



REQUIRED:

• AMAZING personality and work ethic

• Excellent written and verbal English with minimal accent

• At least 3-5 years of experience as a Marketing Strategist or similar roles like Digital Marketing Manager, Marketing Analyst, Marketing Manager, Performance Marketing Manager, Growth Marketing Manager, Integrated Marketing Manager, or Digital Marketing Specialist.

• Experience in office applications such as Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams

• Experience with GPT-4, Claude, or similar AI tools

• Experience in Social Media Marketing, LinkedIn,
, YouTube Shorts

and
 marketing.

• Knowledgeable in Marketing Analytics

• Copywriting frameworks (PAS, AIDA, etc.)

• Experience in Canva, Notion, Cap Cut, Descript, social media management tools, and simple video editing

• Experience in Digital Marketing

• Metrics-driven content strategy and growth loops

• Experience with, and understanding of SEO

• Content Writing

• Technologically savvy

• Knowledge of ticketing systems is a bonus, but not required.

• Knowledgeable with basic data entry



MORE DETAILS:

• A PRE-EMPLOYMENT BACKGROUND CHECK is performed (on our expense). You must have a 100% clean background check. Please do not apply if you don't have a 100% clean background check.

• As part of this position requirement, you must have a computer that will be used exclusively for your work with us. This means we will be installing our security software on that computer, will remove admin rights from you, and monitor/ control it for security and compliance reasons. In return, we will pay you additional “rent” fees, on top of your salary, in the amount of several hundred dollars. Details about this “rental” will be discussed during your second interview. There are minimum requirements that your computer must have in order to be employed with us. You must have a Computer/Laptop with at least i5 minimum 9th gen processor (preferably a newer one) with 16 GB RAM or more, or Ryzen 5/7 (MUST include TPM support) as well as Windows 11 OS.

HOW TO APPLY?



Answer the questions below, or you may also send an

 with the subject line “MS-Feb2026” with your answers:

Only those who have followed the above instructions will be contacted within up to 2 business days with further instructions.

title: Enrollment Specialist Martial Consulting
description:
Enrollment Specialist (Lead Caller & Follow-Up)



Are you confident on the phone, relentless with follow-ups, and driven by results?



We're looking for a hungry, people-oriented Enrollment Specialist to join Martial Consulting, a fast-growing digital marketing agency that helps martial arts schools across North America fill their classes with new students.



Your job is simple but critical: get leads on the phone, book them into trial classes, and follow up until they show up. You are the voice that turns a cold lead into a student walking through the door. If you love talking to people, thrive on hitting targets, and don't take "no-shows" personally, this role was made for you.



IMPORTANT: Applying directly on this platform does NOT confirm your application.

To officially apply, you have two options:



Option 1: Copy and paste the link below directly into your browser and submit your application through our official form (includes a Loom video introduction):





Option 2: Simply reply to this job posting with the word "Apply" or send me a quick message saying you want to apply, and I will send you the application form.



Either way, you must complete the official application form to be considered.



What You'll Be Doing Every Day:



- Call and text new leads within minutes of them coming in

- Follow up with leads who haven't booked a trial class yet

- Call and re-engage no-shows to get them rescheduled

- Use proven call scripts to book trial classes for martial arts schools

- Double-dial leads to maximize contact rates

- Log every call, text, and outcome in our CRM (GoHighLevel)

- Send follow-up text sequences to unresponsive leads

- Track and report your daily call and booking numbers

- Maintain organized records of all lead interactions



Requirements:



- Fluent in English (written and spoken) with a clear, confident phone voice

- Comfortable making 50+ outbound calls per day

- Not afraid of rejection or cold-calling

- Experience in sales, telemarketing, appointment setting, or lead follow-up is a strong plus

- Quick learner who can follow scripts and adapt on the fly

- Familiar with CRMs and basic tech tools (Google Drive, Slack, Loom)

- Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace for calls



What You Get:



- $800/month starting salary (~46,000 PHP)

- Performance bonuses tied to booking and show-up rates

- Clear growth path within a rapidly scaling agency

- Full training provided, including scripts, call frameworks, and access to our internal training platform

- 100% remote role

- Be part of a small, high-performance team where your impact is felt immediately



This Role Is NOT for You If...



- You're uncomfortable picking up the phone and talking to strangers

- You give up after one or two call attempts

- You need someone looking over your shoulder to stay productive

- You take rejection personally

- You prefer behind-the-scenes work over direct communication



Apply Now If You're:



- A natural communicator who loves being on the phone

- Motivated by targets and results

- Ready to take full ownership of your call performance

- Looking to grow inside a fast-moving, high-energy team

- Excited to help real businesses get real customers through the door



To apply, either copy and paste the link below into your browser and submit your application directly:





Or simply reply to this posting with "Apply" and I'll send you the form.

title: Writer / Editor - Psychotech Ideas
description:
Book directly into the group screening interview here: 
/genre/decision-making-interviews



About the Writing / Editing Role



We're building a body of work at the intersection of psychology and technology - exploring how digital systems shape human behavior, cognition, identity, and wellbeing. We need a writer and editor who is genuinely fascinated by these ideas, capable of making complex concepts accessible and compelling, and who has a distinct voice of their own.



This isn't a content mill. We want someone who reads widely, thinks deeply, and has opinions. You'll research and write original pieces on topics like behavioral design, digital addiction, AI and the self, attention economics, neurotechnology, persuasion systems, and the ethics of mind-influencing tech. You'll also edit and sharpen the work of others, maintaining a consistent standard of intellectual rigor and readability across everything we publish.





What You'll Do



- Research, pitch, and write long-form and short-form pieces on psychotech themes

- Edit contributions from other writers, improving clarity, structure, and depth without losing their voice

- Stay current on developments in psychology, neuroscience, tech ethics, and human-computer interaction

- Help shape the editorial direction and tone of the publication

- Engage with reader responses and contribute to building a genuine intellectual community around the work





What We're Looking For



- A strong, distinctive writing voice - someone with a clear perspective, not just a facility with words

- Genuine curiosity about the psychological dimensions of technology, not just surface-level interest

- The ability to write rigorously without writing drily - you can hold complexity and remain readable

- Experience writing or editing in adjacent fields (tech, science, philosophy, culture) is valued

- Comfort working independently and taking ownership of your ideas from pitch to publication





On AI Use



Once you're part of the team, AI tools are fair game. Use them to research, brainstorm, draft, edit - whatever helps you do your best work. We're pragmatic about this.



The application is a different matter entirely.



We want to meet you - your actual voice, your real curiosity, your genuine perspective. And to be clear: that doesn't mean perfect English. Typos are fine. Imperfect grammar is fine. We're not screening for flawless prose - we're screening for a real person with real ideas. Some of the most interesting thinkers we've worked with write in their second or third language, or simply don't lose sleep over a missed comma. That's never been a problem.



What we can't work with is a response that could have been written by anyone - or no one. AI-generated applications tell us little about who you are or whether you'd actually thrive in this role.



We do screen applications for AI-generated content. If we detect it, we won't reach out, we won't explain why, and you'll have simply spent time on something that went nowhere. Save yourself the effort and just write as yourself.



The best applications we receive are the ones where we can tell there's a real person on the other side who genuinely has something to say and shares their personal views.

title: Social Media Manager
description:
Company Overview



We are a dynamic and rapidly growing travel company dedicated to providing unparalleled travel experiences across the diverse and enchanting continent of Europe. We are seeking a structured Social Media Manager to join our team and play a key role in shaping our online presence.



Position Overview



As the Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive social media strategy to enhance our brand visibility, engage our audience, and drive customer loyalty. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the growth of a vibrant company while immersing yourself in the wonders of European travel.



Responsibilities



Implement management’s social media strategy aligned with business goals and brand identity.



Create, schedule, and post social media content across various platforms, including but not limited to TikTok,
, Instagram, YouTube, and X.



Curate engaging, informative, and shareable content that highlights the beauty, culture, and experiences offered by the company.



Coordinate and review the creation of new content from a team of freelance content creators.



Daily engagement with followers across social media platforms to expand reach, impact, and generate sales.



Analyze social media metrics and assess the effectiveness of the strategy and content.



Regular alignment with the Social Media Ads Manager.



Stay up-to-date with social media platform changes and updates, implementing new features to enhance online presence.



Qualifications



Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role, preferably in the travel and tourism industry.

Strong understanding of social media platforms, algorithms, and best practices.

Exceptional writing, editing, and communication skills in English.

Good eye for detail and aesthetics.

Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and meet deadlines.

Highly structured and skilled at coordinating people and providing feedback.

Proven ability to create innovative and engaging video content is a plus but not required.



Requirements



Demonstrated success in growing and engaging social media audiences.

Passion for travel, culture, and the European experience.

Strong organizational and project management skills.

Proficiency in editing tools (e.g., CapCut) is a plus.



How to Apply



If you are enthusiastic about the world of travel, possess a creative flair, and have a proven track record in social media management, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume, a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience, relevant links to your social media profiles, and examples/portfolios of your work to

title: Creative Web & Media Specialist (WordPress, Adobe, AI)
description:
We are a U.S.-based digital marketing agency building websites and content for restaurants and local businesses. We’re hiring an internal Creative Web & Media Specialist to reduce the founder’s workload and help deliver high-quality work quickly.



This is an execution role first: website builds, design, and video editing.

No client interaction required.



What You’ll Do (Primary Work)



Build and update WordPress websites (Elementor required)



Create graphics using Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator



Create branded designs in Canva (when appropriate)



Edit short-form vertical videos (Reels, Ads, Shorts)



Implement basic on-page SEO and follow modern best practices



Add schema markup when needed (LocalBusiness, FAQ, Article, etc.)



Organize project files in Google Drive and follow clear folder systems



Use AI tools (ChatGPT and others) to speed up production without reducing quality



Prioritize tasks correctly and consistently hit deadlines (or finish early)



Required Skills



Strong WordPress + Elementor experience



Adobe Photoshop + Illustrator experience



Canva proficiency



Video editing experience (Premiere preferred, CapCut acceptable)



Basic understanding of SEO best practices + schema markup



Strong English communication



Very organized and detail-oriented



Able to follow instructions and deliver clean work on time



Work Structure



Start: 4–6 hours/day, Monday–Friday



Internal team only (no client calls)



Paid trial project required



Long-term role with performance-based pay increases



Compensation



$5–$8/hour depending on skill level and speed



How to Apply (Must Follow)



Send:



Your portfolio (WordPress + design + video samples)



A short note listing the AI tools you use for work



Include the word “EXECUTE” at the top of your application



Applicants who do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Non Attorney Sales Person
description:
Dragons are the **frontline of our growth**. You are the trusted guides who help potential clients understand:



* Why we are the right firm to represent them

* What the process looks like

* How retaining us can give them clarity, confidence, and peace of mind



You are not just selling legal services — you are helping people **build better lives**.



---



## ???? Performance Metrics (KPIs)



To align with our growth goals, every Dragon will be measured by:



1. **Consultations Scheduled ? Held**



   * Target: 90% of scheduled consultations attended.

2. **Consultations to Retainers** (conversion rate)



   * Target: 50–75% conversion.

3. **Follow-up Effectiveness**



   * Every potential client should receive **written + phone follow-up** within 24–48 hours.

4. **Revenue Generated per Dragon**



   * Individual and team sales tracked weekly.



---



## ???? Tools & Processes



* **Case Management System**: Every lead and consultation must be entered, tracked, and updated.

* **Lead Categorization**: Intake and Acquisitions Assistant will ensure leads are tagged correctly (Google Ads,
, Referral, Organic, etc.). Dragons must verify lead source in their reports.

* **Follow-ups**: Use templated
s + personal calls. Always close the loop.

* **Sales Scripts**: Updated scripts focus on **empathy, authority, and urgency**.



---



## ???? Expectations for Dragons



* Be the **trusted voice** for clients during a stressful life event.

* Use **compassion + authority** to position the firm as the solution.

* Stay disciplined with **daily reporting** (sales board updated every day).

* Work closely with Intake and Acquisitions Assistants to ensure smooth transitions.

title: Business Analyst / Project Delivery Manager
description:
We need a sharp, organized person who can take client requests, understand what they really mean, turn them into clear tasks, and drive delivery with our dev and QA teams. Your job is to keep projects moving, remove confusion, and make sure what we ship matches what was requested.



What You’ll Do



Review client requests 
, tickets, calls) and identify missing details

Ask the right follow-up questions to remove ambiguity (no guessing, no “we’ll figure it out later”)

Turn requests into clear requirements and tickets (acceptance criteria, edge cases, examples)

Break work into deliverable steps and keep scope under control

Coordinate with developers and QA to ensure the work is built, tested, and delivered correctly

Run day-to-day delivery: status updates, priorities, blockers, timelines, and handoffs

Make sure QA has what they need: test notes, expected results, and “what done looks like”

Confirm fixes with the client (or internal owner) and close the loop cleanly

Keep our tools clean and current (tickets updated, notes added, no ghost tasks)



Project Types You’ll Manage



Simple WordPress websites (content sites, small business sites, landing pages)

Shopify stores (theme work, apps, checkout flows, product/catalog updates)

Custom software development (web apps, integrations, internal tools, APIs)



What “Good” Looks Like (Success Metrics)



Fewer back-and-forth messages due to unclear requirements

Tickets have clear acceptance criteria and don’t get reopened for “not what we meant.”

Dev + QA always know what to work on next

Projects move forward weekly with visible progress

Clients feel informed, not surprised



Skills & Experience



Strong written English (you can write clear, simple requirements)

Great at asking clarifying questions without annoying people

Comfortable working with developers and QA daily

Can manage multiple projects without dropping balls

Understands basic web/software concepts (APIs, UI/UX basics, environments, bugs vs features)

Experience with project tools like Redmine, Jira, Trello, ClickUp, etc. (we currently use Redmine/OSTicket/HubStaff)



Nice to Have



Experience in an agency or outsourced delivery environment

Light QA background (writing test cases, reproducing bugs)

Familiar with hosting / WordPress / Shopify / custom web apps

Experience writing SOPs and improving processes



Work Style



Remote

Part-time to start. Full-time in the near future.

You’ll work with a distributed team across time zones (company operations on New York time)

You must be responsive during agreed working hours and proactive about follow-ups



Kindly attach your résumé when submitting your application.

title: Recruiter
description:
Our client is on a mission to redefine the way job seekers embark on their next career adventure. As a Reverse Recruiter, you will be at the heart of this transformation. This unique role is designed for someone who wants to make a significant impact on individuals' professional lives, by bridging the gap between talent and opportunity. You'll partner closely with job seekers, diving deep into their professional backgrounds, aspirations, and preferences to proactively identify and secure opportunities that resonate with their career goals. Your expertise will turn the traditional job search process on its head, creating a personalized, supportive journey for each candidate.





Key Responsibilities:

Foster strong relationships with job seekers, becoming their trusted advisor and advocate in the job market.

Leverage your understanding of the candidates’ skills and goals to identify and secure job opportunities that align with their aspirations.

Develop and maintain a dynamic pipeline of eligible job posts for your client.

Assess job postings to ensure they meet the clients criteria and potential for success.

Act as the primary point of contact for clients, offering guidance and answering questions throughout their job search journey.

Achieve daily targets relating to job postings and applications processed.



Qualifications:

A Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred, showcasing your commitment to learning and professional development.

Exceptional proficiency in English, with the ability to convey complex ideas.

Outstanding organizational skills, with a knack for juggling multiple priorities seamlessly.

Innate interpersonal abilities, with a genuine passion for connecting with and supporting others.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, demonstrating your ability to navigate and utilize software to enhance productivity.

A track record of meeting and exceeding quotas, showing your dedication to achieving goals.

At least 2 years of experience in recruiting, indicating your understanding of the job market and talent acquisition strategies.

title: Sales
description:
We are an established Australian jewellery business building a national eCommerce acquisition system around a custom Engagement Ring Builder.



We are seeking a senior-level Digital Marketing & Funnel Architect to design, implement, document, and optimise the entire digital acquisition system from the ground up.



This is a full-time, project-based build role.

This is not a basic VA position.



BUSINESS ENVIRONMENT



• Shopify-based website (multiple apps & API integrations)

• Custom-built Shopify ring builder application

• API integration with jewellery-specific POS/CRM (Retail Edge)

• Google Analytics 4 installed

• Google Tag Manager installed

• Meta Pixel installed (requires proper configuration & validation)

• National sales focus (not local store traffic)



We are technology-forward and want to build a scalable, measurable acquisition system.



PROJECT OBJECTIVE



To design and implement a paid acquisition system that:



• Drives qualified national traffic

• Captures and nurtures high-intent leads

• Tracks every meaningful event accurately

• Reduces customer acquisition cost over time

• Provides clear visibility into CAC, CPL, ROAS and funnel drop-offs

• Is fully documented and transparent



We are building, testing, measuring and scaling based on data.



SCOPE OF WORK



Funnel Architecture



• Map full customer journey (cold ? warm ? hot ? purchase)

• Design TOF / MOF / BOF campaign structure

• Identify missing touchpoints

• Build retargeting framework

• Produce documented funnel diagrams and SOPs



Meta Ads (Advanced)



Must have strong working knowledge of:



• Meta Business Manager structure

• Pixel configuration & event tracking

• Custom conversions

• Audience building (custom & lookalike)

• Campaign structure & naming conventions

• A/B testing framework

• Budget allocation strategy

• Scaling methodology

• CAC & ROAS optimisation



Google Ads (Search-Focused)



• Campaign structure

• Keyword research (high commercial intent)

• Match types & negative keyword control

• Conversion tracking

• Bidding strategies

• Cost per acquisition optimisation

• ROAS tracking



Tracking & Analytics



• GA4 configuration

• Google Tag Manager

• Accurate event mapping

• Attribution analysis

• Funnel drop-off analysis

• Weekly structured reporting including:



CPC



CPL



Cost per booked consultation



Cost per acquisition



ROAS



Conversion rates at each stage



Documentation & Training



• Document campaign structures

• Document tracking setup

• Create SOPs

• Explain decisions clearly

• Train business owner & staff



We want clarity, not a black-box system.



IDEAL CANDIDATE



• 5+ years hands-on Meta & Google Ads experience

• Experience with mid to high-ticket eCommerce

• Proven ability to reduce CAC over time

• Strong analytical thinking

• Confident communicating strategy to business owners

• Excellent written English



STRUCTURE



• Full-time during build phase

• Project-based engagement

• Generous rate for high-level expertise

• Clear milestones and deliverables



TO APPLY



Please provide:



Example of a full funnel you have built



Example where you reduced customer acquisition cost



Sample reporting dashboard



How you would approach a high-ticket ($4,000+) product funnel



Your project or monthly rate



Confirmation of experience with Meta Ads, Google Ads, GA4 and Tag Manager



We are looking for someone capable of architecting and implementing a scalable acquisition system from the ground up.



— Burrows Jewellers

title: Listing Coordinator- Permanent WFH, With or Without Experience
description:
Are you a highly organized, detail-oriented professional with a passion for facilitating seamless transactions? We are currently seeking a Listing Coordinator to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring smooth real estate transactions from start to finish. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have exceptional communication skills, and have a knack for managing complex processes, we want to hear from you. Join us and be an integral part of our team as we continue to deliver exceptional service to our clients.



Your responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

- Manage the entire listing and transaction process, from contract initiation to closing.

- Review contracts for inconsistencies and errors and ensure corrections.

- Ensure document compliance by sending necessary paperwork.

- Assist in preparing listing packets.

- Proficiency in using transaction platforms like Dotloop, DocuSign, TransactionDesk, and Open to Close.

- Upload listings to MLS.

- Draft contracts, offers, and addendums.

- Coordinate with buyers, agents, attorneys, lenders, title companies, and escrow services.

- Organize property inspections and repairs.

- Schedule open houses and property visits.

- Conduct post-closing follow-up on properties.

- Perform comparative market analyses using online property profiles and MLS research.



Qualifications/Competence:

- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal

- Willing to consider candidates without prior VA experience, as long as they possess the necessary skill sets

- Prior experience in a corporate environment is required

- Able to work in the US Eastern Time Zone (EST), from Saturday to Sunday, 9am-6pm (inclusive of a daily 1-hour unpaid break).

- Stable high-speed internet and a distraction-free workspace.

- We use screenshot monitoring on our VAs.



If you're keen on joining us for a full-time and long-term role,
 us your cover letter and CV at

, for us to ensure that you fully read and understood the description above. Failure to do so will result in the forfeiture of your application.

title: We’re Hiring: SEO Strategist (Philippines-Based)
description:
I’m Dustin, founder of Marketing Done Right, a Cleveland-based digital marketing agency. We’re on the lookout for a motivated SEO Strategist to join our Philippines-based crew and take ownership of client projects.



About Us

Marketing Done Right is a close-knit digital marketing agency that delivers top-tier Local SEO and National SEO solutions. We pride ourselves on collaboration, innovation, and helping our tea
mbers grow professionally while delivering measurable results for our clients.





Why Join Us?

Supportive Team Culture – Work with a collaborative, international team where your contributions truly matter.

Career Growth – Long-term role with opportunities to grow and advance.

Performance-Based Salary Increase – Strong results and consistent performance can lead to salary growth.

Diverse Projects – Lead SEO strategies across a variety of client accounts and industries.

Job Stability – We’re in it for the long run and are looking for someone who is, too.





Role (Overview of the Position)



This position will be responsible for leading the strategy and planning of assigned client SEO projects. The strategist will execute these strategies through MDR’s pod and support systems, working with SEO Specialists, SEO Supports, VAs, and the content team. This role involves taking clear ownership of assigned projects, ensuring strategies are aligned with client goals, guided by data, and carried through effectively from planning to delivery.



Responsibilities (Tasks Associated with the Role)



- Manage multiple client projects simultaneously while ensuring quality, focus, and on-time delivery.

- Lead the strategy and planning for assigned client SEO projects.

- Create monthly reports to show progress, highlight wins, and identify opportunities for improvement.

- Collaborate with the content team by suggesting topics and outlining content deliverables for each month.

- Work with SEO Specialists, SEO Supports, and VAs within the pod system to execute strategies effectively.

- Oversee timelines, deliverables, and workflows to ensure projects are managed smoothly from start to finish.

- Conduct audits, keyword research, and performance reviews to inform data-driven decisions.

- Provide guidance, direction, and feedback to pod members to maintain alignment and quality.

- Develop and maintain SEO documents (such as strategies, audits, and reports) for both internal use and client reporting.

- Take ownership of project outcomes, ensuring strategies stay on track and aligned with client goals.



Results (Expected Accomplishments)



- Assigned SEO projects are delivered with clear direction, steady progress, and alignment to client business objectives.

- Multiple client accounts are handled efficiently, with competing priorities balanced without delays or quality issues.

- Monthly reports consistently highlight wins, performance insights, and opportunities, equipping leadership with valuable talking points for client updates.

- Content deliverables are strategically planned, ensuring each piece contributes to improved visibility and rankings.

- Pod collaboration is seamless, with Specialists, Supports, and VAs executing tasks on time and to standard.

- Timelines, workflows, and deliverables are proactively managed, preventing bottlenecks and ensuring smooth project flow.

- Audits and keyword research regularly uncover growth opportunities, guiding smarter decision-making.

- Performance reviews lead to tangible strategy adjustments that improve traffic, rankings, or conversions.

- Leadership receives accurate, well-structured documentation that strengthens client communication and trust.

- Strategists demonstrate effective delegation and feedback, resulting in stronger team performance and accountability within pods.

- Campaigns remain adaptable to changing client needs or market conditions without losing 
ntum.

- Projects demonstrate consistent alignment with MDR’s quality standards and brand reputation.

- Workload across multiple clients is prioritized effectively, ensuring no project falls behind schedule.

- Collaboration with the content team results in deliverables that not only support SEO but also enhance overall marketing strategy.

- Client satisfaction is reinforced by clear communication, visible progress, and the strategist’s ownership of outcomes.

- Strategists show the ability to anticipate potential challenges and address them before they become roadblocks.

- Reports and strategies are presented in a way that simplifies complex data into actionable insights.

- Campaign outcomes contribute to MDR’s larger goal of delivering measurable growth and value for clients.





Requirements (Expected Proficiencies)



- Proven experience in SEO strategy, including keyword research, audits, and data-driven decision-making.

- Strong understanding of SEO best practices, local SEO, analytics, and reporting tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, etc.).

- Ability to manage and prioritize multiple client accounts at the same time without losing focus on quality or deadlines.

- Skilled in creating SEO documents for both client reporting and internal use (such as strategies, reports, and project plans) that clearly outline progress, insights, and next steps.

- Experience working closely with cross-functional teams (such as content, design, development, PPC, and virtual assistants) to ensure deliverables align with SEO strategies and client goals.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills, both written and verbal.

- Ability to think critically, stay calm under pressure, and find solutions in urgent or challenging situations.

- Comfortable giving direction, feedback, and guidance to tea
mbers to keep projects on track.

- Detail-oriented, organized, and able to keep timelines and deliverables moving smoothly.

- Familiarity with the latest SEO trends, algorithm updates, and digital marketing practices.





How to Apply

Interested applicants must fill out this Google Form to be considered:
