title: Finance Operations Executive
description:
Finance Operations Executive (Virtual Assistant – Accounts & Bookkeeping)

Company Overview



MUST HAVE XERO EXPERIENCE



Yum Street Limited is a UK-based hospitality and events business operating across public events, private bookings, and multi-site food operations. We manage high transaction volumes across events, football matchdays, and catering operations, making accurate financial control and reporting essential.



This role sits at the heart of the business, supporting day-to-day finance operations, cashflow visibility, management reporting, and cost control.



This is not a basic bookkeeping role and not a short-term VA gig.

It is an operational finance position requiring accuracy, accountability, commercial awareness, and strong systems discipline.



We are specifically looking for someone who:



Wants long-term, stable employment



Is committed to working as a professional Virtual Assistant



Has experience in accounts and bookkeeping



Values accuracy, structure, and consistency



Role Overview



The Finance Operations Executive is responsible for maintaining clean, accurate, and reliable financial records, reconciling transactions, supporting management accounts, and ensuring sales and cost data flows correctly across multiple systems.



You will work closely with senior management and external accounting support, providing dependable financial information that supports decision-making and profitability.



This role is ideal for someone who:



Enjoys reconciliations and financial accuracy



Is comfortable working independently as a Virtual Assistant



Wants to build a long-term career in finance operations and bookkeeping



Takes pride in getting things right the first time



Key Responsibilities

1. Xero Reconciliations & Transaction Management



Reconcile bank and card transactions in Xero weekly



Accurately link receipts and invoices to transactions



Extract receipts from
 and WhatsApp and upload to Xero



Ensure all transactions are coded correctly and consistently



Maintain clean, audit-ready records at all times



Accuracy and timeliness are critical. Errors or missing data are not acceptable.



2. Invoicing & Sales Recording



Create and issue invoices directly from Xero



Upload and record football matchday sales into 



Ensure sales data matches POS systems and bank records



Communicate professionally with clients and customers regarding sales queries



Identify and resolve discrepancies promptly



3. Cashflow & Management Reporting



Create and maintain cashflow tracking sheets



Provide weekly and monthly cashflow updates



Prepare weekly and monthly P&L summaries



Highlight variances, missing data, or unusual movements



Support management with accurate, timely, and reliable reporting



4. Cost of Goods (COGS) & Margin Support



Review cost of goods sold (COGS) across operations



Compare supplier pricing and flag opportunities for cost savings



Support margin analysis and cost control initiatives



Maintain and review data within MarketMan



5. Systems & Reporting Integration



Maintain accurate and consistent data across:



Xero







MarketMan



Square POS



Rota Ready



Pull sales and product reports from Square



Ensure consistency between POS, finance, and operational systems



Proactively flag errors, missing data, or system mismatches



Software & Tools Required



You must be confident in, or willing to be trained on:



Xero (essential)







MarketMan



Square POS



Rota Ready



Excel / Google Sheets



Required Skills & Experience

Essential



Experience working as a Virtual Assistant



Experience in accounts, bookkeeping, or finance operations



Strong experience using Xero



Solid understanding of the UK tax system (VAT, basic compliance)



High attention to detail and accuracy



Strong reconciliation and reporting skills



Ability to manage financial data across multiple systems



Professional written English



Confident communicating with internal teams and clients



Ability to work independently, manage time, and meet deadlines



Desirable (Not Essential)



Experience in hospitality, events, or retail businesses



Experience supporting management accounts



Experience in high-volume transactional environments



Performance Expectations (Very Important)



Success in this role will be measured by:



Accuracy and timeliness of Xero reconciliations



Clean, audit-ready financial records



Reliability of cashflow and P&L reporting



Accuracy of sales and cost data across systems



Ability to identify cost-saving and margin improvement opportunities



Consistency, ownership, and follow-through



This is a delivery-focused finance role, not a passive admin or task-only VA position.



Who This Role Is NOT For



People who dislike reconciliations or financial detail



People who struggle with accuracy, consistency, or deadlines



People looking for short-term, freelance, or “side hustle” work



People who need constant supervision to complete tasks



People without confidence using accounting systems



Why Work With Yum Street Limited



Long-term, secure role with stability and growth potential



Clear systems, responsibilities, and performance expectations



Opportunity to gain serious hands-on experience in operational finance



Exposure to real commercial decision-making



Opportunity to grow into senior finance or operations roles



Work with a UK-based, established hospitality and events business



???? Important Note



We are specifically looking for someone who wants to build a long-term working relationship, values accuracy, and takes pride in their work. If you are looking for short-term VA contracts or task-based freelance work, this role will not be suitable.

title: VA Admin Agent
description:
We’re looking for an Administrative Agent to help support our sales and recruiting teams. This is an entry-level position that is eligible for promotion after 12 months of tenure.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********



You will fail the application process if you don't read the entire job description.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********





About Us



Started in 2017, and we're growing like crazy.

We expect to hire at least 4 salespeople, 3 admins, and 3 marketers in 2026.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2025 and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2026

A small team of 1 American and 10 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don’t do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive commission package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week

Schedule - 9 AM to 5 PM EST



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid two weeks off for the Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job.

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience.

If you’re looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you.

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Orders - Processing Product Order (Gift Certificate)

New Orders - Initial Order Confirmation (Level 3)

Instructor Onboarding, Offboarding and Reonboarding

Reactivate Unavailable Instructor

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT. This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Duplicate Record Check

Updating the "Daily Tracking" Process

CTM Prospect Staging





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years of minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and the ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management, and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and a good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experience lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINK ELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here.





Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed.

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system.

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.





How to apply: Please click on the link: 
/work-opportunities/administration-agent

title: Project Manager — Hubstaff Tasks Expert
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Type: Full-time (open to start part-time 20–30 hrs/wk)

Schedule: Must have 4+ hours overlap with US Eastern Time on weekdays



Ashlex is a growing tech group with several divisions. We build WordPress sites and custom web apps for clients and for our own brands. We’re hiring a project manager who lives in Hubstaff Tasks, keeps work moving, and gives clear, honest updates.



You will plan projects end-to-end, break work into doable tasks with owners and due dates, run simple standups and sprint planning, and keep our Hubstaff Tasks boards clean—statuses, priorities, tags, swimlanes, and dependencies. You’ll track time and budgets, call out risks early, coordinate designers, developers, QA, and content, write straightforward user stories and acceptance criteria, review staging links, manage releases, and report progress in plain English. You’ll also help track internal tasks across Ashlex’s divisions so leadership always knows what’s done, what’s next, and what’s blocked.



To do well here, you should be an actual Hubstaff Tasks power user who understands templates, projects, epics, sprints, automations, burndown, and how to keep a board from turning into spaghetti. You know the normal web dev flow—backlog to sprint to code to QA to staging to production—and you’re comfortable managing both WordPress builds (themes, plugins, page builders) and custom development (basic FE/BE concepts and APIs). You’ve worked with Agile and Kanban, and you know when to use which. 



Strong written English, steady organization, and calm under pressure are musts. It’s a plus if you can write simple test cases and UAT checklists, speak basic Git and environments, and handle release basics like hosting, DNS, and SSL.



A quick but important note: no AI-generated applications. Write in your own words. If your application reads like a bot, we won’t review it. We may ask for a short Loom to confirm real Hubstaff Tasks usage.



In your message, first describe your Hubstaff Tasks experience—how long you’ve used it, the features you rely on, and include a 1–3 minute Loom walking through a board you built (blur anything sensitive) if you can. Next, explain your approach to Agile vs. Kanban in 5–8 sentences and define, in your own words, what “sprint goal,” “WIP limit,” and “definition of done” mean to you. Then walk us through your development process: the differences between bugs, features, and technical debt, and your release checklist from staging to production. 



Share links to three to five projects you managed (include your role, team size, and timeline) and one custom dev project (stack if known, any API work, and how you handled QA and handoff) if you can.



If you like clear plans, clean boards, and getting things shipped, you’ll fit right in. Apply now.

title: Marketing Virtual Assistant
description:
About CurbIT



CurbIT is an all natural GLP-1 support supplement designed to help individuals with healthy weight management and reduced cravings in a safe and clinically backed way. We are currently the only product online supported by a double-blind clinical study demonstrating a 544% increase in natural GLP-1 levels.



We are building credibility first, visibility second, and sales as a natural result of authority-driven content.



Role Overview



• We are seeking a strategic and AI-savvy Marketing Virtual Assistant to build and manage our Instagram and
 presence from the ground up.



• This role is not just about posting content. The goal is to position CurbIT as a trusted, science-backed authority in the wellness space.



• The ideal candidate understands brand strategy, content marketing, and how to translate clinical data into engaging educational content.



Key Responsibilities

Brand Strategy and Positioning



• Extract and refine messaging from our website and clinical materials

• Develop clear content pillars focused on credibility, education, and wellness transformation

• Align all messaging with approved compliance and claims guidelines



Content Creation and Management



• Build and launch Instagram and
 brand presence

• Create educational posts, carousels, short-form videos, and captions

• Translate clinical study results into easy-to-understand content

• Develop authority driven posts around GLP-1 education and natural alternatives

• Schedule and manage consistent posting cadence



AI-Driven Marketing



• Use AI tools to research trends and expand brand visibility

• Repurpose content across platforms efficiently

• Identify opportunities to increase organic growth



Community and Brand Presence



• Monitor engagement and respond appropriately

• Help build a credible and professional online voice

• Support visibility growth while maintaining brand integrity



Reporting and Collaboration

• Present content direction and strategy for approval

• Provide simple performance insights and recommendations

• Work independently once direction is approved



Ideal Qualifications

• Experience building social media brands from zero

• Strong content strategy and storytelling skills

• Experience with health, wellness, or supplement brands preferred

• Comfortable interpreting and communicating scientific information

• Proficient with AI tools for marketing and content development

• Highly organized and self-directed



Working Style

• Reports directly to Founder

• Founder approves overall direction and messaging

• VA executes strategy and manages day-to-day content



To Apply:

You MUST submit a portfolio of current social media work, a video intro, and a current resume. Must use at least 6 apply points.

title: Finance Assistant
description:
Job Title: Finance Assistant

Type: Full-time, Remote

Salary:$1,500–$2,000 USD/month (depending on location & experience)

Reports to:Ali (CEO)

Regions Philippines, Pakistan, Egypt, Lebanon



PLEASE APPLY THROUGH THIS LINK: 



About Adcrate:

Adcrate is a fast-growing AI-driven performance marketing agency helping eCommerce and digital product brands scale through data-backed creative and paid media. We’re young, dynamic, and moving fast and now we’re looking for a finance expert to bring more clarity and control to our numbers



The Role:

This is not a bookkeeping role.

You’ll own monthly financial reporting, cashflow visibility, profitability analysis, and invoicing, giving the leadership team clear insight into how the business is performing.

You’ll work closely with the CEO and external accountants, making sure numbers are clean, accurate, and useful - without overcomplicating things.



What You’ll Own:

- Monthly P&L and cashflow reporting (delivered within 5 days of month-end)

- Profitability tracking by client, project, and business unit

- Margin analysis with clear recommendations

- Invoicing and proactive collections (chasing overdue payments)

- Coordination with external accountants (UK + US compliance)

- Building and maintaining financial dashboards (Sheets / Notion)

- Supporting hiring, spend, and investment decisions with data

- Maintaining clean financial documentation and processes



You Should Have:

- Experience in agency, SaaS, or service-based businesses

- Strong working knowledge of Xero or QuickBooks and Google Sheets (must)

- Advanced Google Sheets skills (non-negotiable)

- Confidence working with UK & US entities

- Ability to explain numbers clearly to non-finance people

- Proactive mindset - you flag issues early, not after the fact

- Comfortable working async with leadership

- Fluent English and EU time zone working hours



Nice to Have:

- FP&A or commercial finance background

- Experience building dashboards or financial systems in Notion

- Exposure to fast-scaling remote teams



Why Join Us:

- Be a key part of a growing, dynamic team that moves fast

- Flexible remote work with part-time commitment

- Work directly with the founder and shape the finance function from the ground up

- Opportunity to grow with the agency as we scale

title: Video Editor
description:
About Us:

We are an e-commerce group based in Scandinavia, currently scaling our home/cleaning brand and expanding into footwear this coming month. We have a proven track record of taking brands to 300k €/month and aiming to hit way higher this year. 





The Goal:

Your mission is to expand our Creative Velocity. We will test 7–14+ new creatives every single week. 





Direct Response Specialist: You must master the structure: [Aggressive Hook] ? [Agitate Pain] ? [Solution/Bridge] ? [Proof] ? [CTA].

A-Player Quality: Native-level understanding of pacing, dopamine-driven cuts, sound design, and text-on-screen.

Data-Driven: We share performance data (CPA, Hook Rate) weekly. You must be able to iterate based on what the numbers say.





Who You Are:

Reliable & Fast: You never miss a deadline. Speed is our competitive advantage.

Independent: We provide the brief and the assets. You provide the magic. No hand-holding or micromanagement.

DR Expert: You’ve edited ads for high-spend accounts before (Home, Beauty, or similar categories).





Software: Expert in CapCut or Adobe Premiere.

Compensation & Growth:



Starting Rate: $5–$6/hour (depending on experience).



The Upside: We are looking for a long-term partner. As we hit our goals, we offer performance bonuses and rate increases.

Full-Time Potential: This starts part-time (15–20h/week) but will move to full-time quickly as we launch more brands.



How to Apply (The Filter):

Subject Line: Must start with the word "DIAMOND".

Portfolio: Send a link to your 3 best Direct Response ads (NOT a generic showreel).

The Test: Briefly explain why your best ad performed (What was the hook? What was the CTA?).

title: Video Editor
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Performance Video Editor (Part-Time) who understands direct-response marketing and can create high-converting ad creatives for international markets.



This is NOT just a basic editing job.

We are building localized sales videos that feel native to each country.



If you understand conversion psychology, hooks, and creative testing — this is for you.



Job Type

Part-Time Position

Remote (Online)

Long-term opportunity



 Important:

Workload may vary. Some weeks may be very active, while occasionally there may be little to no work for a week. Flexibility is required.



Your Main Responsibilities

1. Native Localization of Ads



When we give you 1 video, you must:



Translate and fully localize it so it sounds 100% native



Adapt tone, phrasing, and cultural references



Adjust currency to the target country (example: £ ? kr, $ ? €, etc.)



Replace cities, names, and country references accordingly



Ensure the final version sounds like it was originally produced in that country



 No word-for-word translations.

It must feel natural and native.



2. 3-Version Rule (Very Important)



For every 1 video we provide, you must create:



Version 1  Optimized localized version



Version 2  New creative concept (different angle)



Version 3 Another new concept (different angle)



This means we always receive 3 ad variations per project.



You must be creative and think in angles like:

Pain-driven hook

Storytelling

UGC style

Authority angle

Before/after

Emotional trigger

Social proof



 Requirements



Strong experience editing
 ADS



Understanding of direct response marketing



Ability to create strong hooks (first 3 seconds are critical)



Experience with subtitles & dynamic captions



Ability to adapt videos for different countries



Fluent English



Fast turnaround time



Performance mindset (we test creatives constantly)



 What We Care About



We don’t care about cinematic editing.

We care about performance.



Your videos must:



Grab attention instantly

Trigger emotions

Keep retention high

Drive conversions

title: Remote B2B Sales Development Representative
description:
Company: Fightlab

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Salary: $500–$600USD/month + commission

Type: Full-Time Remote



About Fightlab



Fightlab is a Muay Thai & combat sports lifestyle brand based in Phuket, Thailand. Our gear is worn by fighters, gyms, and athletes worldwide.



We partner with gyms and fight teams to supply custom co-branded apparel, including Muay Thai shorts, team training shirts, and walkout gear.



As we expand across Thailand and internationally, we are building a strong B2B pipeline to supply gyms and fight teams with premium Fightlab apparel.



The Role



We are seeking a driven B2B Sales Representative to build and manage Fightlab’s gym and fight team partnership pipeline.



This role focuses on outbound outreach, relationship building, and closing bulk/team apparel partnerships within the global fight community.



You will be building a high-value pipeline from scratch.



???? Primary Targets

Combat Sports Facilities



• Muay Thai gyms & fight camps

• Boxing & MMA gyms

• Strength & conditioning gyms with fight programs

• Fight teams & training groups



????? Product Offering



Fightlab helps gyms and teams create:



? custom co-branded Muay Thai shorts

? team training shirts & vests

? walkout & fight team apparel

? retail merchandise opportunities for gyms



Our apparel helps teams build identity, professionalism, and pride.



???? Key Responsibilities

Lead Generation & Research



• Identify gyms and fight camps globally via Instagram, Google Maps, fight events, and online directories

• Identify decision-makers (owners, coaches, managers)

• Maintain an organized prospect and pipeline system



Outreach & Relationship Building



• Initiate outreach via Instagram and
 Messenger

• Build relationships through authentic, respectful communication

• Move conversations to WhatsApp or LINE for direct communication

• Send follow-ups and nurture relationships over time



Partnership Development & Closing



• Introduce Fightlab apparel partnerships

• Discuss team apparel needs and customization options

• Support bulk/team order discussions

• Coordinate pricing and order details

• Maintain clear deal tracking



Communication & Reporting



• Provide weekly outreach and pipeline reports

• Track response rates and partnership progress

• Share insights and improve messaging

• Suggest new outreach opportunities



???? Performance Goals

Month 1



• 100+ gym contacts researched

• consistent daily outreach activity

• first partnership discussions initiated



Month 3



• 10+ active gym partnerships

• consistent bulk apparel orders

• strong pipeline for continued growth



Month 6



• 20+ gym partnerships

• recurring wholesale revenue

• expanding international presence



? Required Qualifications

Must Have



• Fluent English (written & spoken)

• 1–3 years sales, outreach, or partnership experience

• Strong communication & relationship-building skills

• Highly organized & self-motivated

• Comfortable working independently

• Persistent and resilient mindset



Strong Advantage



• Experience working with gyms or sports communities

• Knowledge of combat sports or fitness culture

• Experience using Instagram for outreach

• Familiarity with WhatsApp/LINE communication

• Remote sales or outreach experience



???? What Success Looks Like



• Fightlab apparel worn by gyms worldwide

• Recurring wholesale partnerships

• Strong global gym network

• Predictable monthly B2B revenue growth



???? Compensation & Incentives

Base Salary



$500–$700 USD/month (based on experience)



Commission



• Bonus per new gym partnership

• Bonus per team apparel order

• Bonus for revenue milestones



Top performers can significantly increase earnings through commission.



???? Why Join Fightlab?



• Work with a growing global fight brand

• Direct impact on revenue growth

• Build international partnerships

• Flexible remote work environment

• Growth into Account Manager role

• Work in the exciting combat sports industry



? Work Schedule



• 40 hours per week

• Flexible schedule

• Overlap with Bangkok time (GMT+7) for communication



???? How to Apply



Send your CV and a brief cover letter to [INSERT
]



Include:



1?? Your outreach or sales experience

2?? Any connection to combat sports or fitness culture

3?? Why you are interested in this role

title: Sales Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Summary: We are seeking a detail-oriented and efficient Administrative

Assistant with Prior Sales Experience to support our sales team. This role is pivotal in managing the administrative

tasks related to global client growth. This role is responsible for managing the response process to Requests for SALES Proposals (RFPs) from potential or existing clients. This role involves analyzing RFP documents, coordinating with cross-functional teams, developing comprehensive proposals, and ensuring timely submission. The Sales Administrative Assistant plays a crucial role in securing new business opportunities and maintaining client satisfaction. Sales admin background or experience is preferred. PRIOR SALES EXPERIENCE IS A MUST for this role.



Key Responsibilities:

• Support our regional growth field executives and account executives with


 data entry, completing order forms and global account

applications.

• Coordinate and schedule meetings across various time zones, particularly for our

sales leaders in the Americas, EMEA, and APAC regions.

• Maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion when handling sensitive

information.

• Provide robust administrative support including document preparation,

systematic shared filing within MS Teams/Sharepoint, and managing

correspondence.

• Assist in crafting reports for a diverse range of audiences, both internal and

external.

• Work collaboratively with different departments to facilitate seamless operations

and communication.

• Analyze and interpret RFP documents to identify key requirements, deadlines, and evaluation criteria.

• Coordinate with cross-functional teams (e.g. sales, marketing, finance, product development) to gather necessary information and responses for each RFP.

• Develop and maintain a comprehensive library of standard responses, templates, and supporting documents to streamline the RFP response process.

• Customize responses to RFPs ensuring they are tailored to meet the specific needs and preferences of each potential client while highlighting the company's strengths and differentiators.

• Manage the RFP response timeline, ensuring all internal reviews, revisions, and approvals are completed before the submission deadline.

• Ensure compliance with all proposal requirements, including formatting, content, and delivery specifications, to maximize the chances of success.

• Conduct post-submission follow-up with potential clients to address any questions, provide additional information, and reinforce the company's interest in the opportunity.

• Perform analysis of RFP outcomes, gathering feedback from clients on both successful and unsuccessful bids to inform continuous improvement in the RFP process.

Qualifications:

• Demonstrable experience in an administrative assistant capacity or a related

field.

title: 3D PRINTING EXPERT
description:
Production Engineer (Remote)



Supporting Voltech Operations

Voltech is seeking a technically strong, detail-oriented Production Engineer (Remote) to support global operations related to Voltech test systems and custom test fixtures.



This role is ideal for an engineer who enjoys solving complex mechanical and electrical problems, improving manufacturing systems, and taking ownership of production standards. You will work closely with cross-functional teams and international suppliers to improve fixture reliability, production efficiency, and long-term product architecture.



We are looking for someone who does more than execute instructions — we value engineers who proactively identify weaknesses, design structured improvements, and drive measurable results.



Role Overview

The Remote Production Engineer will:

Support production and fixture-related engineering activities

Improve manufacturing processes and reduce inefficiencies

Investigate design and production issues affecting Voltech test systems

Maintain and improve technical drawings and documentation

Coordinate with international suppliers on technical and quality standards

Support 3D-printed fixture components and rapid prototyping

Contribute to global production engineering standards

This is a hands-on engineering role requiring strong analytical ability, structured thinking, and practical problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate is comfortable working independently while collaborating remotely with sales, applications, service, and supplier teams across time zones.



Key Responsibilities

1. Production & Fixture Engineering Support

Provide remote engineering support for production of Voltech test fixtures and accessories

Troubleshoot mechanical and electrical fixture issues impacting customer testing

Improve fixture durability, usability, and measurement repeatability

Analyze recurring production issues and implement corrective actions

Design and refine precision contact systems (Kelvin probes, spring contacts, alignment plates)

Manage tolerance stack-ups in multi-component assemblies

Improve durability of high-cycle contact surfaces



2. Engineering & Design

Create, update, and maintain detailed technical drawings:

Fixture layouts

Wiring configurations

Mechanical components

Conduct structured root cause analysis on design failures

Develop improved design solutions to increase product lifespan and reduce cost

Support new fixture designs based on customer test requirements

Address technical areas such as:

Kelvin contact systems

High-voltage and low-current measurement precision

Wear surfaces

Tolerance stacking in fixture plates

Repeatability across global suppliers

3D-printed mechanical + electrical hybrid components



3. 3D Printing & Rapid Prototyping

Manage and maintain in-house 3D printing for fixture components

Optimize print files and material selection for durability and accuracy

Support rapid prototyping of custom fixture parts

Drive improvements in fixture lead time, reliability, and cost efficiency



4. Supplier Coordination

Liaise with international suppliers (including China) on:

Technical specifications

Manufacturing tolerances

Quality standards

Review production samples and supplier drawings

Provide technical feedback and enforce compliance with Voltech engineering standards



Ideal Candidate Profile

Degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Manufacturing Engineering

Experience in manufacturing, industrial production, or test equipment environments

Familiarity with electrical test systems, wiring, or test fixtures (highly preferred)

Strong CAD and technical drawing skills

Strong troubleshooting and structured problem-solving ability

Experience managing tolerance stack-ups and precision assemblies

Comfortable communicating with international suppliers

Able to work independently in a remote setup

Willing to travel when needed to support manufacturing

Capable of managing engineering projects with minimal supervision

Proactive communicator across time zones

title: Social Media Manager Wanted – Established Meme Account | 538K+ Monthly Views | Ready to Monetize
description:
Let's skip the fluff.

This account already works. 538,000 views. 64,600 interactions. 29 pieces of content. All in the last 30 days. The hard part — proving the concept and building 
ntum — is done. Now we need the right person to scale it and monetize it.

The Account:

Marketing Malpractice is an Instagra
me account built around workplace humor and marketing culture. Think relatable, sarcastic, and shareable — the kind of content people tag their coworkers in at 9am on a Monday because it hits too close to home. The voice is established. The audience is engaged. The brand partnerships haven't started yet. That's where you come in.

What You'll Be Doing:



Maintaining daily posting cadence with Reels-first content

Sourcing trending audio, formats, and angles that fit the brand voice

Owning the monetization strategy — brand outreach, sponsored content, affiliate opportunities

Reporting on weekly performance with actual insight, not just screenshots

Growing the follower count to match the reach this account already has



Who This Is For:

Someone who has actually done this before. Not someone who wants to learn on our account. You know what makes a Reel perform before you post it. You understand engagement rates, saves, and shares matter more than likes. You've monetized an account or helped someone else do it. You communicate without being chased.

If you've read this far, here's what we actually want to know when you apply:

Tell us about a specific account you managed — the niche, where it started, where you took it, and how you did it. If you helped monetize it, tell us how. Numbers only. No vague claims.

Applications without this will not receive a response.

This is a long-term role for the right person. We're not looking for a contractor. We're looking for a growth partner.

title: E-commerce Assistant Store Manager – High-End Camping & Overlanding Store Launch
description:
About Us

We operate 2 profitable e-commerce stores and are launching our 3rd in the high-end camping and overlanding niche. This is a high-margin category with strong demand from customers who value quality gear and expert service.



You'll work directly with the owner during launch phase, seeing how we source products, set pricing, build marketing campaigns, and scale stores from zero to profitable. Most VAs never get this level of exposure to 7-figure e-commerce operations.



What This Role Actually Is

You'll manage operations (not people) for a new store during its critical launch phase. This means owning three core areas: customer experience, order fulfillment accuracy, and operational reporting.



As we scale and hire support staff in 6-12 months, you'll transition into team leadership. The systems and SOPs you build now become the foundation you'll eventually delegate.



Your Core Responsibilities (80% of your time)

Customer Service Management

• Handle all customer interactions via
, chat, and phone

• Process inquiries, returns, exchanges, and disputes professionally

• Maintain inventory accuracy in Shopify

• Flag stock issues before they become customer problems

Daily Operations Reporting

• Submit end-of-shift report covering: tasks completed, blockers encountered, support needed

• Track key metrics: orders processed, support tickets closed, errors caught

• Identify patterns that need owner attention



Secondary Responsibilities (20% of your time)

• Maintain accurate product listings (pricing, descriptions, inventory levels)

• Coordinate with vendors and dealer partners on orders and promotions

• Track sales performance and identify conversion opportunities

• Document processes and update SOPs as workflows evolve

• Flag customer feedback patterns that should inform product or marketing decisions

• Support seasonal campaigns (BFCM, holiday promos)



What You Need to Succeed

Required Experience

• 2+ years in e-commerce operations (customer service + order management + platform administration)

• Proven Shopify experience: building listings, managing inventory, processing bulk updates

• Experience managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

Technical Requirements

• Proficiency with Shopify, ClickUp, Airtable, and Google Workspace (or ability to learn quickly)

• Reliable computer setup and 20+ Mbps internet connection

• Backup solutions for both power and internet outages



Work Style

• Self-directed: you identify and solve problems without waiting for instructions

• Detail-oriented: accuracy matters more than speed

• Customer-focused: you view complaints as opportunities to improve systems

• Process-minded: you naturally document and refine how things get done



Bonus

• Knowledge of outdoor, camping, or overlanding gear

• Previous experience in a store launch or fast-growth phase



Work Schedule

• Full-time: 40 hours per week

• U.S. business hours: 9 PM–6 AM PHT or 10 PM–7 AM PHT (depending on Daylight Saving Time)

• 1-hour daily break

• Five days per week



Why This Role Matters

• You're not just processing orders. You're building the operational foundation for a store in a high-margin niche. During the trial period and first 6 months:

• You'll learn how we source, price, and market products from experienced operators running multiple 7-figure stores

• Your input shapes the SOPs and systems we'll use to scale

• You get first consideration for team lead and category manager roles when we expand

• You'll have direct access to the owner for mentorship on e-commerce strategy

• This isn't a stepping-stone VA role. It's employee #1 for a store with serious growth potential.



You're NOT a Fit If:

• You need micromanagement or detailed daily task lists

• You can't work 9 PM–7 AM PHT consistently

• You experience frequent power/internet outages without backup solutions

• You view this as temporary income between other opportunities



Application Instructions

To be considered, follow these instructions exactly:

Subject Line:

[Your First Name] – I Am Your New E-Commerce Operations Manager

(Example: Kevin – I Am Your New E-commerce Assistant Store Manager)

Include:

Cover letter (focus on relevant e-commerce experience)

Resume



Answer These Questions (numbered format, complete sentences):

• Describe your most relevant e-commerce operations experience: platform used, team size, daily order volume, and specific responsibilities you owned.

• What specific Shopify tasks have you performed? (Be detailed: inventory management? Bulk uploads? App integrations? Product page optimization?)

• Provide an example of a difficult customer service situation you handled: what was the issue, what did you do, and what was the outcome?

• What are your current work commitments and availability?

• Provide your internet speed (attach speed test screenshot), computer specifications, and describe your backup solutions for power and internet outages.

• Why are you interested in this role specifically, rather than other VA positions?



Important: AI-generated or template responses will be immediately disqualified. We're looking for thoughtful, specific answers that demonstrate you read and understood this posting.

title: Acquisition Specialist – Cold Caller & Closer
description:
Acquisition Specialist – Cold Caller & Closer



(Single Point of Accountability | Performance-Only | Zero Handoffs)



WARNING:

Apply only if you have verified experience in both outbound cold calling and direct-to-seller closing. If you require handoffs, coaching, or flexible standards, this is not for you.



Role Overview



You are solely responsible for generating, qualifying, and closing distressed property deals (unpaid taxes, inheritance, title issues, problem properties).

You will be measured and retained based exclusively on daily call output, pipeline quality, and contracts closed—no exceptions.



Your Responsibilities



100+ live cold call conversations per day (not dials—actual conversations logged and recorded)



Immediate qualification/disqualification using a fixed criteria set—no “relationship building” without outcome



Full-cycle deal management: Personally negotiate, contract, and close each deal—no handoffs at any stage



Accurate, real-time CRM entry for every contact, note, and pipeline movement



Follow strict process: All activity and results tracked and audited. Miss metrics for any reason = immediate removal



Who You Must Be



Proven in both cold calling (high daily volume) and full-cycle closing (real estate or equivalent asset class)



Able to provide daily metrics and references—not negotiable



Rigid about pipeline management, documentation, and transparent reporting



Comfortable with direct feedback and negative coaching—no sensitivity to high-rejection or blunt performance management



Compensation-driven, with a clear history of thriving under performance-only pay plans



Immediate Disqualifiers



No resume or lack of specific metrics for calls/deals



No voice memo, or memo not following exact instructions below



History of team-selling, “split” process roles, or reluctance to own the full sales cycle



Evidence of missed quotas, resistance to feedback, or incomplete reporting



Application Process



1. Submit your resume clearly listing outbound + closing experience, including your highest daily call volume and annual closed deals.

2. Submit a 2–3 minute, unscripted voice memo (no script, no edits) covering, in order:



Your name, country, and highest daily cold call volume in a sales role



An example of a distressed or complicated deal you personally closed (describe steps and outcome)



Your personal system for tracking activity, pipeline, and follow-ups



The most direct/negative feedback you’ve received about your sales process and what changed after



Why you want a single-point, output-only sales role (not team selling or account management)



Any deviation from these steps = immediate rejection.



Do Not Apply If:



You lack both cold calling and direct closing experience with provable metrics



You need daily encouragement, “culture,” or ongoing training



You resist process, documentation, or daily scorecard reporting



You want a collaborative/”team” sales role

title: Patient Care Coordinator
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Remote Patient Services Representative based in the Philippines. The ideal candidate will manage inbound and outbound calls, assist patients with scheduling appointments, address inquiries, and perform other related tasks to ensure a seamless patient experience.



Key Responsibilities:

• Answer incoming calls promptly and professionally.

• Schedule, reschedule, and confirm patient appointments using our electronic health record (EHR) system.

• Provide accurate information regarding services, insurance, and payment options.

• Address patient inquiries and concerns with empathy and efficiency.

• Maintain and update patient records with a high degree of accuracy.

• Collaborate with the optometry team to ensure optimal patient care.



Performance Metrics:

To ensure excellence in patient service, the following performance metrics will be used to evaluate success in this role:

• Average Handle Time (AHT): The average duration of a patient interaction, including talk time, hold time, and after-call work. Efficiently managing AHT ensures timely assistance to patients while maintaining service quality. ?

• Quality Score: Assessment of call quality based on adherence to protocols, accuracy of information provided, and overall patient interaction effectiveness. High-quality scores reflect a commitment to excellence in patient care.

• Patient Satisfaction Score: A measure of patient contentment with the service provided, often gathered through post-interaction surveys. High scores indicate successful patient engagement and issue resolution.

• Service Level: The percentage of calls answered within a specified timeframe, reflecting the ability to meet patient demand promptly. Maintaining a high service level ensures patient satisfaction and loyalty. ?

• Appointment Scheduling Rate: The efficiency and accuracy in scheduling patient appointments, ensuring optimal utilization of clinic time and resources.



Qualifications:

• Proven experience in a customer service role, preferably in a medical or optometry setting.

• Exceptional verbal and written English communication skills.

• Familiarity with EHR systems and medical scheduling software is a plus.

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

• Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.

• Stable internet connection and a quiet workspace conducive to professional phone conversations.



Work Schedule:

• Full-time position.

• Must be available to work U.S. business hours, including potential evening shifts to accommodate different time zones.



To Qualify, please complete the Assessment below:



1. Application form: wkf.ms/45nfpCJ

title: AI Automation Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced AI Automation Engineer to design and build autonomous AI agents that function as digital tea
mbers inside our company.



This is not a simple prompt writing role. We are building real world automation systems that execute tasks, process information, and interact with business software platforms.



You will be responsible for architecting and deploying AI driven workflows using tools such as OpenClaw, N8N, LLM APIs, and custom integrations. The goal is to build reliable AI agents capable of performing structured business operations including data extraction, CRM updates, estimating workflows,
 processing, and system orchestration.



You should be comfortable building multi step automation pipelines, integrating APIs, designing agent memory systems, and ensuring repeatable task execution with minimal supervision.



Key Responsibilities:



• Build and deploy autonomous AI agents

title: Social Media Manager
description:
Position: Social Media Manager



Location: Remote Work

Shift Timings: EST Time Zone



Job Description:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Social Media Manager to join our team and lead our social media efforts. As a Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing our social media strategy, creating engaging content, managing social media accounts, and analyzing performance metrics to drive growth and brand awareness.



Responsibilities:

- Develop and execute a comprehensive social media strategy to increase brand awareness, engagement, and online presence across various platforms.

- Create, curate, and manage all published content, including images, videos, and written copy.

- Monitor social media trends, tools, and applications and appropriately apply that knowledge to enhance our social media campaigns.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align social media strategy with overall marketing initiatives.

- Manage and monitor social media accounts, responding to comments, messages, and mentions in a timely and engaging manner.

- Plan and execute paid social media advertising campaigns to drive traffic, conversions, and lead generation.

- Analyze and report on key performance metrics regularly, using data to optimize strategies and tactics.

- Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in social media marketing.

- Engage with influencers and build partnerships to expand our brand reach.

- Stay current with social media algorithms and adjust strategies to maximize organic reach.

- Identify opportunities for user-generated content and encourage audience participation.

- Manage social media calendar and ensure timely posting of content.



Qualifications:

- 3+ years experience as a Social Media Manager

- Strong understanding of social media platforms, their respective audiences, and best practices.

- Proficiency in social media management tools and analytics platforms.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

- Creative mindset with the ability to generate innovative content ideas.

- Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

- Experience with paid social media advertising campaigns is a plus.

• Must be willing to work in EST time zone and comfortable using a time tracker



Benefits:

• Leave Benefits

• Internet and Mobile Allowance

• Health and Dental Insurance

• Entertainment Benefits

• Trip Incentive (outside the country)



Note: Benefit terms will be discussed during onboarding.



Application Process:

We look forward to reviewing your application!



Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position. Duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be adjusted as necessary to meet the evolving needs of our company.

title: Operations & Client Support Assistant for Boutique Interior Design Studio
description:
OVERVIEW

**Application Instructions**

Please submit your application only through OnlineJobs.ph. Do not email our company directly. Applications sent outside of the platform will not be reviewed.



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a boutique interior design studio seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented Operations & Administrative Assistant to support daily business needs. This role focuses on email management, administrative tasks, and backend organization allowing the founder to concentrate on creative work and client relationships.



This position does not involve sales or direct client interaction, but it does require professional communication with vendors, trade partners, and brands regarding pricing, samples, orders, and shipping. The role is hands-on and execution-driven, with a strong emphasis on organization and follow-through.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



Email & Administrative Operations

* Monitor, organize, and maintain structured inbox systems

* Draft, send, and respond to professional emails using provided templates and brand guidelines

* Proactively follow up on outstanding emails, requests, and action items

* Flag priority items, identify next steps, and ensure timely resolution

* Maintain clear documentation and organization of email threads when needed



Calendar & Scheduling Support

* Manage and maintain the business calendar, including scheduling calls, vendor meetings, site visits, and deadlines

* Coordinate scheduling with internal team members as needed

* Follow established calendar guidelines and respect scheduling boundaries



Vendor & Trade Accounts

* Apply to new trade and vendor accounts

* Track approvals, account credentials, and relevant details

* Request samples, pricing, and written confirmations

* Maintain organized and up-to-date vendor records



Purchasing & Order Tracking

* Log purchases, invoices, and related documentation

* Upload receipts and supporting files

* Track order status, shipping, and deliveries

* Communicate with vendors regarding delays, issues, or discrepancies



Design & Operations Support Systems

* Upload products, brands, and client-associated information into design software (Programma)

* Maintain clean, organized project records, removing duplicate or outdated items

* Assist with product tracking and coordination of shipping/freight to receiving companies and delivery setup



Future Support (as the role evolves)

* Assist with backend support for the website, ShopMy, and social platforms

* Light content uploads and organization (no creative direction required)



REQUIRED SKILLS

* Strong written English and professional communication skills

* Extremely detail-oriented with strong organizational habits

* Comfortable working with email, spreadsheets, and online systems

* Able to follow established processes and checklists consistently

* Proactive, reliable, trustworthy, and calm under direction

* Comfortable working independently once trained



Bonus (Not Required):

* Experience with interior design, architecture, or creative studios

* Familiarity with tools such as QuickBooks, Programma, or similar platforms



HOURS & PAY

* 10–15 hours per week to start

* Flexible schedule (some overlap with U.S. Central Time preferred)

* $6–$10/hour, depending on experience

* Long-term role with opportunity to grow



1-WEEK PAID TRIAL

Final candidates will complete a one-week paid trial to ensure alignment in communication, execution, and workflow.



HOW TO APPLY

We expect a high volume of applications, so this step is designed to help us identify candidates who truly stand out. We will be selecting applicants for the second round based solely on your response to the prompts below, so please answer thoughtfully and thoroughly. (Please include your resume for future reference, but it will not be reviewed at this stage.)



PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING

1. Brief Introduction

Share something important to you, either personally or professionally, that reflects who you are and what makes you unique.

2. Relevant Experience

Tell us about your administrative or operations experience, including current or previous roles and the types of responsibilities you’ve handled.

3. Availability

Specify your working days and hours in U.S. time.

4. Favorite Organizational Tool

What tool, system, or method do you rely on most to stay organized, and why?



WHO THIS ROLE IS PERFECT FOR

Someone who:

* Loves structure, systems, and completion

* Enjoys organizing information and managing details

* Is happy working behind the scenes

* Wants a steady, long-term role supporting a creative business



**Application Instructions**

Please submit your application only through OnlineJobs.ph. Do not email our company directly. Applications sent outside of the platform will not be reviewed.

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 4a
description:

CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

title: Account Manager
description:
About Us 



LecsIT is a growing managed IT services company that helps small and mid-sized businesses stay secure, productive, and confident in their technology. We focus on long-term relationships, proactive support, and clear communication—not ticket factories or one-size-fits-all IT. 



The Role 



We’re looking for an Account Manager who thrives at the intersection of relationships and technology. This role is all about owning client relationships, translating business needs into IT solutions, and making sure customers feel heard, supported, and strategically guided. 



You’ll act as the primary point of contact for assigned clients, working closely with our technical team to ensure service delivery aligns with expectations while also identifying opportunities to improve the client’s IT posture.

What Success Looks Like 

-Clients feel confident, informed, and cared for 

-Renewals are smooth and predictable 

-Expansion opportunities are uncovered naturally through trust

Qualifications 

-2+ years in account management, customer success, or client-facing roles 

-Experience in IT, MSP, SaaS, or technology services strongly preferred

-Comfortable discussing security, compliance, and IT strategy at a high level

Bonus Points

title: NOW HIRING: REVENUE & OPERATIONS PERFORMANCE CONTROLLER (REMOTE)
description:
???? NOW HIRING: REVENUE & OPERATIONS PERFORMANCE CONTROLLER (REMOTE)



Company: Auto Worx LLC

Location: Remote (Philippines Preferred)

Reports To: Owner (Direct)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Compensation: $7 per hour (Full-Time)



------------------------------------------------------------



POSITION OVERVIEW



Auto Worx LLC is a multi-location automotive repair, fleet maintenance, body shop, and detailing company operating in Guam.



We are hiring a Revenue & Operations Performance Controller to monitor KPIs, review daily reports, observe operations via CCTV, and identify inefficiencies.



This is a performance-monitoring role.

Not an administrative VA.

Not customer service.

Not scheduling.



You will serve as the quiet intelligence layer of the company.



------------------------------------------------------------



CORE RESPONSIBILITY



• Monitor revenue performance

• Audit daily operational reports

• Observe staff productivity via CCTV

• Identify inefficiencies

• Bring structured solutions to the Owner

• After approval, deliver execution plans to management

• Ensure consistent implementation



Company Target: $250,000/month revenue.



------------------------------------------------------------



DAILY RESPONSIBILITIES



Morning (Before 9:30AM Guam Time):



• Pull billed hours per location

• Calculate technician efficiency %

• Review open estimates >24 hours

• Review service advisor conversion %

• Review inspection compliance %

• Review fleet labor worked vs billed

• Review accounts receivable aging

• Prepare concise KPI summary (Green / Yellow / Red)

• Send report to Owner + GM



Evening:



• Verify daily revenue dashboard submission

• Confirm 3Cs documentation

• Confirm labor lines before RO closure

• Confirm estimate follow-up logs

• Flag discrepancies



------------------------------------------------------------



WEEKLY RESPONSIBILITIES



• Fleet Billing Audit

• Advisor Performance Scorecard

• Location Leaderboard

• Efficiency Trend Report

• AR Aging Review

• CCTV Productivity Summary

• Process Improvement Suggestions



------------------------------------------------------------



KEY PERFORMANCE TARGETS TO MONITOR



• 96 total billed hours per day (company-wide)

• 8 billed hours per technician per day

• 85%+ inspection compliance

• 55–60% estimate conversion

• Fleet invoices sent same day

• AR under 14 days

• $250,000 monthly revenue target



------------------------------------------------------------



EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS



• Bachelor’s degree preferred (Business, Accounting, Finance, Operations, Data Analytics)

OR

• Strong experience in KPI monitoring and dashboard management



------------------------------------------------------------



EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS



• 2+ years experience in:

  - Data reporting

  - KPI monitoring

  - Operations tracking

  - Performance auditing

• Strong Google Sheets skills (required)

• Experience creating dashboards

• Comfortable reviewing CCTV footage

• Strong written communication skills



Automotive experience is a plus but not required.



------------------------------------------------------------



TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS



• Advanced Google Sheets

• Comfortable working with data

• Stable internet connection

• Ability to monitor live CCTV feeds

• Ability to work during Guam business hours



------------------------------------------------------------



PERSONALITY PROFILE



• Highly analytical

• Detail-oriented

• Process-driven

• Not conflict-avoidant

• Emotionally neutral

• Disciplined

• Proactive (not reactive)

• Comfortable escalating issues



------------------------------------------------------------



AUTHORITY STRUCTURE



This role:



• Reports directly to the Owner

• Does NOT discipline staff directly

• Does NOT override management

• Observes quietly and reports

• Brings solutions for approval

• Ensures consistency after implementation



------------------------------------------------------------



COMPENSATION



$7 per hour (Full-Time)



Performance bonus eligibility after 90 days IF:



• Company reaches $250,000/month

• KPI compliance exceeds 90%

• Implementation consistency exceeds 90%



No KPI = No bonus.



------------------------------------------------------------



HOW TO APPLY



Send resume to:







Subject:

Revenue & Operations Performance Controller Application



Include:

• Resume

• Sample KPI dashboard (if available)

• Brief explanation of how you enforce accountability

• Expected start date asap

description:

This role focuses on monitoring automations, fixing issues quickly when something breaks, and preventing problems before they happen.
