title: : BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT CENTER (BDC) AGENT – REMOTE
description:
???? NOW HIRING: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT CENTER (BDC) AGENT – REMOTE



Company: Auto Worx LLC

Industry: Automotive Repair, Fleet Maintenance, Body Shop, Detailing

Location: Remote (Philippines Preferred)

Reports To: General Manager

Employment Type: Full-Time

Compensation: $6–$8 per hour + Performance Bonus



------------------------------------------------------------



POSITION OVERVIEW



Auto Worx LLC is a multi-location automotive repair and fleet maintenance company operating in Guam.



We are hiring a Business Development Center (BDC) Agent to handle inbound leads, follow up on estimates, reactivate past customers, and increase appointment bookings.



This is a revenue-generating role.

Not a customer service role.

Not an admin VA.



Your job is to convert inquiries into scheduled appointments and approved jobs.



------------------------------------------------------------



CORE MISSION



Increase booked appointments.

Increase estimate approvals.

Increase customer reactivation.

Support the company’s $250,000 monthly revenue goal.



------------------------------------------------------------



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



INBOUND LEAD HANDLING



• Respond to
, Instagram, WhatsApp, and website inquiries

• Ask qualifying questions

• Provide accurate pricing information

• Book appointments immediately

• Follow up if customer does not respond



ESTIMATE FOLLOW-UP



• Call customers with open estimates older than 24 hours

• Confirm receipt

• Address price objections

• Offer approved discounts when authorized

• Push for approval and scheduling



CUSTOMER REACTIVATION



• Call previous customers in database

• Offer free inspections

• Offer seasonal promotions

• Rebook oil changes, brake services, A/C services



APPOINTMENT MANAGEMENT



• Fill schedule gaps

• Confirm next-day appointments

• Reduce no-shows

• Keep bays productive



------------------------------------------------------------



DAILY KPI TARGETS



• Minimum 30 outbound calls per day

• Minimum 20 inbound lead responses per day (if applicable)

• Minimum 8–12 booked appointments per day

• 60%+ estimate follow-up contact rate

• 55%+ estimate conversion target



------------------------------------------------------------



KEY PERFORMANCE METRICS



• Booked appointments

• Show-up rate

• Approved estimate rate

• Revenue influenced

• Call volume

• Response time



------------------------------------------------------------



REQUIRED SKILLS



• Strong English communication

• Confident phone voice

• Sales mindset

• Objection handling ability

• Comfortable following scripts

• Experience using CRM or shop software preferred

• Fast typing and organized documentation



Automotive experience is a plus but not required.

Sales experience is required.



------------------------------------------------------------



PERSONALITY PROFILE



• Competitive

• Goal-oriented

• Persistent

• Comfortable with rejection

• High energy

• Organized

• Disciplined

• Comfortable being measured by numbers



------------------------------------------------------------



WORK SCHEDULE



Full-Time

Must align with Guam business hours.



------------------------------------------------------------



COMPENSATION



Base: $6–$8 per hour



Performance Bonus Structure:



• Bonus for hitting monthly appointment targets

• Bonus for achieving estimate approval rate above 60%

• Bonus tied to revenue influenced



No performance = no bonus.



------------------------------------------------------------



HOW TO APPLY



Send resume to:







Subject:

BDC Agent Application



Include:

• Resume

• Brief description of your sales experience

• Voice recording introducing yourself (1–2 minutes)

• Expected hourly rate

• Available start date



Serious applicants only.

Performance-driven individuals preferred.

title: Creative AI Video Creator for Apartmenthub (real estate agency)
description:
???? Job Post (OnlineJobs.ph): Creative AI Video Creator (Concept + AI Video Production) — 
 (Remote)

About 




 is a fast-growing real estate & rental company in Amsterdam. We want social content that gets attention fast, teaches something useful, and turns viewers into leads.



We’re hiring a Creative AI Video Creator who can come up with concepts and produce high-quality short-form videos using AI video generation + stock + motion graphics.

? No raw camera footage required.



What you’ll do (Concept + Production)



Concept & scripting



- Create original content ideas and recurring series formats (weekly formats)

- Write hooks (first 1–2 seconds), short scripts, and storyboard beats

- Translate complex real estate topics into simple, engaging social content

- AI video production

- Generate cinematic clips using AI workflows (text-to-video and image-to-video)

- Combine AI clips with stock footage, screenshots, icons, and motion graphics

- Create 15–45 sec videos for TikTok / IG Reels / YouTube Shorts

- Add captions (EN + optional NL), sound design, pacing, and brand styling

- Produce multiple variations per concept (A/B hooks)



The style we want (important)

- We want content similar to what you can make in Artlist AI Toolkit: but also related to our brand and it needs to be funny as well as reliable

- prompt-based video creation (text-to-video / image-to-video)

- clean, cinematic-looking clips

- easy to understand storytelling flow

(Artlist explains the workflow: choose a model ? describe your video or use start/end frames ? adjust settings like duration/aspect ratio ? generate/refine.)



How to create good AI-generated videos (our expected workflow)

- We want you to follow a repeatable process like this:

- Start with the concept

- Pick one clear idea: “common mistakes renters make”, “how to win a rental”, “documents checklist”, etc.

- Write: Hook ? 3 beats ? CTA (very short)



Generate visuals (AI-first)



- Use text-to-video for establishing shots / cinematic sequences

- Use image-to-video when you need more control (create a strong image first, then animate it into video). Artlist specifically encourages generating an image before video for better results.

- Control quality with settings & iteration



Adjust duration/aspect ratio/resolution depending on model and output options



Generate multiple variations, keep the best, refine prompt, repeat (fast iteration is the game)



Edit for retention



- Hard hook in first 1–2 seconds

- Fast cuts, pattern interrupts, zooms, b-roll swaps

- Captions always on (clean, consistent style)

- Brand + conversion

- Consistent fonts/colors





? If you need specific software/tools/subscriptions, we will purchase them so you can do the job well.



Requirements:



- Strong portfolio with short form edits and/or AI-generated video examples

- Proven ability to create concepts, not just edit

- Good English communication

- Reliable delivery & responsiveness

- Ability to work with Amsterdam time overlap (CET/CEST) for feedback loops

- Output & workload

- Start: 12–20 videos/month, scale up if performance is good

- Typical delivery: 24–48 hours per batch (depending on complexity)



To apply (must include)



- Portfolio links (3–10 examples)

- What AI tools you use + your workflow



Fee for each video or hourly rate discussable.

title: Finance Analyst/ Account Analyst
description:
Atrium Housing is a mission-driven real estate development firm focused on creating affordable housing and vibrant communities. Our projects span mixed-finance and LIHTC transactions, and we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, impactful housing solutions while fostering a collaborative, supportive, and growth-oriented work environment.



At Atrium, you’ll have the opportunity to learn directly from experienced development professionals, work on meaningful projects that impact communities, and build a strong foundation for a career in real estate finance and affordable housing development.



Role Purpose



As a Development Analyst, you’ll support affordable housing transactions through financial underwriting, due diligence coordination, and application support. While LIHTC experience is a plus, it is not required—what matters most is your analytical mindset, attention to detail, and eagerness to learn.



Primary Value You’ll Bring:



* Accurate underwriting and financial modeling

* Organized and reliable diligence tracking

* High-quality application support for housing agencies, investors, and lenders



What You’ll Do



* Build and maintain detailed financial models and sources-and-uses statements (LIHTC exposure is a bonus)

* Prepare rent schedules, operating pro formas, and subsidy layering analyses

* Support preparation of state housing agency applications

* Coordinate third-party reports such as market studies, appraisals, environmental studies, and surveys

* Maintain due diligence and closing checklists

* Assist with investor, lender, and internal memos



What We’re Looking For



Technical Competencies:



* Intermediate to advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, modeling)

* LIHTC fundamentals (ideal, not required)

* Strong data organization



Behavioral Competencies:



* High attention to detail

* Responsiveness and proactive communication

* Strong accountability and ownership



Qualifications:



* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Real Estate, Economics, Planning, or related field

* 0–3 years of relevant experience

* Strong analytical and organizational skills

* Performance Metrics

* Accuracy and reliability of underwriting

* Timeliness of deliverables

* Quality and completeness of application materials

* Responsiveness to team and project needs



Why You’ll Love Working at Atrium Housing



* Impactful work: Contribute to projects that provide affordable housing and improve communities.

* Professional growth: Learn from experienced development professionals and gain exposure to mixed-finance and LIHTC projects.

* Collaborative culture: Work with a supportive, mission-driven team where your contributions matter.

* Flexible remote work: Balance your professional growth with personal life while collaborating across time zones.



To apply, answer these questions via vocaroo and send your link.

1. What struck your interest about the role?

2. What's your experience in handling finance especially in the construction industry?

3. Attach the LINK to your updated resume.

title: Virtual Medical Administrative Assistant
description:
***To apply - send a 2-minute loom reviewing your qualifications in the QUALIFIER paragraph to 
 fill out this application: 



QUALIFIER PARAGRAPH: 

If you love creating and improving SOPs, have a strong understanding of HIPAA requirements for patient communication, possess hands-on experience messaging,
ing, and calling patients, are familiar with tools such as 
, Jane App, and GoHighLevel, and speak and write English fluently at a professional level, also are available M-F from 9-5EST and have great internet connection, reliable computer, and back up connection - this role is for you.



We are seeking a highly reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Medical Administrative Assistant to support healthcare providers with patient communication, scheduling, EHR administration, and the creation and refinement of standard operating procedures (SOPs). This role requires prior healthcare administrative experience and comfort working in a clinical environment where professionalism, accuracy, and confidentiality are critical.



This role requires perfect English fluency. You will be communicating directly with patients daily via HIPAA-compliant messaging,
, and text, and must be able to write clearly, professionally, and empathetically at all times. Applicants must have prior experience communicating with patients through HIPAA-compliant channels and understand appropriate boundaries, tone, and escalation protocols.



You will manage patient communications, appointment scheduling, rescheduling, cancellations, calendar coordination, reminders, and follow-ups to support smooth operations for our clients. You will also work directly within electronic health record (EHR) and practice management systems to create and manage appointments, upload and organize documents, track attendance, and assist with preparing and distributing superbills. Accuracy and attention to detail are essential.



In addition to daily administrative responsibilities, this role is ideal for someone who loves building, documenting, and improving SOPs. You will help standardize workflows, clearly document processes, and continuously improve systems to ensure consistency across multiple providers and clients. A strong systems mindset and enjoyment of process documentation are required.



Availability is required Monday through Friday during U.S. business hours. This is not an asynchronous role. Responsiveness and reliability during those hours are mandatory.



The ideal candidate has previous experience in a medical office, clinic, or healthcare administrative role and a strong understanding of HIPAA requirements, patient confidentiality, and professional healthcare communication standards. You should be highly organized, dependable, comfortable managing multiple providers or clients, and confident working independently in a remote environment.



This is not a general virtual assistant role. Healthcare administrative experience is required, and applicants without prior medical or clinical administrative experience will not be considered.



This is an ongoing, long-term freelance position with consistent work for the right candidate. Hours, schedule, and compensation will be discussed based on experience and availability.

title: SEO Account Manager(Agency Experience)
description:
We're looking for a Senior SEO Specialist to join our growing Australian digital agency. We're after someone who lives and breathes SEO and at a broader level digital marketing, who is passionate about delivering great results and top-notch service to clients. You will be working with a team of highly experienced SEO practitioners servicing clients predominantly in Australia but also in the US. While this is a remote team there’ll be constant interaction with the rest of the team based in Australia but also colleagues in the Philippines. The hours of operation will be aligned with Australian Eastern Standard Time.



Area Ten is a global digital agency that services large corporates to fast-growing upstarts across Australia, Asia, and North America. One of the keys to our success lies in the quality of our staff. We have a strict policy of no junior staff which means you’ll be working with the highest caliber of colleagues in the industries, hence there is a scope for ample opportunities to learn and develop.



We are looking for someone who's highly analytical with hands-on technical SEO experience. Do not apply if you have just been doing link-building or SEO content writing. We need someone with at least 5 years of hands-on technical onsite SEO experience, ideally working on multiple sites at the same time in an agency environment. You need to have extensive experience working with GA as well as setting up and maintaining Data Studio Reports.



To be considered for this role you need to pass an Excel test which will test your data analysis skills.





The Role:



*Driving and assisting in executing on-site SEO programs for clients across multiple industries and geographies

*Analyzing client performance to gain insight into the health of an SEO program and to identify opportunities for improvement

*Staying abreast of industry trends and innovations to work out how they can be applied across our customers

*Communicating with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that SEO services are delivered in a timely and consistent manner



What we are looking for:



*A minimum of 5, ideally 10+ years of experience implementing successful SEO projects in an agency environment with larger clients i.e. that spend over $5K a month

*Should have spent the last 3 years at a digital, preferably SEO agency

*Highly analytical and data-driven

*Fluent written and verbal English skills

*Ability to work autonomously

*Strong attention to detail

title: Leasing & Resident Coordinator (Sales, Showings, & Collections Focus)
description:
Leasing & Resident Coordinator (Sales, Showings, & Collections Focus)



Job Overview

We are looking for a high-energy, sociable, and assertive Resident Coordinator to be the front-line voice of our property management operations. This is not a "behind-the-scenes" data entry role. You will be responsible for converting rental leads into tenants and ensuring our revenue is protected through professional, yet aggressive, rent collections.



The ideal candidate is a self-starter who doesn't wait for instructions. You should enjoy talking to people, have a "sales" mindset, and be comfortable holding firm, professional boundaries when tenants are past due.



Top Priority Responsibilities (The Core of Your Day)

- Lead Conversion & Sales: Respond immediately to rental inquiries. Your goal is to qualify leads and move them toward a showing as fast as possible.

- Virtual Showings: When a prospect arrives at a property, you will "meet" them via phone or video call to conduct the virtual showing, highlight property features, and answer questions in real-time.

- Assertive Collections: Make daily outbound calls to tenants with past-due balances. You must be comfortable with "firm" conversations to ensure payments are made, while remaining professional and following company policy.

- Reporting & Accountability: Lead the "Daily Huddle" by reporting your metrics (Leads in, Showings set, Collections status). You must be able to explain your results and your plan for the next 24 hours.

- Applicant Screening: Conduct thorough rental verifications by calling previous landlords and employers.



Secondary Responsibilities (Operational Support)

- Manage and update property listings across various platforms.

- Monitor 
 boards to ensure maintenance and operations tasks are moving.

- Run weekly/monthly reports on rent collected, late fees, and utilities.

- Update our CRM (TurboTenant/Brivity) with detailed notes on every lead and tenant interaction.



What We’re Looking For

- Fluent English (Verbal & Written): You must have near-native English fluency. You will be on the phone with American tenants and prospects all day; clarity and tone are essential.

- High "People Skills": You should be naturally kind, sociable, and able to build rapport quickly over the phone.

- The "Self-Starter" Trait: You don't need a manager to tell you to make your calls. You see a lead or a late payment and you take action immediately.

- Grit for Collections: You can handle "tough" conversations without getting flustered. You are persistent and results-oriented.

- Tech Savvy: Proficiency in Google Workspace, 
, and TurboTenant (or similar) is a major plus.



Work Schedule & Requirements

- Shift: Must be available to work Monday-Friday 9am-6pm Eastern Standard Time business hours.

- Environment: Must have a quiet home office, a noise-canceling headset, and a stable, high-speed internet connection (and a backup).

- Commitment: This is a long-term role for someone looking to grow with a stable company.

- Pay is every 2 weeks. 



To apply, please start your message with the words 'I am a self-starter' and include a 60-second voice recording introducing yourself.

Our company is building AI-powered operational systems across CRM, marketing, outbound prospecting, and client management. We want someone who can spin up AI agents, integrate them into real workflows, and continuously improve them as the AI landscape evolves.

You actively follow:

)

title: UI/UX Designer for Community-First Social App (iOS & Android)
description:
About the Project



We’re building a community-first social media app (iOS/Android) for the LGBTQIA+ community. Focused on belonging, emotional safety, and meaningful connections, the app aims to connect those without access to queer community in their everyday lives and who feel left behind by mainstream social media platforms.



The app prioritises human connection over performance and community over dating- or appearance-first mechanics. It’s designed to be inclusive and promote emotional safety, allowing users to express themselves, their interests, and build community without pressure, harassment, or fear of judgement.



We currently have a v1 prototype in Figma that’s ready for early user testing. We’re now looking for a UI/UX designer who can help refine the app’s identity, UX clarity, and overall cohesion — particularly around sensitive and high-impact flows like onboarding, profile setup, and early engagement with community-driven features such as posts and feed.



?



What You’ll Do

 • Leverage a strong UX and product mindset to review and iterate on an existing Figma prototype

 • Improve user flows to ensure they feel respectful, inclusive, and genuinely solve identified user challenges

 • Help define and refine the app’s visual and experiential identity

 • Collaborate closely with the founder, Product Manager, and soon-to-be onboarded engineering team throughout the design process

 • Prepare production-ready designs and support handoff from design to code (design files, documentation, specifications, assets, iteration support)

 • Continuously incorporate feedback from internal stakeholders and user testing insights



?



Required Experience & Skills

 • 4+ years of well-rounded UI/UX experience, including mobile iOS / Android applications

 • Prior work on consumer-facing products (social, community, content-driven platforms strongly preferred)

 • High proficiency in Figma (auto layout, components, design systems, collaboration workflows)

 • A product-oriented approach — you think about intention, impact, and user outcomes, not just visuals

 • Experience collaborating with engineers and supporting design implementation

 • Comfort working in an iterative, collaborative environment

 • Excellent written and verbal English communication



?



Community & Inclusion Context



Experience designing for queer, LGBTQIA+, or other marginalised communities is highly valued. Everyone is welcome to apply, but you should demonstrate:

 • Thoughtfulness around inclusive design, language, and identity-sensitive UX

 • Awareness of how standard patterns (e.g., onboarding questions, profile fields, interaction mechanics) can unintentionally exclude or alienate users

 • A genuine interest in designing spaces that prioritise emotional safety and consent



Allies and those who are part of the queer community are warmly encouraged to apply.



?



Nice to Have

 • Experience conducting and incorporating user research or usability testing

 • Mobile development experience (Swift, Kotlin, and/or Flutter)

 • Experience creating supporting assets (app store visuals, marketing materials)

 • Timezone availability between Europe and Australia



?



How to Apply



Please apply via
 (do not apply via platform messaging).



Send your application to:





Use the subject line:

UI/UX Designer – LGBTQIA+ App – [Your Name]



In your
, please include:

 1. A brief overview of your mobile UI/UX experience

 2. Links to relevant portfolio work (especially social, community, or identity-sensitive projects)

 3. A short note on how you approach inclusive or community-centered design

 4. Your hourly rate or project rate expectations

 5. Your current availability (hours per week + start date)

 6. Your timezone



To help us understand your product thinking, please also answer this short question:



What is one onboarding or profile design pattern you believe can unintentionally exclude users, and how would you redesign it?



Applications will be reviewed by both the Founder and Product Manager. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted directly.



?



Selection Process

 • Initial application review

 • First discussion (20–30 minutes)

 • Portfolio & skills discussion (approx. 1 hour)

 • Decision

 • ? 1 month contract to start, renewable pending successful collaboration

title: BUBBLE - WEB & APP DEVELOPER FOR SERVICE APP

Position Summary



We are seeking a skilled Bubble.io App and Web Developer responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining web and mobile applications using the Bubble no-code platform. The ideal candidate will transform business requirements into scalable, user-friendly digital solutions while ensuring performance, security, and reliability.



Key Responsibilities

1. Application Development

Translate business requirements into functional technical solutions.



2. UI/UX Implementation

3. Database & Backend Management

Configure privacy rules and user authentication systems.

4. API & Third-Party Integrations

Implement payment gateways and subscription systems.



5. Testing & Deployment

Monitor performance and resolve post-launch issues.



6. Maintenance & Optimization

Improve application speed, scalability, and security.



Troubleshoot bugs and implement fixes.



7. Collaboration & Documentation



Work closely with designers, product managers, and stakeholders.

title: Funnel Builder – Funnelish & Shopify (EU E-commerce)
description:
We are hiring a full-time Funnel Builder for our European dropshipping business.



We operate multiple product-based brands in the health, beauty, and problem-solution niches. We need someone who can build high-converting funnels — not just design nice pages.



What you will do



You will be responsible for building complete funnels using:



• Funnelish (advertorial + sales pages)

• Shopify + GemPages (product pages and landing pages)



Your work will include:



• Creating funnels from scratch

• Transliterating & adapting funnels into other EU languages (using our templates)

• Writing and adjusting copy to improve conversions

• Creating simple GIFs and images for pages

• Requesting and working with Shopify collaborator access

• Using ChatGPT and other tools to speed up production



Sometimes you will receive reference funnels.

Other times you will create new ones with minimal input.



What we are looking for



We are NOT looking for a typical web designer.

We are looking for someone who understands how sales pages convert.



You must:



• Have experience with Funnelish

• Have experience with Shopify + GemPages

• Be comfortable with copywriting and persuasion

• Understand conversion structure & buyer psychology

• Be able to localize content for European markets

• Work fast and follow instructions carefully



Paid Evaluation Task



Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a paid practical task.



This allows us to evaluate workflow, speed, and attention to detail in real working conditions.



Candidates who perform well will move forward to long-term collaboration.



Why work with us



• Long-term opportunity

• Stable workflow and clear processes

• Performance-driven environment

• Opportunity to grow with a scaling e-commerce team



To apply, Please include:

- Examples of funnels/pages you built (Funnelish or Shopify)

- Tools you use daily

- Your availability (hours per day)

- Your experience with EU market localization



Applications without examples will not be reviewed. Write to the start response: APPLY

title: Email Campaign Manager
description:
ABOUT GENFLOW

We are the world’s leading creator monetisation agency. We do everything from building brands with creators, launch digital platforms and work with the world's biggest brands. Our creators include Iman Gadzhi, Grace Beverley, Mike Thurston, Leana Deeb, Chris Williamson and many others. 



We believe having an audience is the most powerful asset you can have - it represents a ready made customer base to which anyone can sell the right product(s), and on which you can launch and scale a business fast. We’ve had a lot of success with this model, and manage a portfolio of 65+ creator brands across physical and digital products in fitness, fashion, beauty, nutrition and wellness, education and productivity. 



We are a fast-growing, ambitious company (team is a 100+ with global offices) that has achieved so much already, but knows there is still so much more opportunity to go after, which is why we are building out our high-performing team. 



Learn about Genflow > 

See our socials here > 
 



THE ROLE



The
 campaign manager will be responsible for managing and optimising our customer marketing channels across a portfolio of 10-15 different creator brands, with a combined customer list volume of several million.
 is a very important channel for us and which offers plenty more opportunities for growth and sales, so we are looking for a full stack
 marketer to join us to unleash a new wave of growth through this channel. 



For us,
 marketing goes beyond just sending ad hoc newsletters out to our lists. It’s about impacting user behaviour and purchase decisions through timely marketing interventions. It’s about attracting new customers into our marketing funnels with lead magnets and it’s about driving sales. You will work closely with the wider Growth, Marketing and Commercial teams.



Key Responsibilities:



- Own our
 campaign strategy end to end.

- Co-ordinating with designers and copywriters to deliver a combination of plain text and banner
s in accordance with brand guidelines

- Design and implement marketing campaigns that achieve best-in-class open and click through rates and drive sales

- Optimise campaigns based on performance

- Implement new popups on web to increase total list size

- Design the right frameworks for testing eg. different subject lines, preview text structures, CTAs etc to develop our insight into what works best for each brand

- Take responsibility for devising the
 marketing strategy and its execution and reporting of results.

- Pull and interrogate the relevant data points that will inform strategy, and harness the insight to put in place practical action plans to improve performance

- Report results weekly to line managers internally 





Ideal Skills + Experience:

- Proven experience in a specialist
 marketing role within the B2C digital content and / or e-commerce industries, preferably with experience in some of the following categories: fitness content platforms, courses and paid community platforms.

- Deep knowledge of designing, implementing, and optimising campaigns

- Analytical thinker and problem-solver with a deep understanding of the metrics and data, and A/B testing, and the ability to translate data into insight and action plans

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

- Strong copywriting pedigree, especially sales and conversion focussed copy

- Ability to create assets using eg Canva to support
s

- Strong organisational skills and attention to detail.



The kind of attitude we’re looking for:

- A naturally curious problem solver 

- The ability to work across multiple projects at the same time at pace

- Someone who really takes pride in their work and the quality of their output 

- A genuine willingness to roll up their sleeves and get work done and make things happen, whether it’s reporting, analysis, execution or jumping on a call with a client 

- A willingness to learn, improve and refine their craft

- Someone who’s naturally interested in creators, social commerce and social content 



Please note, we are looking for someone to start as soon as possible, ideally in the next 4-6 weeks.



To Apply please fill out the form:

title: Customer Service Representative – Remote (Full-Time/Part-Time)
description:
We are looking for an experienced and reliable Customer Service Representative to join our team. If you thrive in a fast-paced e-commerce environment and take pride in delivering excellent customer experiences, we'd love to hear from you.



About the role:

You will be handling customer inquiries via
 and chat, resolving complaints and issues efficiently, managing disputes and chargebacks, and ensuring every customer interaction reflects our brand values.



Requirements:

You have at least 2 years of proven customer service experience and are fluent in English — both written and spoken. You hold a relevant diploma or degree, which we will ask about during the interview process. You have hands-on experience handling disputes and chargebacks. You are also proficient in both Gorgias and Shopify. These are hard requirements — please do not apply if you do not have real working experience with these tools. We will ask specific questions during the interview to verify your knowledge of both platforms, and if it turns out you lack this experience, we will unfortunately not be able to move forward with your application.

You have a sharp eye for detail and deliver consistent, high-quality work without needing to be micromanaged. You are proactive by nature — when you spot a problem, you solve it rather than wait for instructions. And when dealing with frustrated or unhappy customers, you remain calm, professional, and solution-focused at all times.



Technical requirements:

You must have a high-quality webcam, a fast and stable internet connection, and a reliable computer. Please do not apply if you do not meet these requirements. If it turns out after hiring that these requirements are not met, we will unfortunately have to part ways, as consistent performance is non-negotiable for us.



Compensation & growth:

We start at $4 per hour, but we strongly believe in rewarding performance. As you grow with us, take on more responsibilities, and consistently prove your value, your compensation will grow with you. We are looking for someone we can invest in long-term.



How to apply:

Send us your CV along with a short introduction about your customer service experience, including how you have used Gorgias and Shopify in previous roles. We look forward to meeting serious and professional candidates who are ready to hit the ground running.

title: Remote Marketing Assistant – US-Based Better-For-You Food Brand
description:
Remote Marketing Assistant – US-Based Better-For-You Food Brand

Work-From-Home



About the Company

We are a growing US-based better-for-you ice cream brand sold across the United States. We're building something people are genuinely excited about – a healthier indulgence that doesn't compromise on taste – and our marketing team is at the heart of how we bring that story to life. We're a lean, fast-moving team where your work will be seen, your ideas will matter, and your impact will be real.



The Role

We're looking for a sharp, self-motivated Remote Marketing Assistant to join our team full-time. This is not a passive, task-ticker role. You'll be the voice of our brand to our customers every single day, managing social media communities, answering customer inquiries, and helping keep our marketing engine running smoothly. If you love social media, take pride in your writing, and thrive working independently – keep reading.



Your Schedule

This is a full-time remote position. You'll work one of the following shifts (US Pacific Time):



Option A: Wednesday – Sunday, 8:00 AM – 4:30 PM PST

Option B: Thursday – Monday, 8:00 AM – 4:30 PM PST



You must be available and actively online during these hours. Weekend availability is required for this role.



What You'll Be Doing

Customer Service (Daily Priority)



Monitor and respond to customer
s and SMS inquiries in a timely, brand-appropriate manner

Represent the brand with professionalism, warmth, and accuracy in every interaction



Social Media & Community Management



Assist with scheduling and publishing posts across all brand social media channels

Respond to DMs, comments, and engage with followers and consumers daily

Serve as the primary social media lead on Saturdays and Sundays

Support outreach and community-building efforts across platforms



Project & Asset Management



Track and organize marketing assets and company storage unit inventory

Maintain accurate records and support ongoing project timelines



Administrative Support



Data entry and digital file organization

 and calendar management for the CMO

Support the CMO on special marketing projects as needed





What We're Looking For



4 to 8 years of experience in marketing, social media, or a closely related field

Exceptional English communication skills – both written and verbal. You will be writing customer-facing messages daily; your English must be flawless

Strong attention to detail and the ability to meet deadlines without being micromanaged

Experience managing brand social media accounts (not just personal accounts)

High level of professionalism and the ability to take initiative

Reliable, fast internet connection – you must live in a major metropolitan area with stable, high-speed WiFi. We cannot consider applicants in rural areas with connectivity issues

Comfortable working independently across a remote team in a different time zone





Nice to Have



Experience in CPG, food & beverage, wellness, or consumer brand marketing

Familiarity with customer service tools, social scheduling platforms, or project management tools

Background in community management or brand voice development



Compensation



$1,200 – $1,300 per month (paid in USD)

Full-time, long-term position

Work-from-home





How to Apply

Please apply with the following:



1 Your updated resume

2. A brief cover letter (in English) explaining why you're a great fit for this role

3. Links to any social media accounts, pages, or campaigns you have managed professionally

4. Your preferred shift schedule (Option A or Option B listed above)



We are hoping to move quickly on this hire. Qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview shortly after applying.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Senior Delivery & Operations Lead (Fractional)
description:
**Remote | Fractional to start | WordPress services business**



---



## Overview



WP Support Specialists is a long-established WordPress support and services business with a small, capable remote team.



The support side of the business runs reliably, but when work becomes more complex such as web projects, custom development, or client escalations, the founder still gets pulled back into delivery.



This role exists to change that.



We are looking for a senior Delivery & Operations Lead who can take ownership of day-to-day delivery, coordination, and escalation handling so the business can run cleanly without founder involvement.



This is a fractional role to start, not because the role is small, but because the business is being restructured carefully and deliberately. As volume increases, responsibility and hours will grow with it.



Within the next 30 to 150 days, the goal is to:



- Remove the founder as the default escalation point  

- Run delivery day to day without founder involvement  

- Standardise how complex work is delivered  

- Create a delivery system that can scale without chaos  



---



## Why this role matters



For years, the founder has been the person who steps in when:



- Projects need steering  

- Scope needs protecting  

- Clients escalate  

- Delivery feels uncomfortable  



The goal is for you to become that person instead.



If this role is done well, the business can scale without becoming messy, and new opportunities can be pursued without dragging the founder back into the weeds.



---



## What success looks like



### In the first few months, you will:



- Own delivery escalation across support and projects  

- Handle complex or sensitive client situations so they feel looked after without founder involvement  

- Own delivery feasibility for websites and non-standard development work  

- Scope and price delivery work related to existing clients and projects  

- Own project delivery including scope, resourcing, timelines, and quality  

- Enforce delivery standards and boundaries with the team  

- Say no to work that should not be taken on  

- Grow the role in scope, hours, and responsibility  



### By day 30



- You are the default route for delivery questions and escalation  

- The team no longer goes directly to the founder for delivery decisions  

- You clearly understand where delivery still depends on the founder and why  



### By day 60



- Founder involvement in day-to-day delivery is minimal  

- You are confidently handling complex client and project situations  

- Delivery decisions are being made without founder input  



### By day 90



- Founder operational delivery involvement is under 5 percent  

- Delivery runs predictably with clear decision ownership  

- Escalation is the exception, not the norm  



---



## Time commitment and working style



- Approximately 3 hours per day  

- Every weekday (daily presence matters more than total hours)  

- Async-first using Slack, with a defined daily availability window  



You are paid for taking ownership and making decisions, not for completing a long list of tasks or filling hours.



---



## Out-of-hours escalation (important but rare)



Occasionally, urgent client or delivery issues arise outside normal working hours. This is not frequent, but it does happen.



In those situations:



- You are the default escalation owner  

- You d
 whether something genuinely requires immediate action  

- If it does, you take ownership of resolving or coordinating it  



This is not an on-call role, and you are not expected to monitor messages constantly.



However, when true emergencies occur, ownership does not pause.



Clear boundaries exist to prevent abuse, and the expectation is judgement, not availability.



---



## Who this role is for



This role is for someone who:



- Has already owned delivery in an agency or services business  

- Is comfortable making decisions others may disagree with  

- Enjoys fixing systems before scale  

- Does not need constant validation or direction  

- Is confident communicating with clients and teams  



You are expected to make judgement calls and challenge decisions when needed. This is a role with real responsibility, not a task-management position.



---



## What this role is not



- Not a sales role  

- Not a customer support role  

- Not a junior or learning position  

- Not a role where every decision is checked with the founder  



---



## Fractional nature and growth



This role starts fractional because:



- Support operations are already stable  

- Initial focus is on ownership, visibility, and control rather than volume  

- Web and development work will increase as lead generation ramps up  



As new work comes in, this role is expected to grow in both hours and responsibility. The intention is not to keep this small, but to build it properly.



If you are currently working elsewhere, we will want to understand:



- What you are doing now  

- How you would manage this role alongside it  

- How you would handle this role growing over time  



---



## How we work



- Remote, async-friendly team  

- Clear expectations and direct communication  

- Trust given upfront, backed by accountability  

- Founder available for alignment and escalation, not day-to-day supervision  



---



## What we are looking for



You will be a strong fit if you:



- Have run delivery or operations in a services or agency-style business  

- Are comfortable owning delivery and handling escalations  

- Can protect scope and say no when needed  

- Think in systems, not just tasks  

- Are calm under pressure and decisive when required  

- Have experience working with remote teams  



Experience with WordPress or similar digital services is important.



---



## How to apply, use the link below:

title: Senior Performance Ad Script Writer
description:
Senior Performance Ad Script Writer (Meta )



We are a fast-growing e-commerce team operating multiple direct-to-consumer brands across Meta and TikTok. Our growth is driven by aggressive creative testing, strong hooks, and data-backed iteration.



We are looking for a full-time Senior Performance Ad Script Writer who understands what actually converts.



This is not a role for generic copywriters. We are specifically seeking someone with deep experience in performance ad scripting, particularly in both VSL-style creatives and native UGC formats. You must be able to move confidently between structured direct-response storytelling and natural, scroll-stopping social content.



---



 Your Responsibilities



* Write high-converting Meta ad scripts on a daily basis

* Develop strong hooks, angles, and creative concepts

* Create structured VSL scripts for advertorial funnels

* Write natural, high-performing UGC scripts

* Translate product benefits into compelling paid-ad messaging

* Continuously iterate based on performance feedback

* Collaborate closely with our media buying and creative team



---



Required Experience



You must have proven experience in:



* Meta Ads script writing

* Direct-response copywriting

* E-commerce (physical products preferred)

* VSL structure and conversion psychology

* UGC ad formats that feel native and authentic



Strong bonus if you have worked in:



* Beauty, hair, or skincare

* DTC brands

* High-spend ad accounts

* Fast creative testing environments



---



 Application Requirements



To be considered, please include the following in your application:



* Links to your best-performing ad scripts (Meta or TikTok)

* Examples of VSLs that generated strong results

* Industries or products you have written for

* Approximate ad spend behind your winning creatives

* Your typical script turnaround time

Applications without clear proof of performance will not be considered.



---



What We Offer



* Attractive full-time compensation

* Performance-based upside

* Long-term collaboration opportunity

* Fast-moving, performance-driven environment

* High creative volume and testing velocity

* Direct impact on scaling campaigns



---



Next Step



If your profile is a strong fit, we will invite you to a short introductory call.



Please apply only if you are ready for a meeting this week, as we are looking to move quickly and get to know your experience and past results in detail.

Core working hours will regularly fall between 9 AM and 6 PM Eastern Time.

This is not a flexible or partially overlapping schedule.

Apply only if you have previous experience working overnight or US time hours and can sustain this schedule long term.

You will be required to explicitly confirm this during the application.



About Kressler Real Estate

Kressler Real Estate is a boutique real estate brokerage serving Central Florida. We deliver a high touch, detail driven experience for home sellers and buyers. Our clients expect clarity, responsiveness, and professionalism throughout the entire transaction.

This role supports one lead agent and plays a critical role in keeping transactions organized, clients informed, and operations running smoothly.



Position Overview

We are seeking a highly organized, proactive Virtual Transaction Coordinator to support real estate transactions, marketing coordination, and client care.

This role requires ownership, calm communication, and strong attention to detail. You will be deeply involved in contract to close processes and client communication.

This is a long term role for the right person.



Core Responsibilities

Transaction Coordination

-Manage buyer and seller transactions from contract to close

-Track deadlines and ensure documents are completed on time

-Schedule inspections, appraisals, walkthroughs, and closings

-Communicate with title companies, lenders, inspectors, and clients

-Proactively identify issues before they become problems



Marketing and Listing Support

-Coordinate listing photography, video, signage, and launch timelines

-Assist with social media scheduling and content organization

-Maintain CRM records and marketing campaigns

-Support
 marketing and client outreach



Client Care

-Serve as a first point of contact for client updates and questions

-Send thoughtful check ins, follow ups, cards, and gifts

-Support client events and relationship building initiatives

-Ensure every client interaction feels calm, professional, and intentional



Administrative Support

-Manage calendars,
 correspondence, and task tracking

-Prep the agent for listing appointments and contract writing

-Prepare presentations, reports, and market summaries

-Support special projects as needed



Qualifications

-Minimum 2 years experience in real estate support or executive assistance

-Strong understanding of the real estate transaction process

-Experience with Follow Up Boss, MLS, Dotloop, Asana, and Microsoft 365

-Comfortable with Canva and social platforms

-Highly organized with strong attention to detail

-Clear written and verbal communication

-Ability to work independently and manage deadlines remotely

-Proven ability to work US time hours or overnight schedules



Growth and Compensation

-Starting hourly rate within a competitive range for experienced real estate support roles

-Paid 30 day trial period

-Performance based bonuses

-Long term growth opportunities

-Paid time off

-Structured trial period with clear expectations



How to Apply



Please complete our written application in full by going here: 



Resumes are optional. We care more about how you think, communicate, and execute than about formatting or buzzwords.

Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.

Shortlisted applicants will be invited to the next step of our process.

title: Prospecting Outbound SDR (Cold Calling) / Lead Generation – Luxury Yachts
description:
About Us



We manage luxury yachts and handle premium client requests daily.



We are looking for a disciplined, fast, and structured Outbound SDR (Cold Calling) to generate qualified interest through outbound calls and pass serious opportunities to our sales team.



This is a structured, process-driven role within a premium environment.



About the Role



You will be making outbound calls to targeted contacts and turning cold outreach into qualified yacht charter inquiries.



Your responsibility is to:



Make outbound calls with a calm, premium tone



Spark interest and identify whether there is real charter intent



Collect essential high-level information 



Keep calls short, controlled, and professional



Write clean, structured notes and prepare a clear handoff summary



Maintain strict organization during your shift





This role requires clarity, control, and discipline, not aggressive selling.



What We Expect



Excellent spoken English (clear, professional, premium tone)



Confidence on the phone and ability to handle rejection calmly



Ability to keep conversations short and controlled



Structured thinking and strong attention to detail



Fast execution and consistency during shift



Comfort following a defined process



Very stable internet and professional working setup (quiet environment + headset; dual screen recommended)



Previous experience in cold calling.



Compensation



$500 per month (to start)



Long-term opportunity with growth potential



Working Style



We value:



Speed



Clean communication



Reliability



Maturity



Process discipline



It’s a structured, premium, and execution-focused role.



How to Apply



Please send:



A short introduction about yourself



Your previous outbound/calling experience



Your internet speed



Your availability (hours per day and days per week)



A 30–60 sec voice note in English (your natural phone tone)



We review applications carefully and only contact shortlisted candidates.

title: Video Editor (B-Roll Focused – Talking Head Content)
description:
Rate: $1.25 – $1.50 per finished minute

(More consistent work available for strong performance.)

We’re looking for a skilled video editor who specializes in adding strong, relevant B-roll to talking-head content (finance/political style videos). This role focuses on clean editing and visual storytelling — no complex motion graphics or heavy effects required.

This is a long-term opportunity for the right editor.



Editing Style

For the reference video: youtu.be/PXD4h8MWBMw

We want you to observe:

How B-roll is placed





How it visually supports what the speaker is saying





How it enhances understanding without distracting





The overall edit does not need to be fast-paced. However, the B-roll placement should feel dynamic, intentional, and well-timed.



What We’re Looking For

Strong, relevant B-roll that directly supports the message





Good judgment in choosing visuals





No random or generic stock footage





Clear storytelling through visuals





The speaker should still appear on screen at times — this should not be pure B-roll throughout. However, B-roll should be prioritized so we can clearly evaluate your selection and storytelling skills.

title: Senior Mental Health Biller
description:
Position: Senior Mental Health Biller

Employment Type: Full-time

Hours: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST



About Us:



Blue Kite Wellness is a reputable and rapidly expanding behavioral health organization dedicated to providing high-quality services to individuals and communities. We provide mental and behavioral health care to clients across Illinois. We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Senior Mental Health Biller to join our offshore team. This role requires strong English communication skills, as you will interact with U.S. insurance agencies, clinicians, and administrative staff.



Responsibilities:

> Prepare and submit claims for mental health services (telehealth, diagnostic evaluations, psychotherapy, IM+CANS, H codes).

> Manage primary and secondary claim submissions across multiple insurance carriers.

> Ensure claims include proper documentation and modifiers according to payer guidelines.

> Track and manage follow-up tasks, including claim corrections, pending authorizations, and missing documentation.

> Support submission of appeals within timely filing limits.

> Collaborate with U.S.-based clinical and administrative teams to resolve billing questions and discrepancies.

> Mentor or guide junior billing staff as needed.



Qualifications:

> Proven experience in mental health billing, including outpatient and clinic services.

> Knowledge of CPT, ICD, and mental health-specific codes (IM+CANS, H codes, psychotherapy, telehealth).

> Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple billing tasks and deadlines.

> Excellent English communication skills for interacting with U.S. teams and insurance agencies.

> Available to work within the 8AM - 5PM CST timeframe.



Preferred:

> Familiarity with U.S. Medicaid, MCO, or commercial insurance billing.

> Experience with wraparound programs or behavioral health-specific billing procedures.

> Prior experience in a senior or leadership role in billing.



How to Apply: Please submit the following:



1. Resume: Include relevant work experience and skills in mental health billing.

2. Cover Letter: Explain why you are a great fit for this role and your interest in mental health services.

3. English Communication Sample: A short voice or video recording introducing yourself and describing your experience. This helps us assess your English proficiency for interacting with U.S. teams and insurance agencies.

4. Availability: Confirm that you can work 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST.

5. Hourly Rate Expectation: Include your expected hourly rate within the $8–$15/hour range.

title: CX Specialist for Folly
description:
WHO WE ARE

We don’t just build dream homes and mansions— we create sanctuaries in nature where artists, athletes, and visionaries come to disconnect from the noise, recharge, and find inspiration to create what’s next.



WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS

- Starting at Php 45K+ (85K when you included our numerous benefits – Free Unemployment Insurance, Bonuses, etc.)

- 100% remote. Work from the beach, the mountains, or another city, you’re free!

- Low stress, no burnout

- Minimum of 24 days off a year. Not to escape life, but to live it on your terms

- Free & Full Healthcare coverage (HMO & Health Insurance)

- Free Mental Health coverage

- HAVE FUN at our team-building events in BGC with our Beverly Hills & Manila teams. We're talking about haunted houses, yoga, muay thai, painting, Korean BBQ, rooftop happy hours, dancing, and karaoke!



WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

- Follow-Up with Warm Leads: Talk to guests who already showed interest—like people who canceled a booking or stayed with us before. You’ll reach out by phone or
 to see how we can help, share new spots they might like, and help them plan their next stay. No cold calling, ever!

- AI Assistance: We use AI to identify users who either abandoned their cart during checkout or are no longer actively staying with us. The AI calls these users to see if they need help completing their booking. If they do, we connect them with you to finalize their reservation.

- Subscription: We offer a subscription plan that gives guests access to all of our locations. When someone calls to cancel, your job is to explain the benefits and value of staying subscribed, and help them make the most of their membership.



Apply here:

title: E-Commerce Merchandiser
description:
Company Overview:

We are a fast-growing direct-to-consumer fashion brand focused on modern, trend-led dresses for women aged 20–40. Our collections are built around strong aesthetics, commercial awareness, and consistent product evolution. We operate in a fully remote, performance-driven environment where speed, ownership and execution matter.



Role Overview:

We are hiring an E-commerce Fashion Merchandiser to lead the development and launch of weekly mini collections within our dresses category.

This role is responsible for identifying trend opportunities, structuring themed product drops, managing supplier communication, validating margins, and overseeing product launch execution from selection to site publication.

You will own the end-to-end merchandising process from product research and commercial validation to storytelling and launch coordination. This is a hands-on role requiring both strategic thinking and operational execution.



Key Responsibilities:

Identify trend-driven and commercially viable dress styles within our target market

Analyze competitor assortments and best sellers

Build cohesive mini collections with a clear theme and positioning

Communicate with suppliers to confirm pricing, timelines and feasibility

Ensure margin alignment before product approval

Coordinate imagery and product presentation standards

Monitor product performance and adjust assortment accordingly



Who We’re Looking For:

3+ years of experience in fashion merchandising, buying or DTC e-commerce

Strong commercial instinct and understanding of pricing structures

Experience working with suppliers and managing product pipelines

Ability to balance trend awareness with brand consistency

Highly organized, detail-oriented and execution-focused

Comfortable working in a fast-paced remote environment



Hourly rate: $10 – $20 per hour, depending on experience, expertise, and demonstrated commercial ability. Final compensation will be determined based on relevant experience in fashion merchandising, supplier management, trend research, and e-commerce execution. Performance-based incentives may be discussed based on impact and consistency.



As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Almond Muse does not discriminate against applicants or employees because of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, age, citizenship, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or because of any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
