title: Remote HR Manager / Recruitment Manager
description:
We are hiring a highly organised and experienced HR / Recruitment Manager to manage our end-to-end candidate screening process for our Australian retail operations.



This is a remote, full-time position. You will be responsible for attracting, screening, and interviewing candidates via Zoom before shortlisting only the best applicants for final in-person interviews in Australia.



You will act as the main gatekeeper in our hiring process.



Responsibilities:



- Post job ads and manage applications

- Screen resumes and shortlist candidates

- Conduct structured Zoom interviews

- Assess communication skills, reliability, and cultural fit

- Perform reference checks

- Present detailed candidate summaries to management

- Maintain organised recruitment tracking systems



Requirements:



- Proven recruitment / HR experience

- Strong interviewing and candidate assessment skills

- Excellent spoken and written English

- Highly organised and detail-oriented

- Confident, perceptive, and able to identify red flags

- Reliable internet connection and professional home setup



We are looking for someone who is smart, structured, and confident making hiring recommendations.



To Apply, please send:



- Your resume

- A short video (3-5 minutes) explaining why you are the right person for this role and what makes you excellent at assessing candidates



Applications without a video will not be considered.



Competitive salary based on experience. Long-term opportunity for growth.

title: Virtualization Specialist
description:
We are looking for a Virtualization Specialist who can design, deploy, and operate KVM-based environments—especially Proxmox VE and Linux virtualization stacks. You will support customer implementations, troubleshoot production issues, and help improve our virtualization architecture and operational standards.



Key Responsibilities

 • Design and implement KVM-based virtualization environments (with emphasis on Proxmox VE)

 • Configure and maintain virtualization hosts, clusters, and core services (compute, storage, networking)

 • Perform troubleshooting and root-cause analysis for performance, availability, and configuration issues

 • Support migration projects (physical-to-virtual, hypervisor-to-hypervisor, and workload moves)

 • Optimize virtualization performance and reliability (CPU/memory tuning, I/O, network throughput)

 • Define and maintain best practices: documentation, runbooks, backups, and recovery procedures

 • Collaborate with internal teams and customers on planning, delivery, and ongoing operations



Required Qualifications

 • Strong hands-on experience with KVM virtualization on Linux

 • Practical experience with Proxmox VE (setup, cluster, storage, networking, backups)

 • Solid Linux administration skills (systemd, networking, storage, logs, troubleshooting)

 • Experience with virtualization networking concepts (bridging, VLANs, bonding, routing/firewall basics)

 • Familiarity with storage options commonly used in KVM/Proxmox (e.g., ZFS, LVM, NFS, iSCSI, Ceph—any subset)

title: WANTED! The World's Most Detail-Oriented Remote Bookkeeping VA
description:
WANTED! The World's Most Detail-Oriented Remote Bookkeeping VA



When you apply, please make sure the subject line is: "I actually read the instructions"



Who We Are



We're Real Cents Organized, a growing bookkeeping firm that specializes in helping real estate investors and landlords build wealth through accurate, timely financials. Our clients aren't just property owners—they're building generational wealth, and they depend on us to give them the clarity they need to make smart decisions.



We're a small, tight-knit remote team (currently just two of us!) that values accuracy over speed, proactive communication, and continuous learning. We don't micromanage—we hire self-directed professionals who take ownership of their work and treat our clients' businesses like their own.



We're at an exciting inflection point: we have more clients than we can handle (great problem!), and we need a second VA to help us scale without sacrificing the quality our clients love.



Quick note: When you
 your application, please start your message with "I'm excited to apply for the bookkeeping position at Real Cents Organized" so we know your
 didn't get caught in our spam filter. We've had issues with legitimate applications landing in junk folders lately!



What We're Looking For



We need a detail-obsessed bookkeeping VA who lives and breathes QuickBooks Online, understands the unique challenges of real estate accounting, and can work independently to deliver accurate financials on tight deadlines.



This isn't data entry—this is strategic bookkeeping. You'll be the person who catches the $5,000 repair that should have been capitalized before it costs our client their tax deduction. You'll be the one who spots a missing security deposit refund before the landlord gets a call from an angry tenant.



If you're the type of person who color-codes their personal budget, triple-checks your work, and feels genuine satisfaction when a reconciliation balances to the penny—keep reading.



Job Description



Key Responsibilities



You'll be responsible for these specific deliverables each month:



1. Transaction Categorization: Accurately categorize monthly transactions across multiple rental properties in QuickBooks Online. You'll distinguish between repairs vs. capital improvements, allocate expenses to the correct properties, and ensure every transaction supports defensible tax positions.



2. Bank Reconciliations: Reconcile bank accounts monthly with 100?curacy. Find every discrepancy—even the $0.23 rounding errors—because precision matters.



3. Property-Level Financial Reporting: Generate clean, client-ready profit & loss statements for each rental property, plus consolidated owner statements, by the 5th of each month. No excuses, no delays—landlords make decisions based on these reports.



4. Compliance Tracking: Maintain meticulous records for security deposits, track vendor payments for 1099 preparation, and flag any transactions that could trigger IRS scrutiny.



5. Proactive Communication: Use ClickUp to update task status daily, flag discrepancies before they become problems, and ask clarifying questions when something doesn't add up. We'd rather you ask 10 "unnecessary" questions than make 1 incorrect assumption.



Qualifications



We care more about **how you think** than where you went to school. Here's what matters:



- QuickBooks Online fluency - You don't just know where the buttons are; you understand chart of accounts structure, class/location tracking, and can troubleshoot when things break.



- Real estate accounting experience - You've worked with rental properties before and understand the difference between a repair (expense immediately) and an improvement (capitalize and depreciate). Bonus if you've handled short-term rentals.



- Obsessive attention to detail - You're the person who notices when a transaction is coded to "Property A - Unit 1" when it should be "Property A - Unit 2." Small mistakes compound into big problems in this work.



- Strong written English - You'll communicate directly with ClickUp comments and occasional
s. We need clear, professional communication that builds trust.



- Self-directed work style - We're async and remote. You won't have someone looking over your shoulder. You need to manage your own time, prioritize ruthlessly, and deliver on deadlines without hand-holding.



- Technology comfort - Beyond QBO, you'll use ClickUp (project management and communication), Google Workspace, and ScreenshotMonitor (screen recordings).



Salary & Growth



Starting Compensation: $7/hour for 20-30 hours per week ($560-$840/month)



We know this is competitive for the Philippines market, and we're willing to pay for quality. After your 60-day trial period, here's the path forward:



- **Month 6+:** Increase to $8/hour + potential for full-time hours (40/week = $1,280/month)

- **Year 2:** Promotion to Senior Bookkeeper at $10/hour managing your own portfolio of clients

- **Year 3+:** Potential equity stake or profit-sharing as we scale (we want to build this together)



We don't just hire people—we invest in them. Our current VA has been with us for 18 months.  



Personality Profile



**You're probably a great fit if:**



- You get genuine satisfaction from balancing to the penny (and mild anxiety when things are off by $0.01)

- You're naturally skeptical—when something looks weird, you dig deeper instead of ignoring it

- You prefer written communication over phone calls (but can handle a video call when needed)

- You have a system for everything (folders, naming conventions, checklists—you're organized AF)

- You'd describe yourself as reliable, methodical, and low-drama

- You like working independently but aren't afraid to ask for help when you need it



**You're probably NOT a great fit if:**



- You're easily bored by repetitive tasks (bookkeeping has a rhythm—embrace it)

- You're a "big picture" thinker who hates details (we need detail ninjas)

- You need constant feedback and validation to stay motivated

- You struggle with deadlines or tend to procrastinate

- You're juggling 5 other clients and can only give us 5 hours/week of distracted attention



Skunks (Deal-Breakers)



Let's be honest about potential challenges upfront. These are non-negotiable, so please only apply if you're genuinely comfortable with:



1. Strict Deadlines: Month-end close is sacred. If reports are due by the 5th, "the 6th" isn't acceptable. Clients make financial decisions based on our timelines.



2. High Accountability: Every error has real consequences. A misclassified transaction could cost a client thousands in unnecessary taxes or trigger an IRS audit. We need someone who takes this seriously.



3. Occasional US Business Hours: Most work is async, but you may need to join tea
etings during US Eastern Time business hours (which means early morning if you're in the Philippines). This won't be daily, but maybe 2-4 times per month.



4. 60-Day Trial Period: We're investing heavily in finding the right person (hence this detailed job posting!). The first 60 days are a mutual evaluation. If it's not working for either of us, we'll part ways professionally—no hard feelings.



5. Real Estate Focus: If you're looking to do general bookkeeping across industries, this isn't the role. We specialize in rental properties, and you'll need to develop deep expertise in this niche.



Our Values



These aren't just words on a wall—we actually make decisions based on these:



1. Accuracy Over Speed

We'd rather you take an extra hour to get it right than rush and create cleanup work. Slow is smooth, smooth is fast.



2. Proactive Communication

Don't wait for us to ask. If you see a problem, flag it. If you're unsure, ask. If you'll miss a deadline, tell us ASAP so we can plan.



3. Continuous Learning

Tax laws change. QBO adds features. Real estate strategies evolve. We expect you to stay current through webinars, articles, and training (which we'll provide/fund).



4. Client-First Mindset

Our clients are building generational wealth for their families. Treat their money with the same respect you'd want someone to treat yours.



5. Trust & Ownership

We don't micromanage. We hire adults, give them the tools and context they need, and trust them to deliver. In exchange, you own your results—good and bad.



To Apply



Here's what we need from you (this is a test—follow the instructions exactly):



1.
 Subject Line

"I actually read the instructions"



If your subject line is anything else (like "Bookkeeping VA Application"), we'll know you didn't read this carefully—and attention to detail is literally the job.



2. Resume

- File name: `FirstName_LastName_BookkeepingVA.pdf`

- Example: `Maria_Santos_BookkeepingVA.pdf`

- Highlight your QuickBooks Online experience and any real estate/property management clients

- Keep it to 1-2 pages max—we value clarity over length



3. Personality Assessment

Take the free 16Personalities test at 
 and include your 4-letter result (e.g., ISTJ, ISFJ) in your
. We use this to understand work style, not to exclude anyone—there's no "right" answer.



4. Creative Question

Answer this in 2-3 sentences within your
:



"If you were a QuickBooks report, which one would you be and why?"



(Seriously. We want to see how you think about the work, not just your resume credentials.)



5. Video Introduction

Record a 60-second Loom video (
 is free) covering:

- Your name and where you're based

- Your QuickBooks Online experience (how many years? what industries?)

- One example of a costly error you caught before it became a problem

- Why you're interested in specializing in real estate bookkeeping



Include the Loom link in your
.



6. Sample Work (Optional, but Impressive)

If you have any property-level P&Ls, reconciliation screenshots, or examples of your QBO work (with client names redacted), include them. Show us what "excellent" looks like in your book.



What Happens Next?



Here's our hiring process (transparent, fast, and designed to avoid wasting your time):



Week 1: We'll review applications and respond within 3 business days. If your application follows instructions and looks strong, we'll invite you to a paid trial project.



Week 2: Trial project ($20 for ~2 hours of work). We'll give you access to a QuickBooks sandbox with realistic scenarios. This lets you see the actual work, and lets us evaluate your skills beyond a resume.



Week 3: Top 2-3 candidates from the trial project will have a 30-45 minute Zoom interview. We'll discuss the work, your trial project, and cultural fit.



Week 4: We'll make an offer, finalize the contractor agreement, and get you onboarded!



Total timeline from application to start date: 3-4 weeks max.



Why You Should Apply (Even If You're Nervous)



Look, we know imposter syndrome is real. You might be reading this thinking, "I don't check every single box—should I even apply?"



Here's our take: If you're detail-oriented, have solid QBO skills, and are willing to learn real estate accounting specifics, we want to hear from you. We'd rather teach someone the technical stuff (we can train) than try to teach attention to detail or work ethic (you either have that or you don't).



The fact that you read this entire job posting (it's long—congrats if you made it here!) suggests you're thorough. That's exactly what we need.



Ready to Apply?



Send your application to: 



Subject line: "I actually read the instructions"



Include:

1. Resume (FirstName_LastName_BookkeepingVA.pdf)

2. Personality type (from 
)

3. Answer to the QuickBooks report question

4. Loom video link (60 seconds)

5. Optional: Sample work



Application deadline: March 12, 2026 (applications reviewed on a rolling basis)



We're excited to find someone who nerds out about clean books as much as we do. If that's you, hit send—let's build something great together.



P.S. - If you're thinking "This job posting is way too long"... you're probably not detail-oriented enough for this role. If you're thinking "I love how thorough this is—it shows they actually care about finding the right fit"... we're going to get along great.????

title: Own Sponsorship Revenue – 20% Commission – 1M Subscriber YouTube Brand
description:
We run a long-form storytelling YouTube brand with approximately 1 million subscribers and a highly engaged audience.



The audience exists.

The reach is proven.

The ad inventory is already there.



What does not exist yet is someone fully owning sponsorship revenue.



That is the opportunity.



What You Will Do



• Identify brands aligned with our audience

• Build and manage outbound outreach

• Pitch sponsorship placements confidently

• Negotiate terms

• Close deals

• Build and refine a repeatable sponsorship pipeline



You own the outreach and closing process.



You are responsible for generating revenue.

Final approvals provided when needed.



Compensation



20% commission on every deal you close.



Example:



Close a $3,000 deal ? You earn $600.

Close 4 per month ? $2,400/month.

Close larger deals ? Earn more.



There is no cap.



You are monetizing an existing 1M subscriber asset, not building from zero.



Who This Is For



This role is for someone who:



• Wants autonomy

• Is comfortable with outbound sales

• Thinks in revenue, not hours

• Is motivated by earning, not clocking in

• Wants upside directly tied to performance



If you need guaranteed salary, this role is not for you.



If you want ownership and uncapped upside, it is.



To Apply



Send:



A short summary of your sales experience

title: Patent Legal Assistant
description:
A Legal Assistant (Patent) plays a crucial role in supporting the legal team, particularly in intellectual property (IP) matters, with a focus on patents and occasional involvement in trademark cases. This role involves assisting attorneys and patent agents in various aspects of patent and IP law, including research, documentation, and administrative tasks. The primary responsibilities of a Patent Paralegal include:



Key Responsibilities:

1. Patent Filings: Provide support to external legal counsel in the submission of patent applications in jurisdictions that mandate filings exclusively by attorneys. Prepare, review, and file patent applications with the appropriate patent or intellectual property offices whenever possible. Ensure compliance with filing requirements and deadlines.



2. Patent Prosecution Support: Assist in managing patent prosecution activities, such as tracking deadlines, preparing responses to office actions, and communicating with patent examiners and/or external counsel.



3. Patent Search and Analysis: Conduct patent searches to assist in the evaluation of patentability and patent infringement issues. Summarize and present findings to legal professionals and/or external counsel.



4. Document Management: Organize and maintain intellectual property related documents, including but not related to patent portfolios, external counsel correspondence, and related paperwork. Manage electronic and physical files efficiently.



5. Deadline Compliance: Maintain and update patent docketing systems to ensure accurate tracking of patent deadlines, including maintenance fees and annuities.

6. Communication: Prepare correspondence for external counsel and internal tea
mbers to provide updates, gather information, communicate instructions, and facilitate collaboration on patent and IP matters.



7. Trademark and Copyright Assistance: Provide support in various trademark-related tasks, including conducting trademark searches, preparing trademark applications, and managing trademark maintenance. Additionally, assist with copyright tasks, such as advising on copyright registration, submission of documents and requirements under copyright laws, and aiding in the enforcement of copyright protections.



8. Legal Research: Conduct legal research into matters pertaining to patent and intellectual property law, ensuring continual awareness and understanding of evolving regulatory frameworks, case law, and best practices.



9. Administrative Support: Handle administrative tasks, such as billing, scheduling, and preparing reports and other duties as required by the legal team.



Qualifications:

* A bachelor's degree in a related field is often preferred.

* Paralegal certification that allows them to prepare and/or prosecute patent applications.

* Experience in Patent and IP law.

* Proficiency in legal research, patent databases, and document management software.

* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with legal professionals and clients.

* Knowledge of patent prosecution procedures and USPTO rules and regulations.

* Familiarity with intellectual property law in multiple jurisdictions (a plus, but not always required).

title: Compliance and Documentation Coordinator
description:
Overview

The Compliance and Documentation Coordinator is responsible for organizing, maintaining, and standardizing the company’s digital documentation across all departments. This role ensures that files, records, and reference materials are properly structured, easily accessible, and consistently updated — supporting smooth collaboration and operational efficiency across the organization.

mbers on proper file management practices and document handling.

Company Overview



Bilsmidigt is a fast-growing online used-car dealer in Sweden. We sell cars fully online, offer free home delivery, and focus on creating a smooth, transparent customer experience. We operate with strong processes, modern tools, and a remote first mindset. As we grow rapidly, we are building a detail driven operations team to support scale.

s, calendar coordination, vendor comparisons including price and lead time, and basic cost tracking.

title: Financial Operations Analyst
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Employment: Full-time

Salary: $500/month

Time zone: Stockholm time



Company Overview



Bilsmidigt is a fast-growing online used-car dealer in Sweden. We sell cars fully online, offer free home delivery, and focus on creating a smooth, transparent customer experience.



Behind the scenes, our business has many moving parts—car sourcing, reconditioning, logistics, sales, and finance. This role is critical in making sure our numbers are accurate, our margins are protected, and small financial issues don’t turn into big losses.



Role Purpose



Your main goal is to reduce money leakage by catching small financial inconsistencies, improving control routines, and ensuring our operational data in Airtable matches our bookkeeping system (Fortnox). You will help make our margins, inventory days, and KPI dashboards reliable so leadership can make confident decisions.



Key Responsibilities



Financial Controls & Reconciliation

-Run weekly and monthly financial checks to detect

-Missing credits or refunds

-Duplicate or incorrect invoices

-VAT or pricing errors

-Unbilled work or add-ons

-Mismatches between sold cars, payments, and recorded revenues

-Reconcile Airtable with Fortnox (costs, revenues, car-level profitability) and follow up until issues are fully resolved.



Airtable Ownership

-Maintain and improve our Airtable base (fields, formulas, views, and interfaces).

-Ensure data is structured correctly to flag issues early and support accurate reporting.

-Help improve or build automations where useful to reduce manual errors.



KPI Reporting

-Build and maintain a weekly KPI scorecard, including

-Expected vs actual margin per car

-Inventory days

-Reconditioning cost variance

-Add-ons and extra revenues

-Ensure KPIs are accurate, consistent, and easy to understand.



Invoice Pre-Approval & Admin Support

-Perform invoice pre-approval before final approval

-Verify invoices against internal operational updates (e.g. work completed by partners or contractors)

-Resolve unclear items directly with the relevant team or external partner before escalation

-Support admin work with structure, checklists, and follow-ups.



How the Role Evolves



This role will evolve over time. You should be comfortable shifting focus toward the biggest financial or operational problems in the company, ensuring each improvement delivers real impact.



Requirements (Must-Haves)



-Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills with high attention to detail.

-Experience using Airtable (views, formulas, interfaces).

-Comfortable reconciling data across systems and following issues through to completion.

-Good English communication skills.

-Proactive, structured, and reliable.



Nice-to-Haves



-Experience with bookkeeping or accounting systems (Fortnox or similar).

-Background in operations, finance support, or audit-style roles.



Work Setup



-Remote

-Long-term role

-Stable workload with room to grow and take ownership

title: Amazon Product Researcher (Online & Retail Arbitrage)
description:
About Us

We are a growing ecommerce business focused on profitable online and retail arbitrage on the Canadian Amazon marketplace. Our goal is to consistently source high-margin products and build a scalable operation. We are seeking a detail-oriented, analytical, and proactive Product Researcher to help uncover winning opportunities.



Position Overview

As an Amazon Product Researcher, you will be responsible for finding products with strong resale profitability on Amazon Canada. This is a results-driven role — your research directly impacts revenue.

You will work independently using tools such as Keepa and RevSeller to analyze product viability, pricing history, sales performance, and competitive landscape. The role offers flexible hours, allowing you to work when it suits you.



Key Responsibilities

*Conduct product research for online and retail arbitrage

*Analyze pricing history and sales velocity using Keepa

*Evaluate product profitability and ROI using RevSeller

*Screen products for eligibility and compliance with Amazon policies

*Accurately match products between supplier websites and Amazon listings

*Report findings clearly by entering complete and accurate data into Google Sheets

*Communicate progress, issues, and questions clearly via chat/email and regular check-ins



Mandatory Requirements

? Fluent or proficient in written and spoken English

 ? Fast, stable internet connection and a reliable computer

 ? Proven experience with Amazon product research for arbitrage

 ? Strong ability to accurately match products between suppliers and Amazon

 ? Comfortable using Keepa and RevSeller

 ? Ability to analyze ROI, sales rank, pricing history, and competition

 ? Strong analytical skills and exceptional attention to detail

 ? Ability to work independently and manage time effectively

 ? Willingness to learn quickly and take feedback seriously



Nice to Have

? Familiarity with Canadian marketplace nuances, including pricing differences, seasonal trends, stock availability, and common retail/online sources



Salary & Hours

*Starting at $3–$5 USD per hour (part-time)

*Rate depends on experience and performance

*5-hour paid trial period during the first week

*10 hours/week guaranteed after successful completion of the trial

*Opportunity for rate increases and transition to full-time based on results



What You’ll Get

? Fully remote role

? Flexible work schedule

? Guaranteed hours after trial period

? Performance-based growth opportunities

? Supportive, long-term collaboration



How to Apply

*Please submit the following:

-Your CV/Resume

-A short introduction describing your Amazon product research experience

-A brief list of tools you’ve used

-Examples of past product leads you’ve sourced



In your application
, start your message with the word “Maple” so we know you read the full job post.



NOTE: You will be asked to complete a short sample task. Successful completion is required before being offered a role.



Application subject line:

 Amazon Product Research VA – [Your Name]



Optional (but a big plus):

 Include a short 1–3 minute video introducing yourself and explaining your Amazon VA experience.



We are looking for someone who wants to grow with us long-term. If you are detail-oriented, comfortable with numbers, and experienced in Amazon product research, we would love to hear from you.

title: Junior Operations Coordinator
description:
Date With the Muse



[
](
)



If you can commit to and live with the following principles, then you are the type of person who will be successful and help our company thrive. If you feel this level of engagement is not right for you or that you’re not willing or able to participate with us at this level, we are not a good fit for you.



Our expectation is that you will take the steps necessary to do what you say you are going to do and be accountable for your actions. You are committed to excellence and take pride in a job well done.



We understand that not every person is ready for this level of performance and we appreciate the honesty of those who d
 this is not the right place for them. On the other hand, you would make an ideal candidate to join our company if you are willing to commit to the following principles:



- Accountability: see it, own it, solve it, do it

- Become part of the solution

- Respect for others and their feelings

- Act now.

- Ask the question: “What else can I do?”

- Ask the questions: “What coaching do you have for me?” and “What can I do better?”

- Personal ownership and pride

- Reject average

- Show others that you care



This is not a virtual assistant role.



This is a structured operational coordination role for someone with project management or operations experience who understands sequencing, readiness, and follow-through.



You are not here to “help where needed.”



You are here to ensure the company runs cleanly.



---



## The Real Role



You are the traffic controller of the company’s time resource.



Your responsibility is to ensure:



- The right people are in the right place

- At the right time

- With the right materials

- Fully prepared



Across clients, coaches, the CEO, and potential clients.



Meetings do not proceed without readiness.



Deadlines do not pass silently.



Follow-ups do not disappear.



You protect operational flow.



---



## Core Responsibilities



### 1?? Calendar & Readiness Enforcement



You do not just manage calendars.



You:



- Perform pre-meeting readiness checks

- Confirm prerequisites are complete

- Ensure materials are attached in advance

- Validate participant readiness

- Prevent dependency errors

- Escalate when sequencing is wrong



If a meeting is not ready, it does not proceed.



---



### 2?? Cross-Team Coordination



You ensure:



- Coaches have what they need before sessions

- Clients receive required prep materials

- The CEO is not blindsided

- Deliverables are tracked and owned

- Commitments are visible

- Follow-ups are documented and confirmed



You are the continuity layer between tea
mbers.



You prevent dropped balls before they fall.



---



### 3?? Client & Team Communication



Strong written communication is essential.



You must be able to:



- Write clear, concise updates

- Ask clarifying questions

- Confirm understanding before execution

- Document decisions accurately

- Escalate professionally without drama

- Communicate boundaries clearly



You do not assume.



You confirm.



---



### 4?? Help Desk & Operational Support



You:



- Route tickets accurately

- Respond using existing SOPs

- Escalate policy-related issues

- Identify recurring friction patterns

- Flag documentation gaps



You protect the client experience from preventable errors.



---



### 5?? Execution with Verification



You:



- Follow checklists precisely

- Test links before marking tasks complete

- Verify time zones and views

- Attach proof of completion

- Complete recurring tasks without prompting



If it’s on the checklist, it gets done.



Without reminders.



---



## Non-Negotiable Traits



- Strong executive function

- Exceptional follow-through

- Structured thinking

- Pattern recognition

- Calm escalation when unclear

- High personal accountability

- Clear, concise written communication

- No reassurance-seeking submissions



You do not require reminders to complete standard work.



---



## What This Role Is NOT



- Not an inbox babysitting job

- Not a creative improvisation role

- Not a “help wherever needed” assistant

- Not a reminder-dependent position

- Not a reactive firefighter role



---



## KPIs



- 100% of repeat tasks completed without prompting

- 0 preventable client-facing errors

- Meetings occur only when ready

- Escalations happen before deadlines

- No “Was this done?” follow-ups required

- Clear written updates with minimal back-and-forth



---



## 30 / 60 / 90 Days



**30 Days**



- Master core SOPs

- Run repeat tasks independently

- Demonstrate clean written communication



**60 Days**



- Independently manage ticket flow

- Enforce readiness standards consistently

- No repeat execution errors



**90 Days**



- Fully trusted operational filter

- Prevents issues before escalation

- Ensures the CEO’s time is protected



---



## Who This Is For



You likely have:



- Project management or operations coordination experience

- A track record of reliable process execution

- Comfort enforcing standards

- Pride in zero-defect work

- Strong written communication skills

- Experience managing sequencing and dependencies



You enjoy being the stabilizer in a fast-moving environment.



---



## Who Should Not Apply



- If you need reminders to follow procedures

- If you frequently miss checklist items

- If you avoid escalating unclear situations

- If you prefer improvisation over structure

- If you struggle with consistent communication



---



## Growth Path



Strong performers who demonstrate systems thinking and communication clarity may grow into broader operational responsibility over time.



Execution discipline comes first.



---



---



## To Apply



Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. To express interest please submit 



a cover letter addressed to the CEO detailing why you are uniquely qualified for this role,



a resume,



and a DISC profile 



 materials to 
 with the headline OPS



Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis. This position begins ASAP for the right candidate. 



Applications received through this platform/website will not move forward.



---

title: SEO Specialist (Singapore Market Focus – Home Improvement)
description:
SEO Specialist (Singapore Market Focus – Home Improvement)



Company Overview – 338aircon.sg



338aircon.sg is a Singapore-based air-conditioning service provider specializing in installation, servicing, repair, and maintenance for residential and commercial properties. Operating in Singapore’s highly competitive home improvement market, the company is focused on building strong organic visibility, dominating local search results, and ranking **Top 3 for high-intent home improvement keywords in Singapore**.



This is a long-term role for an SEO professional who deeply understands the Singapore market and can consistently deliver measurable organic growth.



---



Role Objective



Your primary goal is to rank our business in the Top 3 Google search results for priority Singapore home improvement and aircon-related keywords, driving qualified leads and sustainable organic traffic.



?? Only candidates with proven Singapore SEO experience will be considered.



---



Key Responsibilities



* Develop and execute SEO strategies **specifically targeting the Singapore market**

* Conduct **Singapore-focused keyword research** (local intent, service-based searches)

* Optimize website content, landing pages, and service pages for conversions

title: $400(US) - 10 Day Gig - WordPress (Bricks Builder) Developer – Site Rebuild & Optimization Sprint
description:
???? WORDPRESS (BRICKS BUILDER) DEVELOPER

$400 FIXED-PRICE SPRINT (10–14 DAYS)

Site Rebuild + Blog Deployment + Performance Optimization



OVERVIEW



We are rebuilding an existing live site from Squarespace to WordPress (Cloudways hosting) using Bricks Builder.



This is a structured 10–14 day sprint with clearly defined deliverables and quality standards.



The current site will be used as a reference. The WordPress rebuild must improve structure, modularity, performance, and scalability — not just replicate layout.



This is a fixed-price sprint: $400 upon successful completion and approval.



?



PROJECT OBJECTIVE



Rebuild and optimize the site in WordPress using Bricks Builder with:



• Clean modular architecture

• Production-ready blog framework

• Performance baseline (Core Web Vitals aware)

• Structured SEO foundation

• Tracking stack implementation

• Controlled animations

• Redirect mapping + clean launch



?



SCOPE OF WORK



1. WordPress + Bricks Implementation



• Configure WordPress on Cloudways (server provisioned)

• Use Bricks Builder (licensed + installed)

• Build modular global header + footer

• Create reusable components (CTA blocks, testimonial sections, content grids)

• Implement consistent spacing system

• Ensure responsive behavior across desktop, tablet, mobile



2. Pages to Rebuild



• Homepage

• Service Page – Disability Compensation

• Service Page – Aid & Attendance

• Pricing Page

• Blog Index Page

• Blog Single Post Template

• Required admin pages (About, Interest, Thank You, Privacy, Terms, etc.)



3. Blog Framework



• Blog index template

• Single post template

• Dynamic Table of Contents

• Category structure

• Author box

• Breadcrumb navigation

• Related posts section

• Clean URL structure

• XML sitemap verified in Search Console



4. Testimonials System



• Custom Post Type for Testimonials (preferred)

• Supports name, text, optional rating

• Grid layout (service pages)

• Optional slider layout (homepage)

• Editable inside WordPress admin

• Basic review schema markup



5. Controlled Animations (Limited Scope)



• Hero text rotation (1 location)

• Number count-up animations (up to 3 sections)

• Bar fill animations (up to 2 sections)

• One radial/circle chart animation

• Must be lightweight, performant, and mobile-safe



6. SEO + Performance



• Install + configure Rank Math

• Basic on-page SEO setup

• Schema baseline

• Image compression

• Caching configuration

• Remove unused CSS/JS where possible

• Font optimization

• Target Lighthouse score:

• 85+ mobile

• 90+ desktop



7. Tracking + Integrations



• GA4 setup + verification

• Meta Pixel setup

• Google Search Console connection

• Google Ads verification

• Jetpack configuration



8. QA + Launch



• Cross-browser testing

• Mobile testing

• Redirect mapping from Squarespace URLs

• Broken link audit

• Clean transition with minimal downtime



?



QUALITY EXPECTATIONS



• Clean backend structure (no unnecessary plugins)

• Logical template naming and organization

• No layout inconsistencies

• One structured revision round after staging delivery

• Short Loom walkthrough upon project completion



?



DEFINITION OF DONE



Project is complete when:



• Site is fully live on WordPress

• All listed pages rebuilt and functioning

• Blog fully operational

• Tracking verified working

• Redirects functioning

• Performance baseline achieved

• No major layout inconsistencies



Payment is issued upon full completion and final approval.

No partial “90% complete” delivery.



?



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



• Strong Bricks Builder experience

• Custom WordPress builds (not theme flipping)

• Experience migrating from Squarespace

• Performance optimization knowledge

• Clean, structured implementation style



Portfolio required.



If successful, additional sprint projects are available.

title: Digital PPC Advertising Executive
description:
We are seeking a PPC Digital Advertising Executive to support our Performance Marketing team in a full time position.



This is a great entry position for anyone with limited experience in Pay Per Click roles and is eager to sharpen their skills and deepen their knowledge along side seasoned professionals. You ideally have a minimum of 1 year of experience in a PPC role.



As a PPC Digital Advertising Executive, you will be responsible for various tasks and duties related to PPC set up, day to day management and reporting.



This role can lead to a more senior position over time for those that apply themselves and learn methodologies.



This will include:



* Monitoring Account Performance daily.

* Optimising towards client goals (such as a revenue or ROI target). This will include tasks such as bid optimisation, campaign

budget optimisation, keyword & targeting optimisation and more.

* Refining and expanding PPC ad coverage (e.g. creating additional Ads, Keywords and Targeting as required).

* Managing to an agreed monthly PPC budget.

* Contributing to reports and account strategies with the Account Strategist (your line manager)

* Providing regular updates on the days actions and changes.

* Hosting regular calls to explain the work done, opportunities and key next steps within the PPC account.

* Use Amazon internal and third party tools to run competitor analysis, ranking changes and finding opportunities to grow revenue



Requirements:



* Excellent written and verbal English

* The ability to work closely to UK time zone (does not need to be exact)

* 1 year experience in PPC management roles.



Bonus:



*Knowledge of Pacvue a big plus

*Knowledge of running advertising on Mirakle channels such as B&Q, Tescos, Debenhams and eBay



About Us:



We are a 10-year old Amazon and Multi channel management services agency. We are UKL based, but have clients in the US and other regions of the world.



We communicate heavily on slack, and embrace a spirit of "act like an adult, be treated as one". This means we value work-life balance and focus on results. 



As a multi channel provider, you will be expect to learn eBay PPC, Debenhams PPC and various other channel PPC engines. However this will be taught.



This role demands a high degree of English written and spoken language skills - you will need to lead calls, present reports, and converse in English.



This is a focused role - your sole responsibilities with be PPC management. You will not preform other duties, however career and job advancement in other roles in our company is warmly welcomed over time.



We are awesome to work with - we're fun, supportive and kind. If you can manage Amazon PPC client accounts and relationships, leading reports and delivering consistent results to our playbook methodology and best practises, we want to hear from you. 



We can't train attitude or natural skills - you need to be good with talking to clients and communication, and you need to have a good spirit towards work and learning. If you lack some technical detail, that can be trained.

You will take full ownership of creative strategy across multiple brands, develop weekly angles, concepts, and briefs, write strategy-driven UGC and ad scripts, analyze ad performance, identify winners, and collaborate closely with editors, content creators, and media buyers to execute campaigns effectively.



What We’re Looking For

Candidates should have proven experience with supplement or DTC brands, a track record of running ads with $100K+ spend on Meta, creation of 200+ ad scripts, and experience leading a creative team. You must have real-world results in scaling brands and identifying winning angles. Fluent English is required, and German is a plus.

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Company:



INNELS is a Full-service Amazon Agency where we help European and US brands to sell on Amazon and launch on global markets. We are a fully remote agency.



We are urgently looking for a new Amazon PPC manager.



Responsibilities:



- Develop, implement, and manage Amazon Sponsored Products and Sponsored Display campaigns.

- Manage advertising for multiple clients and a wide range of products across both the US and European Amazon marketplaces.

- Conduct regular campaign optimizations to improve ACOS and TACOS, reduce wasted spend, and drive profitability.

- Take a holistic approach to PPC, ensuring that products are retail-ready before scaling traffic.

- Provide detailed, data-driven reports with both performance metrics and strategic insights.

- Stay up to date with Amazon advertising trends, algorithm updates, and best practices.

- Manage budgets effectively and forecast performance and spend across multiple accounts.



Requirements:



- Proven experience in managing Amazon PPC campaigns (Sponsored Products and Sponsored Display) - this is a must.

- Experience working with both European and US Amazon marketplaces.

- Strong understanding of Amazon as a platform, including listing optimization, keyword research, and conversion drivers.

- Ability to analyze product performance holistically and make strategic decisions based on data and product health.

- Skilled in generating comprehensive reports and providing clear performance overviews and insights.

- Experience managing multiple clients and product portfolios simultaneously.

- Proficient in tools such as Helium 10.

- Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to work independently and manage deadlines.



HOW TO APPLY:



1. Send us your resume and, if possible, a portfolio of brands you’ve worked with.

2. Share the categories you have worked in, the maximum number of SKUs you’ve managed at once, and the markets you’ve worked with. + let us know for how long you have been managing Amazon PPC.

3. Record a short video explaining briefly how you generally approach PPC.



We would like to start on hourly-based work where we test our collaboration, but then we switch to part
-time.

title: French Translator
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled French Translator to join our growing eLearning development team. This role is ideal for a detail-oriented linguist with a strong background in medical, healthcare, or compliance translation who can deliver accurate, culturally aligned content for French-speaking learners. If you are passionate about producing high-quality educational materials and enjoy working in a dynamic digital environment, we’d love to meet you.



Key Responsibilities

• Localize medical, dental, and regulatory terminology to ensure compliance with industry standards.

• Input, format, and organize translated text directly within Articulate Rise 360.

• Generate natural and accurate French audio narration using AI voice tools (e.g., ElevenLabs).

• Proofread, edit, and quality-check translated materials for clarity, consistency, and precision.

• Collaborate closely with the content development team to verify terminology and ensure alignment with compliance requirements.

• Maintain consistent glossaries, terminology databases, and style guides across all translated modules.

• Handle confidential and compliance-sensitive content with discretion and professionalism.

________________________________________



Qualifications

• Native or near-native proficiency in French, with excellent written and spoken communication skills.

• Strong fluency in English.

• Proven experience translating medical, healthcare, or regulatory/compliance-related content (required).

• Experience with eLearning tools especially Articulate Rise 360 is an advantage

• Familiarity with AI-based narration platforms (e.g., ElevenLabs) for generating French voiceovers.

• Exceptional attention to detail, accuracy, and linguistic consistency.

• Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

________________________________________



Other Details

• Schedule: 8 hours/day, Monday to Friday

• Days Off: Weekends

• Time Zone: Mountain Standard Time (MST)

• Employment Type: Full-time, Work From Home

• Start Date: ASAP

title: EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT
description:
StressKnotNYC is a premium in-home massage and recovery company serving New York City, New Jersey, and surrounding areas. We deliver high-quality, therapist-led wellness services directly to clients’ homes, hotels, and workplaces. We are growing and looking for a strong Operations Manager to help keep the business organized, responsive, and running smoothly.



Role Overview

The Operations Manager is responsible for handling daily fulfillment and making sure every client inquiry turns into a smooth, well-coordinated booking. When fulfillment is slow, this role shifts into growth-focused tasks like recruiting therapists, reactivating past clients, and reaching out to local businesses.



Key Responsibilities

Fulfillment (Primary Priority):

Answer calls, texts, and
s from clients in a timely, professional manner

Schedule and coordinate massage sessions

Match available therapists to incoming bookings

Send invoices and confirm appointments

Follow up with clients and therapists before and after sessions

Keep records organized (bookings, notes, updates)



Growth Support (During Slow Periods):

Recruit and communicate with licensed massage therapists

Reach out to past clients to encourage rebooking

Contact local businesses to introduce services and explore partnerships

Assist with basic outreach and follow-ups



Ideal Candidate

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Strong communicator with a professional, friendly tone

Able to multitask and stay calm under pressure

Takes initiative and stays productive without constant direction

Reliable and responsive



Experience Preferred

Operations, dispatch, or scheduling experience

Customer service or client coordination background

Experience working remotely



Please send in your introduction video of how you can help us scale.

Akasne Architects is a Melbourne-based residential architecture practice focused on climate-aware, performance-driven homes.



We design thoughtfully, document thoroughly, and operate with clarity and calm professionalism.



We are building a structured, high-quality studio system and are seeking a full-time Remote Studio & Content Coordinator to support daily operations and content production.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who values precision, reliability, and structured work.



Role Overview



You will become the operational backbone of the studio.



Your role is to ensure systems run smoothly, content is produced consistently, and administration is organised and proactive.



You will not make architectural decisions.

You will support coordination, production, and organisation.



Core Responsibilities

???? Studio Coordination & Scheduling



Manage and maintain calendar



Confirm meetings and send invites



Send reminders to clients and consultants



Track action items and deadlines



Prepare weekly priority overview



Send Friday weekly summary report



Project & Document Management



Organise and rename drawing files



Compile submission packages (PDF formatting)



Maintain project trackers



Follow up consultants for missing information



Upload documents to portals



Maintain structured folder systems



Update CRM / project management software



Financial & Admin Support



Issue invoices (template-based)



Track outstanding payments



Send payment reminders



Maintain revenue tracking spreadsheet



Prepare simple weekly financial summary



???? Content Production & Publishing



Edit 2–3 short-form videos per week



Add clean, minimal subtitles



Maintain professional editing style



Upload and schedule content



Organise media library



Provide simple analytics summary



Suggest clarity improvements to content structure



Editing style must be:



Calm and minimal



Professional (not influencer-style)



No flashy effects



No trend-chasing edits



Working Structure



Full-time position

Flexible hours

Some overlap with Australian Eastern Time (AEST) preferred

Long-term role with growth potential



Requirements



Strong written and spoken English



Excellent organisational skills



High attention to detail



Experience with:



Video editing (Premiere Pro, CapCut, etc.)



Google Drive / file management



Spreadsheets



Calendar management



Reliable high-speed internet



Professional communication style



Comfortable receiving structured feedback



Preferred (not required):



Experience working with architects or professional services



Familiarity with CRM or project management systems



Basic understanding of residential construction terminology



Important



To confirm you have read this listing carefully, please begin your application with the word:



Architect



Applications without this word will not be considered.



Application Instructions



Please include:



Examples of short-form videos you have edited



Description of previous administrative roles



What editing software you use



Your expected monthly salary



Your weekly availability



Screenshot of internet speed



Shortlisted applicants will complete a paid test task.



Compensation



Competitive full-time salary based on experience.

Long-term opportunity for the right person.



Kind regards,

Jarryd

Akasne Architects

title: NOC Engineer (Network Operations Center) – 24/7 Managed Services
description:
We are seeking a proactive NOC Engineer to join our global "Digital Shield" team. You will be the first line of defense, supervising network health, managing remote devices, and resolving any software-defined issues before they require a physical site visit. You will directly support our 2 NYC-based Field Engineers by triaging issues and providing them with precise "tactical briefs" when on-site intervention is required.



Key Responsibilities:

* 24/7 Monitoring: Provide continuous oversight of Juniper/Cisco hardware, BGP internet links, and wireless Access Points.

* Remote Triage: Resolve 90% of connectivity, Wi-Fi, and software issues remotely using our PSA and RMM toolsets.

* Smart Dispatch: Coordinate with our NYC-based Field Technicians for high-priority physical hardware failures.

* Provisioning: Utilize the Essensys platform to manage secure VLANs and tenant onboarding.

* Daily Health Sweeps: Perform automated diagnostics on conference room AV systems and report status to local leadership.

title: 7-Figure Video Editor for Ecommerce - Dropshipping
description:
Company Overview:

We are a skilled 7-Figure dropshipping team known for our high standards and exceptional results. Our success is built on a foundation of quality work, loyalty, and a relentless pursuit of excellence. We are looking for a talented Video Editor to join our dynamic team. If you possess the attitude, behavior, and skills of a 7-Figure employee, we want you on board. If not, please do not apply; we value our time and yours.



Position Overview:

As a Video Editor specializing in dropshipping, your primary responsibility will be translating videos from one language to another while maintaining the original intent, quality, and style. Additionally, you will create and edit picture ads, search for new scroll-stopping content, and develop compelling video creatives that drive bring insane ROAS!



Key Responsibilities:

Video Translation: Accurately translate provided videos from one language to another, ensuring the final product retains the original message and quality.

Creative Development: Create new video content for winning creatives that align with our high standards and brand voice.

Picture Ads: Design and edit high-quality picture ads that capture attention and drive engagement.

Scroll Stoppers: Proactively search for and identify potential scroll-stopping content that can be repurposed or reimagined into compelling videos.

Performance Tracking: Use TimeDoctor software to track your hours and performance. Adherence to time management and productivity is non-negotiable.

Feedback Integration: Regularly receive and implement feedback to continuously improve your work quality and efficiency.



Requirements:

Proven experience in video editing, specifically within the dropshipping or e-commerce industry.

Proficiency in video editing software (
, Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, etc.).

Strong understanding of what makes content engaging and effective in a dropshipping context.

Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

High attention to detail, ensuring every video and ad meets our 7-Figure standards.

Experience using TimeDoctor or similar time-tracking software.

Loyalty, reliability, and a strong work ethic.



What We Offer:

A challenging yet rewarding role within a successful 7-Figure dropshipping team.

Regular feedback to help you grow and excel in your role.

The opportunity to work with a team that values quality, innovation, and commitment.

If you believe you have what it takes to thrive in this environment and contribute to our ongoing success, we encourage you to apply. Only candidates who meet our high standards will be considered.



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate for this position. Include examples of your video editing work, particularly any relevant to dropshipping or e-commerce.



We look forward to seeing your best work!



Note: Applicants who do not meet the above criteria need not apply.

title: Virtual Administration Manager
description:
Volt Business Sales Administration Manager Job Description



Volt Business Sales (VBS) is a premium Australian business broking firm specialising in the sale of

mid-tier businesses across multiple industries. Our business is built on trust, confidentiality, efficiency,

and professional execution. We operate with a structured, process-driven approach, managing

confidential transactions that require precision, integrity, and exceptional documentation standards.



Position Overview

Volt Business Sales is seeking a highly skilled and trustworthy Virtual Administration Manager to manage and optimise our internal processes, systems, and confidential documentation environment. This role requires exceptional attention to detail, advanced Microsoft capability, strong English communication skills, and the ability to independently manage sensitive information within a structured deal environment.

  

The successful candidate will work remotely in the Australian Business Hours and must demonstrate high levels of self-management, discretion, and proactive communication.



Key Purpose of the Role

The Administration Manager is responsible for:

• Managing Volt’s internal systems and documentation processes

• Managing SharePoint data rooms and confidential document storage

• Supporting brokers and directors with deal execution workflows

• Maintaining structured, accurate, and compliant data management systems

• Ensuring professional and accurate document production across all client-facing materials



This role is critical to maintaining the operational integrity of Volt Business Sales.



Core Responsibilities



1. Process & Systems Management

    • Maintain and where appropriate, improve internal workflows and administrative systems

    • Manage document control processes across all business listings including

            o DocuSign

            o SharePoint

            o Aro

  • Ensure consistency in templates, branding, and file structures

  • Implement structured naming conventions and version control protocols

  • Monitor compliance with internal documentation standards



2. SharePoint & Data Room Management

    • Create and manage secure SharePoint data rooms for active transactions

    • Upload, structure, and categorise confidential documents

    • Assist with the access permissions for buyers, sellers, and advisors

    • Ensure confidentiality protocols are strictly adhered to

    • Link SharePoint folders accurately to Excel tracking registers

    • Maintain live due diligence indexes within SharePoint



3. Microsoft Office Expertise (Advanced)

    • Advanced Word document formatting (i.e structured templates, styles, tables, headers/footers)

    • Advanced Excel skills (i.e structured registers, data tracking)

    • Creation and maintenance of master due diligence indexes

    • Data linking between Excel and SharePoint



4. DocuSign Execution & Document Control

   • Prepare, issue, and manage DocuSign envelopes

   • Monitor execution status and ensure timely completion

   • Maintain executed document registers

   • Ensure correct sequencing of signatories

   • Maintain confidential storage of completed agreements



5. Data Development & Management

   • Build and maintain structured data registers

   • Ensure accuracy of financial, employment, asset, and compliance schedules

   • Cross-check data consistency across multiple sources

   • Support directors with reporting and internal dashboards

   • Maintain CRM accuracy



6. Confidential Document Handling

   • Manage highly sensitive financial and legal documents

   • Maintain strict confidentiality standards

   • Operate with discretion in all communications

   • Ensure all data access is appropriately controlled

7. Communication & Self-Management

   • Communicate clearly and professionally in written and spoken English

   • Provide regular status updates to Directors

   • Work independently with minimal supervision

   • Manage time effectively across multiple live transactions

   • Escalate issues promptly when required



Required Skills & Experience

1. Essential

    • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and SharePoint

    • Proven experience managing structured document environments

    • Experience using DocuSign at a professional level

    • Strong data development and management capability

    • Exceptional written and verbal English

    • High attention to detail and accuracy

    • Demonstrated experience working remotely

    • Strong self-discipline and accountability

   • Experience handling confidential documentation



2. Highly Desirable

   • Experience in legal, accounting, business brokerage, or M&A environments

   • Familiarity with due diligence processes

   • Experience managing secure virtual data rooms

   • Understanding of Australian business documentation standards



Personal Attributes

The ideal candidate will demonstrate:

   • Absolute integrity and discretion

   • Structured and systems-oriented thinking

   • Calm under pressure

   • Highly organised and methodical

   • Proactive and solution-focused

   • Strong follow-through and reliability

    • Professional communication at all times



Reporting Structure

This role reports directly to the Director of Volt Business Sales and works closely with the VBS team. Performance Measures

Success in this role will be measured by:

   • Accuracy of documentation

   • Efficiency of data room management

   • Timeliness of DocuSign execution

   • Quality of internal systems

   • Confidentiality adherence

   • Operational flow with the VBS team



Why This Role Is Important

Volt Business Sales manages transactions involving millions of dollars in confidential business sales.

The Administration Manager is central to ensuring that:

    • Buyers receive structured and accurate information in the required timeframes

    • All stakeholders experience professional process management

    • Deals move efficiently from enquiry through to settlement

title: Cold Caller Real Estate with content creation
description:
Cold Caller for STR Biz – Real Estate Growth Role

We’re a fast-scaling short-term rental (Airbnb/VRBO) management company looking for a confident, sharp cold caller/VA to help us grow in New England and beyond.



This is not your average VA gig—you’ll play a key role in helping us acquire properties, talk to real owners, and set appointments that drive our revenue. We’ll train you, support you, and reward you when you deliver.



What You’ll Do:

-Call property owners from our lead lists (STR & real estate leads)



-Pitch our Airbnb/VRBO management services with a natural tone (no script)



-Set up appointments or pass leads to our team for follow-up



-Track results in our Trello board or lead tracker



Bonus: You may help source leads later if you're capable



What We’re Looking For:

-Fluent English speaker (Mandatory)



-Confident on the phone – not afraid to take control of a conversation



-Able to follow a pitch and think on your feet (Be able to understand and use google maps, attractions and be able to connect with potential clients as if your local)



-Cold calling or real estate experience preferred



-Organized, reliable, and goal-driven



What You Get:

1-on-1 paid training to learn our pitch + offer



Call tracking tools and onboarding resources



Daily support + clear expectations



Bonuses for qualified appointments or successful deals



Opportunity to grow into a long-term leadership role as we expand



Compensation:

$3 to $5/hour to start plus bonuses



Performance bonuses



July–August pilot period with long-term potential if results are strong



To Apply:

Send a 1-minute voice recording introducing yourself and sharing:



Your cold calling or real estate experience



Why you’re the right person for this role



Your availability and internet speed - share how many calls you can make and also can you do basic marketing such as social media post for the company and/or create a flyer on canva on microsoft

*I will ask for a personality test to be taken if we d
 to move forward



*Also if your message to me is not tailored and seems like it is copied and pasted, I will ignore your message. I have received a dozen already and cancelled 10 applications due to it being copy and paste. This position must be your only position as well , not a second job during the same time frame. 



This is your chance to join a real U.S. real estate company, make an impact, and grow with us. We want closers, not order-takers. If that’s you—let’s talk.
