title: Executive Assistant - Real Estate
description:
About Us:

At Kressler Real Estate, we specialize in delivering a boutique, high-touch experience for homeowners and buyers across Central Florida. Our mission is to provide luxury-level service with integrity, care, and a touch of fun. We’re looking for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, people-focused environment and is passionate about keeping operations smooth and clients happy.



Position Overview:

We're seeking a highly organized, proactive Executive Assistant to support our real estate operations virtually. This role is perfect for someone who has experience in real estate transactions, marketing coordination, and client relationship management. You’ll play a critical role in supporting the daily activities of the lead agent and ensuring our clients feel cared for every step of the way.



Key Responsibilities:

Transaction Coordination:

• Manage contract-to-close process for buyer and seller transactions

• Schedule inspections, appraisals, walkthroughs, and closings

• Track transaction deadlines and ensure timely execution of documents

• Communicate with title companies, lenders, inspectors, and clients to keep all parties aligned

Marketing Support:

• Assist in planning, creating, and scheduling social media content

• Coordinate property listing materials (photography, video, signage, print materials)

• Update and maintain CRM with marketing campaigns and leads

• Help manage
 marketing campaigns and newsletters

Client Care:

• Serve as a first point of contact for client questions and updates

• Send personalized check-ins, cards, gifts, and follow-up messages to past and current clients

• Support client event planning and outreach initiatives

• Ensure every client touchpoint feels thoughtful, polished, and professional

Administrative Support:

• Manage calendars, schedule appointments, and handle
 correspondence

• Prepare presentations, reports, and market research summaries

• Assist with special projects and team initiatives as needed



Qualifications:

• 2+ years of experience as an executive assistant or in a real estate support role

• Strong knowledge of the real estate transaction process (experience with Florida real estate preferred)

• Experience with Follow Up Boss, MLS platforms, Dotloop, Asana, and Microsoft 365

• Tech-savvy: comfortable using CRM software, project management tools, Canva, and social media platforms

• Highly organized with strong attention to detail

• Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

• Friendly, proactive, and resourceful with a client-first attitude

• Ability to work independently and manage deadlines in a remote environment



Nice to Have:

• Passion for design, branding, or storytelling in marketing



Benefits:

• Work from anywhere – 100% remote

• Paid time off

• Bonus opportunities based on performance

• Opportunity to grow with a thriving and values-driven real estate team



How to apply: 

We’ve created our own unique application process—one that’s intentionally designed to find the right fit, not just someone blasting out resumes or sending canned
s. If you're genuinely interested in joining us and making an impact, we invite you to get started here:

==>

title: Relational Transaction Coordinator
description:
About the Role

This is a remote role for a highly organized and experienced Transaction Coordinator who will play a pivotal role in keeping our clients informed, our agents supported, and our transactions moving. While the primary focus is transaction management, this role will also include light marketing coordination and occasional showing scheduling.

We care deeply about our client experience. That means we’re not just checking boxes — we’re checking in, staying connected, and showing people we genuinely care. You’ll be a key player in making sure every client feels that from day one through closing.



Key Responsibilities

Transaction Coordination

* Coordinate contract-to-close process for both buyers and sellers

* Prepare and manage listing paperwork and MLS input

* Schedule inspections, appraisals, walkthroughs, and closings

* Track contract deadlines and ensure timely execution of documents

* Communicate regularly with title companies, lenders, inspectors, and clients

* Keep all parties aligned and informed

Marketing Support (Light)

* Assist in scheduling and posting listings and content to social media

* Maintain online presence for active listings

* Help coordinate occasional marketing campaigns or
 updates

Client Care

* Serve as the first point of contact for transaction-related updates and client check-ins



Qualifications

To be successful in this role, you’ll need to bring the following:

* 1+ year of U.S. real estate transaction coordination experience (minimum 50+ transactions closed)

* 2+ years in a real estate support or executive assistant role

* Strong understanding of the contract-to-close process for both buyers and sellers

* Experience with key platforms: Follow Up Boss, MLS, Dotloop, Asana, Microsoft 365

* Tech-savvy with tools like Canva, social media schedulers, and CRMs

* Exceptionally organized, with strong attention to detail and follow-through

* Professional written and verbal communication skills

* Friendly, reliable, resourceful, and self-motivated

* Ability to work independently in a remote setting and manage time effectively

* A heart for client service — you genuinely care about making people feel supported



Benefits

* 100% remote – Work from wherever you are most productive

* Paid time off – Because rest fuels great work

* Performance-based bonus opportunities

* A chance to grow with a boutique, values-driven real estate brand

* Meaningful work that supports clients through one of life’s biggest milestones

* A small, supportive team that cares deeply about relationships over transactions



How to Apply

We’ve created a unique application process — not just another resume drop. This helps us connect with the right people, not just the most available ones.

If you’re genuinely interested in joining a people-first real estate team and making an impact behind the scenes, start by applying here: 
 



We can’t wait to learn more about you and make you part of our loyal team. Let’s build something amazing together.

title: HighLevel (GHL) Technical Support & Reporting VA
description:
Full-Time | Long-Term | Growth Role | Remote



We are a fast-growing UK fitness franchise using GoHighLevel to run lead management, booking, messaging, and automations across 25+ locations.



We are looking for a technically strong Virtual Assistant who can own our GoHighLevel systems and reporting and support franchisees day to day.



This is not a generic VA role. You will be working inside live production systems that affect lead flow, bookings, and revenue across a real franchise network.



At Transform Hub, we care about people, and that extends to the people who work for us.



This is a chance to work alongside the Head of Tech and the CEO of a booming fitness franchise. You will learn about and get a chance to use emerging technology and use GHL for far more than a standard business or marketing agency.





Core Outcome



You are responsible for keeping our GoHighLevel systems and Google Sheets reporting accurate, live, and trusted across the entire franchise network.



If a franchisee or leader asks, “What’s happening with my leads and sales this week?”, we should be able to answer using dashboards and reports that you maintain.



This Is Not a Junior Role



We are not looking for someone who is still learning GoHighLevel.



You must already have hands-on experience managing live GoHighLevel accounts, diagnosing problems independently, and working in systems where mistakes affect real businesses.



Do not apply if:



- You have not used GoHighLevel in a live production environment

- You cannot work UK hours (9am–5pm GMT/BST), Monday to Friday

- You rely on snapshot cloning without understanding how the systems actually work

- You are uncomfortable troubleshooting problems you have not seen before



Hours & Setup



- Full-time: 40 hours per week



- UK hours: 9am–5pm GMT/BST, Monday to Friday



- Not an async role - you’ll work live alongside the UK team



- Daily 10-minute Zoom check-in



- Ongoing communication via Slack



What You Will Be Doing



Priority 0 – Reporting & Data Hygiene (Daily / Weekly)



This is the foundation of the role. You keep our numbers clean so decisions are based on reality, not guesses.



Examples:



Check that all key metrics are flowing correctly from GoHighLevel into Google Sheets / dashboards (leads, booked calls, show-ups, sales, cancels, churn).



Manually update or correct data when automations miss something (fixing stages, tags, sources, owners, etc.).



Run daily and weekly “sanity checks” to spot problems early (e.g. a site suddenly shows 0 leads today, pipeline totals look wrong, a formula is broken).



Maintain clear, documented definitions for every KPI so reporting is consistent across all locations.



Prepare simple weekly summary reports for leadership and franchisees.

Work with tools like 
 (we can train you) to keep reporting flows reliable.



Priority 1 – Franchisee Support & Troubleshooting (Daily)



You are the first point of contact when something breaks or looks wrong.



Real examples:

A franchisee reports that automated follow-up messages have stopped sending.

The AI booking bot is not adding appointments to the correct calendar.

Leads are receiving duplicate or overlapping automated messages even after staff have replied.

Booking confirmations are going out with the wrong location or coach name.

A workflow that was working last week has silently broken.



You will:



Check workflow execution logs and trigger conditions.

Reproduce the problem in a controlled way.

Find the root cause, not just describe the symptom.

Test your fix safely before pushing it live.



Priority 2 – Workflow & Automation Management (Regular)



Create and edit workflows and automations.

Manage pipelines, stages, and opportunity flows.

Build and maintain forms, surveys, calendars, and basic landing pages.

Set up and edit SMS,
, and WhatsApp templates.

Manage contacts and bulk actions carefully (no “oops, I messaged 10,000 people by mistake”).



Priority 3 – Account Setup & Systems (As Needed)



Set up new franchise sub-accounts from snapshots.

Manage snapshots and sub-account configurations.

Handle basic webhook setup inside GoHighLevel.

Liaise with GoHighLevel support when needed and follow through to resolution.



Tools You Will Use



GoHighLevel (core of the role – required)

Google Sheets (daily for reporting and checks)

Slack (team communication)

Canva (basic asset tweaks)

GHL calendars and booking systems

AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT) to speed up your work without reducing quality

Bonus: 
 and CloseBot experience



The Type of Person We Want



This matters more than your tool list.



Green Flags



- You check workflow execution history before asking what went wrong.

- You test a fix in a controlled way before pushing it live.

- You proactively flag issues you spot before anyone reports them.

- You explain why something broke, not just what you changed.

- You are comfortable saying, “I need to check this before I change anything.”

- You notice when numbers don’t look right in a report and go dig.



Red Flags



- You guess or change settings without understanding the impact.

- You say “done” without testing.

- You need to be told what to look at every time something breaks.

- You avoid taking ownership when something goes wrong.

- You are not available during UK working hours.



Experience Required



Proven experience using GoHighLevel in a live, production environment.

Experience supporting multiple accounts or locations is strongly preferred.

Strong Google Sheets skills (lookups, filters, pivots, error checking).

Comfortable learning new tools and adapting to evolving systems.

Detail-oriented, reliable, and calm when things break.

Strong written English – you will communicate directly with franchisees (business owners, not tech people).



Compensation



$1,200–$1,500 USD per month, depending on experience

Performance-based increases

Long-term role with room to grow for the right person



Hiring Process & How To Apply



Written Application

In your application, please include:





- A short summary of your GoHighLevel experience (what you actually did, not just “used it”).

- A link to a Google Sheet dashboard or report you have built or maintained. Briefly explain how you kept the data accurate (3–5 sentences).

- A short description of a time when the numbers in a report didn’t make sense. How did you find the root cause and fix it?

- Short Loom Video (2–3 minutes)





Introduce yourself.



Walk through the Google Sheet/report you shared and explain how you use it.



Tell us about the most complex GoHighLevel problem you have fixed.



We will then proceed to a 1-on-1 Interview with shortlisted candidates.





Afterwards, we will make a final decision.





If you want a fun role where your technical brain, attention to detail, and calm problem-solving directly impact dozens of real businesses every day, we’d like to see your application.

title: VIRTUAL CSR
description:
We are hiring reliable CSRs to join the growing team of The Comfort Authority company!



THE COMPANY:



The Comfort Authority is a top-rated Heating, Ventilating & Air Conditioning Company in Tampa Bay in Florida, USA. You can learn more about them here: 
/



ROLE DESCRIPTION:



A typical day for a Call Center Representative is primarily to perform the work to book appointments to fill the call board with the required number of appointments. This involves making a high volume of outbound calls to existing customers to book appointments as well as taking and booking inbound calls. Other lead sources such as Podium, Yelp, etc. are other places the CSR will look to for customer requests for service. 



Additional tasks such as addressing customer questions and concerns, assisting upset customers and handling administrative tasks such as looking up warranty information and/or communicating with management to resolve issues will also be required. The CSR will track their time via a spreadsheet and time will be monitored by the Call Center Manager.



The First CSR to arrive will go through the after-hours calls from all lead sources. The CSRs will help the call center department meet its goals by handling daily inbound and outbound calls, managing leads and booking service appointments for our customers via phone, chat, or
.



Throughout the day, the main priority of the CSR is to fill the call board. This is done through both outbounding to our existing customer base and receiving inbound calls from both existing and new customers. There is no limit to how many appointments can be booked in a day and only the Call Center Manager will let you know what days we are booking appointments for. The only communication outside the Call Center should be to let Dispatch know a call has been booked. 



This position is repetitive and can be challenging to continue to perform at a high level. Performing at a high level is critical as this is the most important position in the company to keeping the business running. 

A critical part of this job is dealing with customers that are upset. The customer’s anger level is likely to be elevated, and this is something the CSR will have to work with. Customers will even call in yelling at the CSR and the CSRs need to know that it is not personal, and the CSR will need to be able to handle this and continue to perform at a high level.



The CSR will track and enter information from customer into our software, ServiceTitan. They must become fluent using this program for looking up and entering customer information, as well as notes from field personnel the customer may be calling in for.



The position is competitive in nature. Compensation will be hourly with some performance-based compensation. They must achieve 20 outbound calls per hour. 5-10% of people we speak with that we outbound should be booked. If these numbers are not hit, the business will not have the calls they need to keep everyone working and feeding their families.



We are looking to hire CSRs to start full-time immediately, working in the EST time zone.



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND TRAITS:



• Previous customer service, particularly call center based, preferred, but we will be happy to train the right candidate – we hire for personality over experience.

• Great phone voice. Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral.

• Proficient in computer applications; experience with ServiceTitan is a plus!

• Dependable and self-driven, with a strong sense of initiative.

• Superior attention to detail, organized, eager to work, coachable, and motivated.

• Exceptional customer service skills, always aiming to deliver top-notch satisfaction and work well within a team.



WHAT WE OFFER:



• Salary $5/hr and overtime pay (paid via Wise)

• Paid training

• Vacation or sick leave entitlement

• Paid Holidays

• A family. This is last on the list because it’s most important. We care about our team and expect you to bring that same caring when you join. We do a lot more than just work together and you’ll build life-long friendships here.



If you think you are the one we are looking for, please respond to this job post with your quick video introduction (no more than 2 minutes) and answer this survey: 
. This will take you about 5-10 minutes to complete, but take your time and be thorough. Please confirm in your response that you have successfully completed the survey.

title: Graphic Designer & Reel Editor
description:
About Finalytics 
 on Instagram)

We provide startups and scaling companies with CFO-led finance teams, modern tools, and operational discipline at a fraction of traditional costs. We're transforming finance from a bottleneck into a growth enabler.

The Role

We're looking for a creative, social-media-savvy designer and video editor to bring our finance content to life. You'll be the visual voice behind our brand on Instagram, LinkedIn, and beyond - turning complex finance concepts into scroll-stopping content that educates and converts.

This is a part-time, remote-flexible position (15-20 hours/week) perfect for someone who wants creative freedom, values impact over busywork, and thrives in a fast-moving startup environment.

Content Creation (70%)

Data-informed but creatively bold

Required Qualifications

title: SEO Specialist (Individual Contributor) — ASAP Hire (Remote)
description:
SEO Specialist (Individual Contributor) — ASAP Hire (Remote)

We’re hiring an experienced, highly analytical SEO Specialist to own end-to-end SEO across three brands: Maker’s Row, 
, and TailoredTeams. This is an ASAP hire and we’re moving quickly.



Role Summary

You will independently lead and execute the full SEO function—strategy through implementation—covering technical SEO, on-page SEO, off-page/link building, content SEO, and reporting. This is a hands-on, execution-heavy role for someone who can also think strategically and build a long-term roadmap.



What You’ll Own (Core Outcomes)

Grow organic traffic, keyword rankings, and qualified conversions

Improve site health, crawlability/indexation, and Core Web Vitals

Build domain authority/backlink quality

Deliver clear dashboards, reporting, insights, and next-step plans

Key Responsibilities

Own the SEO roadmap across all three brands (planning + execution).

Manage the full SEO lifecycle: keyword research ? technical audits/fixes ? on-page optimization ? link-building ? reporting.

Build strategies aligned to each business, including KPIs, timelines, content clusters, and traffic goals.

Identify new growth opportunities and present structured, prioritized plans.

Conduct full-funnel keyword research across multiple ICPs; build topic maps and pillar-cluster frameworks.

Execute on-page SEO: metadata, headers, schema, alt text, internal linking, and content optimization aligned with semantic search and E-E-A-T.

Run technical SEO audits and drive fixes across: crawlability, indexation, site speed, CWV, redirects, canonicals, structured data, and site architecture—partnering with engineering/design for implementation and validation.

Create SEO-driven content briefs, optimize existing content, and guide content direction based on search opportunity.

Execute off-page SEO: link-building campaigns, high-authority placements (guest posts/PR), monitor DA/DR and link quality, manage disavows when needed.

Build and maintain reporting in GA4, GSC, Sheets/Looker Studio, delivering weekly/monthly/quarterly insights and actions.

Requirements

Experience



5+ years of hands-on SEO execution (not just strategy)

Preferred background: SaaS, marketplaces, job platforms, or B2B services

Demonstrated results improving rankings and organic growth

Skills



Technical SEO, on-page optimization, schema/structured data

Keyword clustering, topic mapping, content SEO

Link-building strategy and execution

Core Web Vitals and performance optimization

Strong project ownership and cross-functional execution (engineering/design/content)

Tools



Ahrefs and/or SEMrush

Screaming Frog and/or Sitebulb

Google Search Console, GA4, Google Tag Manager

Looker Studio (nice to have: SurferSEO)

Who This Role Is For

You’re an independent operator who can run SEO end-to-end.

You’re comfortable being hands-on daily (audits, fixes, briefs, links, reporting).

You can communicate clearly with stakeholders and provide actionable insights.



Application - 

To apply, please complete the application form and include the following:



Intro video link (1–2 minutes): who you are + why you’re a great fit (strong spoken English preferred)

Portfolio link

Resume/CV with an active phone number (we may call during EST hours if shortlisted)

If your experience matches what we’re looking for, our recruitment team will contact you.

title: Location acquisition specialist
description:
About the Role



We are a U.S.-based national pipeline of business owners, rapidly expanding. You are to secure locations for vending machine placement or equipment of similar nature.



This is NOT a typical VA job. This is a unique opportunity to expand personal and professional growth within a company.



This is NOT appointment setting.



Your responsibility is to contact business owners, present our vending placement program, overcome objections, and secure a signed agreement allowing placement of a vending machine at their location.



The job is complete only when the agreement is signed.



This is outbound closing.



If you are not comfortable closing deals directly with business owners, this role is not for you.



What You Will Be Doing

Cold call business owners and decision makers

Clearly explain our vending placement offer

Handle objections confidently in real time

Utilize softwares such as Docusign

Follow up consistently until agreement is signed

Log call activity and notes accurately

Submit signed agreements as proof of completion



Success = Signed Agreement

 “Interested” is not success

“Call me later” is not success



Compensation Structure (Commission-Only Trial)

This position begins with a 14-Day Performance Trial.

60 hour limit for the 14 days

$2/hour PLUS You are paid $50 per signed vending location agreement.



The trial is considered successfully completed once 3 signed agreements are secured within the 14-day period.

Performance determines income.



Trial Expectations

During the 14-day trial, you are expected to:

Make high outbound call volume.

Speak directly with decision makers.

Overcome objections professionally.

Follow up persistently.

Secure a minimum of 3 signed agreements.



14-day test passers WILL obtain:

Personal growth opportunities

Long-term commission structure

Hourly wage review

Higher per-deal payouts

A 'gold standard' commission of $350 per 'gold standard' location. (A hard to acquire/employee-heavy/foot-traffic heavy location)

Potential leadership role as team grows



We are building a serious outbound closing team.



You Are a Strong Fit If You:

Have closed sales before

Thrive in commission-based roles

Are confident speaking with U.S. business owners

Understand that follow-up closes deals

Are disciplined and self-motivated



Bonus Experience

Real estate cold calling

Merchant services

Solar / insurance sales

B2B contract sales

Commission-only roles



Requirements

Excellent spoken English

Stable internet connection

Quiet workspace

Ability to work U.S. business hours



Comfortable with:

Google Sheets

CRM tools

DocuSign or similar e-signature platforms



Application Process



Shortlisted candidates will:

Join an interview outlining the company goals, processes, and training.

Perform the 14-day trial test.

Perform a roleplay call on the interview.



Only serious closers should apply.



Thank you for your time and attention.

-Lorenzo

As we continue to expand our reach, we’re seeking a skilled and driven Social Media Manager to lead our social media efforts and enhance our brand presence across digital platforms.



About the Role

As our Social Media Manager, you will own and execute our social media strategy across key platforms 
, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and others). Your mission will be to grow our audience, increase engagement, support product launches, and build a strong, consistent brand voice. You’ll collaborate closely with product, design, and content teams to translate product value into engaging narratives that resonate with our target audience.



Key Responsibilities



- Drive some AI-driven and human-created content



- Develop, execute, and optimize a data-driven social media strategy aligned with business goals



- Plan and publish content calendars across all platforms



- Collaborate with design and content teams to produce compelling posts, stories, reels, and videos



- Monitor trends, user behavior, and platform updates to stay ahead of the curve



- Manage community engagement, responding to comments and DMs, and nurturing brand trust



- Track, analyze, and report performance metrics, turning insights into action



- Coordinate with product and marketing teams to support launches, updates, and campaigns



- Identify and work with influencers or creators to grow reach and credibility



- Ensure brand voice, tone, and visuals are consistent across all channels



Requirements

- 2–5 years of experience in social media management, ideally in a Beauty industry



- Proven track record of growing and managing social media channels



- Strong understanding of short-form video, platform algorithms, and engagement tactics



- Excellent writing, editing, and communication skills



- Creative eye for visual storytelling and brand presentation



- Proficiency in using analytics and scheduling tools



- Familiarity with AI products or interest in emerging technologies is a plus



- Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects



What We Offer

- A collaborative, creative, and fast-paced environment



- Flexibility in working hours



- Opportunities to grow with a product at the forefront of AI innovation



- Direct impact on product narrative, community building, and user experience



- Competitive salary and benefits



To Apply

Send your resume, a brief cover letter, and links to social media accounts or campaigns you’ve managed. We look forward to seeing your work and hearing how you can bring our brand to life online.

title: Workforce Analyst (Remote)
description:
Workforce Analyst (Remote)



About the Role

We’re looking for a Workforce Analyst to help turn large volumes of workforce, scheduling, and operations data into clear, actionable insights. This role will own the process of gathering data from multiple systems, cleaning and combining it, and building automated dashboards and reports in Power BI and Excel to support decision-making across the organization.



You’ll work closely with leadership, central scheduling, and operations teams to identify trends, improve labor efficiency, and support data-driven management of staffing operations.



?



Key Responsibilities

 • Collect, clean, and consolidate data from multiple systems (HRIS, timekeeping, scheduling, agency, and productivity tools).

 • Build, maintain, and automate Power BI dashboards and Excel reports for workforce metrics (e.g., HPPD, utilization, coverage, call-outs, agency usage, etc.).

 • Create and maintain data models, charts, and visualizations that clearly tell a story.

 • Develop and document standard reporting templates and refresh processes.

 • Identify and correct inconsistencies between data sources.

 • Support ad-hoc data analysis requests from leadership.

 • (Preferred) Work with APIs, data connectors, and Power Automate/Power Query to automate data pulls directly from systems.



?



Qualifications

 • 2+ years of experience as a Workforce Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role.

 • Advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, Power Query, macros preferred).

 • Strong Power BI experience (DAX, data modeling, interactive dashboards).

 • Solid understanding of data integrity, cleaning, and normalization.

 • Experience combining data from multiple systems/sources.

 • Excellent attention to detail and analytical thinking.

 • (Preferred) Experience with APIs, Power Automate, Google Sheets, or other data connectors.

 • (Preferred) Experience with workforce management, scheduling, or HR data.

 • Strong communication skills in English.



?



What We Offer

 • Full-time remote position based in the Philippines.

 • Competitive compensation based on experience.

 • Work with an international operations and analytics team.

 • Growth opportunities into data engineering, automation, or operations leadership roles.

title: Schedule manager for Nursing homes (central scheduler)
description:
Central Scheduler (Healthcare) — Work From Home

Location: Remote — Philippines

Job Type: Full-Time (12-hour shifts, 4 days per week)

Must have long-term care / Nursing home experience



About the Role

We’re looking for a detail-oriented and compassionate Central Scheduler to join our growing healthcare support team. In this role, you’ll play a key part in keeping our partner facilities well-staffed and organized by coordinating shift schedules and supporting our clinicians with any last-minute changes.

If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have excellent communication skills, and enjoy helping people, this could be the perfect role for you.



What You’ll Do

Handle daily scheduling requests for multiple healthcare facilities in the U.S.

Coordinate directly with nurses, clinicians, and facility managers to confirm shifts and resolve conflicts quickly.

Keep schedules accurate and up to date to maintain compliance and prevent staffing gaps or overages.

Answer calls, respond to urgent scheduling changes, and provide support with empathy and professionalism.

Use Microsoft Excel and scheduling software to manage and track shift assignments in real time.

Collaborate with fellow schedulers to deliver smooth, reliable service to our clinical teams.



What We’re Looking For

Required Skills & Experience:

At least one year of call center/BPO experience, preferably handling U.S. accounts.

Familiarity with Microsoft Excel (comfortable with basic functions and updating spreadsheets).

Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

Strong attention to detail and accuracy — must be able to manage multiple schedules correctly.

Good time management and the ability to work under pressure in a high-volume environment.

Professional, calm, and empathetic attitude when assisting clinicians and staff.

Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace at home.



Nice to Have (but not required):

Previous experience in healthcare staffing, healthcare scheduling, or nurse line support.

Knowledge of U.S. time zones and healthcare shift patterns.



Why You’ll Love Working With Us

Permanent work-from-home setup — no daily commute required.

Supportive and collaborative team culture.

Opportunities to grow your skills and build a career in a meaningful healthcare support role.

Be part of a company that values your contribution and well-being.





Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly value diversity. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, or any other protected status.
